description:
Had lunch with Gino with Arthur on a Friday when it was Fleet Week.

- 

We all got Nick's Way:

One taco w/ a crispy corn tortilla wrapped in a soft tortilla w/ Monterey jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo & guacamole.

I got the one carne asada & one carnitas.

^ I hated the carne asada and I love carne asada, but aside from that the tacos were really good and I highly recommend the carnitas.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Came here with a group during a conference and was pretty underwhelmed. I ordered a vegetarian burrito. It was OK (pretty hard to mess up a veggie burrito) but definitely rates in lower 50% in terms of burritos I've met. Perhaps the high ratings this place gets is primarily for their more unusual items, like their shrimp tacos, but there weren't any exciting vegetarian options.  

Long line to order, then another long wait, some 20 minutes, all for a simple veggie burrito. Plus the prices are very high for Mexican food, even within SF, and the service, lukewarm at best. The place has been called "upscale," but I just don't see it.  I mean they have wood plank tables and benches, c'mon.
author: Andrew W.

description:
My go-to place for great tacos- I always get mine "Nick's way", which involves a second layer of tortilla and cheese.

They do a great job of handling the many customers rest enjoy this neighborhood gem. The food is consistently great, and the staff does their utmost to accommodate the service side of the restaurant.
author: Scott N.

description: I live so close but haven't been here in years! How did I manage to miss it??? These tacos are exactly what you want on any taco night - go the nick's way and you won't be disappointed! It's the perfect mix of soft tortillas in the hard shell with so many fillings! Check it out
author: Ruchi M.

description:
I'm surprised I haven't been here earlier given how close I live, but I finally came here for the first time with a friend for dinner a few weeks ago.

I think the food is good, but not great. My favorite was the shrimp and side of rice. The guacamole was average and the sangria wasn't anything special unfortunately.

I do appreciate the service through. I had an issue with my guacamole and the staff were quick to remedy the situation and were very apologetic about it. 

Still debating whether I will come back for a second try because the place is rated decently high, but I felt like it fell short with my recent visit.
author: Gita r.

description:
After being in Europe for the past month, I wanted a good Mexican fix yesterday.  As good as food is in Holland, Spain, Morocco and Portugal, we have them all beat hands down, when it comes to Mexican food.  

I've been here on numerous occasions, specifically for the Nicks' Way tacos (steak) and burritos.  The Nicks' Way tacos are unique in that they use both a soft tortilla as well as a crispy tortilla in a single taco, so I like the variation in texture.  However, it's something like $5.00 for a taco that I can consume in less than 5 minutes.  Nothing special about their burritos.  

I do really like their green salsa, though, which I use in such voluminous amounts that it would probably easier for me to get it through an intravenous infusion!  It's delicious on any of their items you put it on.

Their chips have really improved recently.  Previously, they served super hard tortilla chips that were usually brown from over frying.  Or Lord forbid, they double fried day old chips.  Who knows. Instead, now, they have chips that are perfectly firm and never seem to be over fried.  However, why aren't the chips complimentary?  They're not! Come on, just give your customers a good couple of handfuls if they're purchasing an item, whether they enjoy it on the premises or as take out.  That's plain stingy for the overinflated prices they are already charging.  

Also, be ready to wait an extraordinary long time if you're getting take out when they're busy.  I've waited for 20 minutes for one burrito at noon, and nearly missed an appointment.  I had no idea the wait time for a take out burrito would be anywhere near that long.  Staff is also indifferent, and not at all friendly.   

Tacko is definitely a popular, but a trendy Americanized "taqueria".  The vibe is fun and lively, especially at the peak of lunch or in the heart of dinner.  However,  you'll pay nearly twice as much as you would at a place in the Mission, and get decent, but unauthentic Mexican food. Shouldn't be surprising.  After all, how many authentic Mexican restaurants have prints of upscale, exclusive Nantucket covering their walls? I can tell you, the answer to that is none!

Personally, for food, especially take out, I prefer the significantly less trendy, but more authentic taqueria, Los Hermanos, about a 5 minute walk away on Chestnut Street, in the Marina.  Los Hermanos also provides better value and has a rare 100 out of 100 S.F. health rating.  It's fine for what it is, but opt for somewhere else, other than Nick's, if you're in search of real authentic Mexican food, in an authentic Mexican setting.
author: Lori N.

description:
Yes Yes Yes
One of the best Barreto spots in SF 
Thank you for putting LOVE  in to your food.
author: Niza Lideo ..

description:
This is a decent Mexican restaurant with quick service. We ordered the chicken tacos nick's way and the taco salad. The tacos were good -nick's way made them even better. The guacamole is very tasty. For the salad, I'd recommend adding a protein (there are several options, we added shrimp), otherwise it's not too filling. Overall, the salad was pretty average. 

Overall, a good spot for a quick and casual lunch. Snag a seat outside or by the window if it's not too busy to enjoy people watching on Fillmore.
author: Nicole D.

description:
What a great find in the Marina for fast casual!

The chips and salsa with guacamole was so good they use the real chips and not Tostitos! 

The tacos nicks way is also unique with cheese in between a soft corn tortilla and hard shell taco. Above all they were LOADED with carnitas and guac Pico de Gallo etc.

The bet was the California burrito with carbs asada as that was a grilled burrito goodness with guac cheese fries and carne asada.
author: Casie N.

description:
We wandered around our hotel to find something for dinner. On a Friday night, our options were a little more limited unless we wanted to wait 45 minutes. We turned down a random street and found this gem! It wasn't too crowded, and the service was fairly quick for how many people were in there. We tried the San Diego and San Francisco burritos. I must first say that I LOVE that they offer a burrito with no beans and rice! That filler is not for me (hubby loves rice & beans, so he was happy too!). 
The guacamole is great! Very fresh, creamy, maybe a hint of lime, and onions. Super yum! My burrito was a little wetter than I anticipated and fell apart. Hubby loved his, but wished for a dollop more sour cream. 

The noise level was intense - we couldn't talk to each other across the table. It's very quaint, the restaurant is clean, and the staff are super friendly! If they opened a Tacko's in Vegas, we would frequent it to try the lobster roll, quesadilla & corn & bean salad!
author: Tiffanie E.

description:
I'm obsessed with Tacko! They have the most delicious salad, soups and tacos. I like how you can order at the counter but there is plenty of good seating and some nice outdoor tables. They are my go to take out spot and a fun place to have a relaxed meal if you don't want to bother with table service. 

The best deal on the menu is the cheese quesadilla for under $5...a good add on to your order. I recommend the soup if you aren't feeling well....always does the trick!
author: Lady N.

description:
The food is really good! Great Cali-Mexican fusion. I would give the food 4 or even 4.5 stars. For those who don't know, Nick's Crispy Tacos (Polk and Broadway) is basically the same food & menu. 

So why the three stars? You'll have to read between the lines: the extreme effort put forth to make this place look like a Nantucket beach house opposed to a Mexican restaurant has to raise a brow. Why the random 'k' in Tacko? Maybe I'm missing something. This kind of curated branding makes me wonder what this business is trying to avoid and what they are trying to promote.
author: D L.

description:
Love this place !!
Great street tacos , nicks two way , yum & tasty burritos.
Tortilla soup also , meal in the one bowl , so good .
Never had the lobster roll , have to try that next .
Salsa and guacamole / chips , huge portion and so fresh .
Always friendly service , great beers & love , love the complimentary filtered water .
New chocolate shop directly across the street , nice way to end a good meal .
Busy on week ends , but they serve so efficiently that it's not a drag .
Check it out , clean , healthy , tasty !!!
author: Ellie O.

description: Ordered the carne asada (Kobe beef), vegetarian, and Baja fish tacos, all Nick's Way (with a crispy corn tortilla inside the flour tortilla. Jack cheese and guacamole).  Comes with Spanish rice, some salsa and chips.  Only got through two tacos for lunch - these are huge (about $7 apiece).  Tasty, filling. Next time will get without red onion, cilantro and beans.
author: Vivian W.

description:
One of my favorite places for a zero hustle cal-mex fix in Cow Hollow neighborhood. I am a vegetarian and they have great selection to choose from. Something that is not very obvious on the menu is a burrito bowl, and to top it all you can add fries for a more hearty meal!

If you like things on the spicy and tangy side of the spectrum, there is a wide selection of hot sauces to choose from (not your neighborhood grocery store kind).

They have very distinct flavors of agua fresca but you also can't go wrong with the house margarita or sangria if you want something with higher than zero ABV!
author: Nidhi M.

description:
Very surprised by Tacko -- excellent Cali-Mex food. I'd say Mexi-Cal, but it's not, it's strongly Californian.
I live near Nick's Crispy Taco's and have tried them  a couple of times. They're fine. I think the best part of Nick's is that they're in a bar. Full disclosure: never got taco's Nick's Way -- but I'm more of a quesadilla gal or a burrito gal. 
So, anyway, when Caviar had a no fee delivery promotion, I decided to try Tacko. 

So glad I did! I got the carne asada (Kobe beef -- yes! It rises above) and the Elote (amazingly delicious with the lime crema!) and the Skinny Guacamole (no chips, but cucumber, jicama, radish, & carrots. -- skip the carrots), I was surprised. 

Why, you may ask.

Well, because the quesadilla was cooked on the grill, with plenty of cheese on the tortilla, making it perfectly crispy, browned to perfection. That's how I want all my burritos to be! But I keep getting steamed ugh ugh. The amount of meat they put into the quesadilla was insane! Delicious!

The Elote was such a great corn on the cob. I've lived in Iowa and we pride ourselves on the best corn in the world -- so I know corn. This cob was sweet, easy to eat, delicious and with just the right amount of crema, cojita and cayenne to make it perfect.

Finally, the Skinny Guacamole was surprising. I love all the veggies in the mix -- the only thing: the large rounds of carrots were a little less crisp than the cake, jicama & radish. Next time, I'll probably skip the carrot. And you can -- you can customize your order to what you like.

All in all, 5 stars!
author: Yasi S.

description: In my opinion this lace has the best Mexican fast food in the city the service is really fast and the food is delicious. I usually get the SF burrito and it's pretty good and the sauces the have on the side is like no other.
author: Adam L.

description: I like this place, it's a bit of a drive to get to but the food is good. Street parking can be a bit difficult to find and the line tends to get long. If you're planning to dine in, have someone order the food and the other stand in line to buy it. My cousin and her family were fortunate to be able to find a table to sit the five of us. It gets packed and busy in waves, but for the most part, it's busy and on the expensive end. I ordered 3 street tacos for $7 but they were super mini tacos. I was a little upset with the portion I received because at any other local taco spot I could get BIGGER TACOS for that price. I was left hungry and munched on the chips we ordered and I also ate my nieces chicken quesadilla. The chicken quesadilla was more expensive, but it was bigger and more filling than my order. We also had an order of elote corns. Water is self-serve, but unlike any other spot, you have an option for sparkling water. The table set up has some sauces and some utensils, but you can grab additional utensils on the side where you pick up food and get water. If you wish to take your leftovers to go you can go by the front door where you put dishes away and there are brown bags and foil that you can use to place your food in. There's only one bathroom and that's a downfall because there can be a long line for it. I would come back here to order their chicken quesadilla this time, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it as well. I would only come back here if I am already in the area. If you live near this location I would recommend you to give it a try, but be prepared to wait longer than your typical taqueria.
author: Danika P.

description:
It was my first meal in the Bay Area and my friends asked me what I was in the mood for. "San Francisco food" I told them. They brought me here and I'm glad they did! This place is pretty chill - no frills, just great food! I got the Mexican "Street Style" tacos and loved all three. I really appreciated how simple they were - carne asada, carnitas, and chicken topped with cilantro and onions. Just a few great ingredients and they were good to go. The meat on all three of the tacos was super tender and the toppings were fresh. I tried their green salsa on the carnitas and it paired really well. I also got the mango Homemade Agua Fresca and it was so refreshing and delicious! 
A great place to go for some great tacos!
author: Alyx V.

description:
Omg my first time
Here.. and had bad experience.. great menu.. but cashier guy seems slow.. got my order but my drinks won't in the bag.. I had to walk back 2
Blocks to get my soda.. n wasn't cold n only in bottles.. if I knew I wouldn't of ordered.. I won't be coming back..
author: Crisy G.

description:
Just crazy good Mexican. Nick's Way tacos are just stupidly good. We are in town for just a week and my wife insisted that we come back here again. They are THAT good.

Everything else that we had was also super tasty.
author: Tom P.

description:
This place crushed it with their California burrito! Loved how the carne asada meat wasn't greasy. In fact, it was dry. But there was so much going on in this wrapped piece of heaven, so it was actually preferable to me if the meat wasn't the center of my taste bud attention. 
The salsas in a squirt bottle on the table = excellent idea! The green was mild, and the red was medium  
Overall, great vibe! Service was fast and there was ample space to move around between tables. Not too noisy.
author: Hannah J.

description:
Tacko is one of my favorite casual spots in the Marina. Actually, San Francisco can be very small. My mom met the owner on her plane ride from Nicaragua to San Francisco. She raved so much about him and his restaurant that every time she's in town, she always wants to go to Tacko. Service is a tad slow and prices are a little high, but the food makes up for that and always consistently good. Try one of these (or all) and you can't go wrong: 

Watermelon or Mango Agua Fresca 
Carne Asada Taco (Nicks Way)
Carnitas Taco (Nicks Way) 
California Burrito
Sopa de Tortilla 
Elote
author: Stephanie M.

description: My favorite joint (fast food taco spot) in SF. The employees are efficient and tacos taste great. I mean what else do you expect? I even met a cute girl there. Forgot to get her number though. Gotta post one of them craigslist ads. oh well, Poetic justice.
author: Kay Z.

description: Had the taco trio. Cool neighborhood, outdoor seating. The Tacos were exactly what i was looking for. They could use some spicier salsa, but thats not a complaint.
author: Daniel H.

description: not to bad tacos, especially when looking for something fast to eat. ordered fish tacos (grilled fish) which tasted really well
author: Lucas K.

description: Me and my buddy came here just to try something different, and we were blown away!!! This place is awesome great atmosphere with amazing food! The portions are unreal the burrito is like 1lb or over that and the carne Asada quesadilla is crazy good. If your in the marina area stop by here you won't regret it.
author: Anthony V.

description:
Tacko is quickly becoming one of my favorite places for a quick bite in cow hollow.  Although prices are a little high, the quality of ingredients is equally high, from the chicken (all shredded breast meat and not dry at all) to the beef and carnitas.  

Although some of the recipes / menu items seem suspiciously similar to La Taqueria in the Mission (my favorite  burrito / taco spot in SF), I really don't care since La Taqueria is on the other side of the city.  For those of you a little health conscious, the salad is phenomenal, and is actually filling.  

The award for most disappointing menu items goes to the lobster roll, which was not only small, but also filled with rubbery over-cooked lobster and very bland.  If they're going to style this place after Nantucket, the least they could do is offer a halfway decent New England style lobster roll.

Overall, I really like this spot.  The food is good, fresh, and consistent, and the menu is not terribly overpriced for SF.  My only caveat is that this spot gets busy during dinner time and if you're planning to take food to go, be sure to call ahead, otherwise you may be waiting for 10-20 minutes.
author: Tom G.

description:
This has been my new favorite place to get a burrito! It used to be La Taqueria on Mission, but cash only is a major turn off! I'm not into having cash in my wallet since I got my wallet stolen in 9th grade with all my birthday money in it, but that's another story and I don't want to bore you with my problems as an adolescent.

Anyway... Back to bragging about Tacko! My husband and I spent all day hanging out at Crissy Fields beach with our dog Peanut! Peanut is a service animal. He helps me with my anxiety. Since we were at the beach, we didn't think about bringing her service vest or her service ID card. We got a little hungry on the beach and we didn't want to eat the boring granola we brought.  We saw two guys eating a burrito! My husband asked where they got the burrito from. Of course they said Tacko. This place was a 20 minute walk from where we were. We started walking. When we were close to the restaurant, I realized we didn't have Peanuts service vest or card with us. But when we got there they welcomed Peanut with open arms and let her in the restaurant! 

When we ordered I couldn't decide on a California burrito, San Francisco burrito, a Nicks Way Taco. I couldn't decide! I ended up with a San Francisco burrito. It was Mission style burrito with carnitas! OMG!! I ate that whole burrito in less than 5 minutes! It was juicy, tender, savory. I had an orgasm in my mouth! I loved it!!  

It's been a week since we ate there and I swear I've been talking about it to everyone I encountered! I think I might go there today!!
author: Darlene M.

description: 16.50 that includes a Jarritos""! Cool no issue with the premium "" you want to flat top your burritos like La Taqueria SF " bring your u A game & flavor which they did not!!!!! No way Jose lack luster & they lag & get 2
author: Sean K.

description: Spend 40 bucks but my husband got two burritos (with the most expensive meat and add guacamole), i got the street tacos, and he got a beer and I a horchata. He is ready to eat the second burrito and go back for breakfast he said it was so good. The service was fast and the green sauce was amazing on the street tacos!
author: Alana B.

description:
The highlight of this place wasn't really the food, but more so the convenience and ambiance. The service is fast and the food is solid. You're bound to run into everyone you know in the Marina/Cow Hollow at night, especially on the weekends.  

This is a perfect place to hang out before a night out with friends. The pitcher margaritas available here make everything even better! It's definitely a very youthful, fun crowd. I will definitely be back here if I'm in the neighborhood to hang out with friends.
author: Jenny D.

description:
This taco place is about as good as it gets for Marina Tacos. Every time I go I have gotten the Street Taco Combo. I usually get one of each of the Carne Asada, Chicken and Carnitas. 

Each of the tacos came with a huge portion of meat, perfectly made tortillas and fresh cilantro and onions. The meat is all wonderfully seasoned to the point where every bite is bursting with flavor and the meat is sooooo juicy. 

I also never pass up the margaritas! You can order a pail in a sand toy bucket and share it with your date. Great spot for Taco Tuesday or just a casual dinner any night of the week.
author: Michael P.

description:
I'm surprised that I haven't reviewed Tacko until now as I've been a regular over the past five years. It's easily my second favorite burrito in San Francisco behind La Taqueria, and that's saying a lot. 

What makes this place so great? The quality of proteins, the salsas/hot sauces and tortilla. I'm a huge fan of the chicken as my protein but, the carnitas and carne asada are both legit too. Yesterday, I ordered the San Francisco chicken burrito and guess what? Unreal. Get it. 

I'm also a big fan of their quesadillas and it's a great option if you're into those. Who isn't? ;)

Tacko. Mi Amor. Thanks for being you.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
I was really excited to come to Tacko and wow! They really let me down.

I came in with my husband early on a friday night- he ordered two tacos Nick's way and I got the tortilla soup.  We sat down with our number and 5 minutes later my soup comes. 15 minutes later he gets up to ask if they forgot about his tacos. No apology, actually a pretty rude WTF do you want response .. and 10 minutes later his tacos come- slapped down on the table, no 'enjoy' or 'sorry' or 'we forgot about you, oops!'

My soup was so salty I couldn't take my ring off later. 

2 stars for having sparkling (and still) water on tap. Vs. negative 100 stars.
author: Christine L.

description: Hands down best Mexican in the city (or marina). Can get pretty packed quick but ordering online is an easy fix.
author: Manda P.

description:
Not bad if you are in the neighborhood but just average on the burrito flavor scale for me (I might need to explore the menu more).  Only two salsas to choose from and one kind of beans.  No black beans?  At all?

Don't get the Nantucket decor - we all live in California now - Mexico lives on our border - from whence the Taco came.  

Staff have always been pretty friendly.  Much appreciated.
author: Dan B.

description:
Honestly, I had the Nicks Way taco with carne asada. it was pretty good the steak was very soft and not tough unlike some other taco places i've been too. I liked the soft taco with a crunchy shell and I highly recommend it. I also ordered the french fries and they arrived cold but I was too hungry to complain about it lol. Besides them being cold it actually had good flavor. The staff is just okay. it's also very loud in there but I believe I went there on a Friday or Saturday? 

Hope I helped!
author: Amber R.

description: Our first visit. Food and service was wonderful. Really enjoyed the chips, salsa, y guacamole. The street tacos were delicious. The vibe was fun but loud. Burritos were a huge hit. Margarita y sangria were ok. Probably should have stuck with beer. Liked the water dispenser and many hot sauce choices. Def
author: tina l.

description:
A casual burrito/taco place that is a great deal. San Francisco burrito is great with carne asada. Everyone was very friendly and actually made an effort to let us have a a good experience at a casual restaurant.

A pitcher of margaritas for 17 dollars is one of the best deals I've found in SF. Definitely recommend and hope to come back soon. Line can be a little long but goes by quickly.

Vibes: 4/5
Food: 4.5/5
Customer service: 5/5
author: Bito M.

description: Okay so delicious, but less than a day later and it is food poison city and I am the mayor. My colleague had the same thing after eating a chicken burrito..... beware.
author: Samantha L.

description: If you want the traditional SF burrito experience, this isn't the right place to go. Tacko is great for me because it offers healthy options, including chicken tortilla soup! I had the guacamole, which came in a huge portion with pico on top. Also had the steak burrito was was just okay.
author: Anjali P.

description: This is hands down my favorite Mexican restaurant in the city! The salsa and high quality ingredients are what have me coming back. I always get the California burrito. I wish that they gave more red salsa when I order delivery...
author: William M.

description: A strangely Nantucket themed taco and burrito joint in San Francisco. Quality wise similar to Qudoba or Chipotle. Sizable burritos, they taste fine and they will fill you. The price is reasonable. Nothing to shout about.
author: Tommy F.

description:
TLDR - $2 Taco Tuesdays sound like a steal but the tacos are small and the meat is bland and overcooked

I was looking for something quick for a late lunch and decided to check out Tacko since it happened to be Tuesday and I saw that they had $2 Taco Tuesdays. Plenty of seating inside with just two tables outside. Order at the counter and they'll give you a number and bring you your food. They've got tacos, burritos, quesadillas and some other things here, including lobster rolls (random), but obviously I was enticed by the $2 taco deal. 

Honest opinion? Not worth it. They're sad and small and there's literally only cilantro and onions, so you're really paying $2 for a little bit of meat. There's an option to get tacos Nick's Way (with cheese, beans, pico de gallo & guac), but those aren't part of $2 Taco Tuesdays and they're pretty expensive ($5.50-5.75 for one taco). Plus, their meat is poorly executed, I'm not sure extra toppings will save them.. Tough, lacking flavor. The best was the carne asada, but even that I wouldn't want again.

* MEXICAN "STREET STYLE" TACOS (normally $7.75 for all 3, $2 each on Tues)
[topped w/ cilantro & onions on small corn tortillas]
- Carne Asada - 3/5 - decent flavor but overcooked and chewy
- Carnitas - 2/5 - rather bland and disappointingly tough and dry
- Pollo - 1/5 - dry and bland, even when drenched in the salsa in the bottles on the table
author: Jessie L.

description: Didn't like the chicken quesadilla much at all. Found it to be too greasy. Our group did like the tacos -- they found the steak to be very good. I got a can of Tecate and that was the highlight of my dinner. Will day I liked the Nantucket theme.
author: Matt J.

description:
The tacos here are revolutionary ! 
Hard and soft shell with beans and cheese and meat and guacamole and pico de Gallo.. sooo amazing ! 
Sangria is good too
author: Tabby I.

description: When you're in the mood for Fish tacos Nick's way, this is a great place to get them as an alternative to the obvious locations. I also got the elote and chips and salsa. Pico de Gallo was fresh and tart. Elote was sweet and cheesey.  Great food, friendly employees, and bright and sunny atmosphere.  Would definitely come back!
author: Nancy B.

description:
Day 4 in San Francisco. Been to many restaurants and I love this place. The only one I'm leaving a glowing review for. Got the San Francisco carne asada burrito, queso corn, chips/salsa/guac and a margarita. It's busy on a Wednesday - looks like locals eat here which is a good sign. Everything was tasty and the staff is friendly. Food came out quick too. I'll def come back. 

Update: Been here a while now since I first started this review and there's a constant line of people to dine in, they keep walking in. And also noticeable pickup is happening. Turnover is good. It's busy with loud conversation right now - but not too loud though. Enough to feel like a night out even though it's Wednesday.
author: JoAnn H.

description: Food was good. We had a burrito, quesadilla, the tortilla soup. All of which was a good choice. Our favorite part was the salsa, it was delicious and fresh. Parking wasn't too bad.
author: Tamara S.

description:
Had an early dinner here with a friend who frequents Tacko a lot - now I know why!!  

It was my inaugural visit and, although I don't get to SF very often, will not be my last.  Nick's Way tacos with the Carne Asada was SO GOOD!  The chips and guac were fab too.
author: Vikkie N.

description: I came here with 3 of my friends and the service is just terrible. 2 of the girls were over 21 and 2 of us were not. The 2 girls who were over 21 ordered their own drinks and had their IDs checked. The manager, Nem, would not stop staring at us and talking about us with other coworkers. He even sent another coworker to check on us to see who was drinking. We could feel eyes on us at all times and we felt super uncomfortable and harassed the entire time. He asked to see our IDs FOR A SECOND TIME. We even complained about his staring to him and he kept doing it. The sad part about it is the food was good but the one manager made our experience so uncomfortable that we will not go back.
author: Sydney Z.

description: Chicken tortilla soup is really good tastes homemade. The service isn't the best but a nice casual atmosphere. Give you free chips with your order.
author: Hana T.

description:
YUM! This place is where we ended up at after searching high and low all over sf for a quality Mexican spot. 

Their So-Cal Burrito has French fries in it! How cool is that?! They use whole-wheat tortillas (so good by the way), and their salsa is to die for. Their chips and "salsa" is really chips and pico... the chips are served with a heaping pile of pico de gallo on the top. I really love their red salsa on the table in the bottle.

Decor and ambiance are awesome. 10/10! So good!
author: Emily J.

description:
I ordered the street tacos here (seems like the standard order) and the tacos were great!! Also the red sauce they have at the tables are incredible.

Overall, nothing too out of the ordinary, but its a good taco place with a minimal wait (if any).
author: James D.

description:
First off, this is not how you spell taco!

Second off, I'm from California and these California burritos are some of the worst I've even experienced. Oily, mushy, and very poorly made. Putting french fries into a burrito is not just something you toss in there to label it "Cali", there's an art form to it. They need to be crispy, to add a nice crunch to every bite, not just extra mush you taste when you get to the center.  

Over priced food. Douchy atmosphere. Amateur Mexican food, at best. One star!
author: Bobby S.

description: Great food! Being from MA, I thought that the Nantucket theme was neat, however, not the star of the show. That didn't matter though. The ingredients and "San Francisco" style burritos where unlike anything I have had before. Not going to lie, I was hesitant to try this place but was more than pleased once I had a Yerba Mate Aqua Fresca to wash down delicious food that filled me up for the night. Definitely come during off hours or order ahead if you aren't looking to wait... but the same goes for any quality Mexican fare.
author: J. E.

description:
Came here recently and ordered crispy fish tacos (Nick's way) and margaritas. The tacos were okay, but I definitely prefer Nick's Crispy Tacos over Tacko. The tortillas seemed a bit stale, and the fish wasn't very warm. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing?

The margaritas on the other hand were terrible. Worse than cheap margarita mix - very syrupy, no tequila. For the first time ever, my boyfriend and I didn't even finish our first glass (and we ordered a pitcher). We also weren't offered salt on the glass rim.... who drinks a margarita without salt? At the very least, the salt would have covered up the shitty tasting margarita.

Also, the atmosphere was disappointing. Hole in the wall feel, with marina bro's yelling everywhere. Not my style, may be for other people.

I probably won't be back unless Nick's Crispy Tacos is closed again and I'm absolutely craving fish tacos.
author: Amanda R.

description: Great food! Good prices. For a Sunday night, the line to the counter was a bit long and it took a while but worth it. Maybe have a second cashier? All in all it was delicious and worth the wait!
author: Leslie Z.

description: I had the 3 taco combo with added chips and guacamole. Everything was great! The chips were salted well, the guacamole and pico de gallo was fresh and the 3 small tacos were filling. I will definitely try this place again!
author: Brandan W.

description:
The cashier was incredibly slow, she seemed like she was on something. And the food was mediocre at best But the real dealbreaker was that it made me ill. Got severe indigestion as it just sat in my stomach for hours on end.

Would not recommend - super overrated "mexican" food.
author: Ameer K.

description: Huge Tacko fan. Nick's way tacos are filling, unique, declious and reasonably priced. Two is plenty for a dinner. I usually grab horchata as well, though it could use a bit more cinnamon in my opinion.
author: Ross R.

description: The food was very yummy. I ordered a carne asada quesadilla and it was filled up with meat and good tender tasty meat!! Good quality food. My son and mom got cheese quesadillas with sour cream and guacamole..a tip they put the sour cream and guacamole inside the quesadilla and it's more of a wrapped quesadilla then the traditional one. It was surprising but it didn't matter cuz the taste and price were on point!! When we came to San Francisco we didn't think Mexican food but we sure are happy we stopped here. And another tip you order first then sit down which is fine but we didn't know. It was very loud in there but that's just because it was so busy which is a good sign to me :) very tasty
author: Kris E.

description: Good place, good food, I just visited and I like the environment, very clean and nice staff, I ordered a carne asada burrito  and it was delicious (just a little bit smaller than regular burritos) and the horchata one the best I have tasted here in San Francisco, definitely I will be back when I am close to Fillmore area.
author: Lilian S.

description:
One of the better Mexican food places I've tried! I had the San Francisco burrito with chicken. The chicken was nice and juicy, and the tortilla had a nice crisp to it!

They have a huge selection of sauces and salsa to choose from, so you won't be disappointed if you can't eat Mexican food without sauce (like me). 

Nice and clean, great window light & seating.
author: Joshua C.

description: Tacko... Had a San Francisco Burrito & it was good, staff was friendly, make sure to call in your order tho, busy place :)
author: Albert R.

description:
I come here for my crispy taco fix because it's close to my gym, and I usually end up wishing I had gone to Nick's crispy tacos instead. Here are the reasons:

The crispy tacos here are skimpy on the additional ingredients like the guacamole and the cheese. 

The crispy tacos here are sometimes cold, whereby the cheese between the soft and crispy shell is not completely melted.

The salad here is basically iceberg lettuce and canned beans.
author: S W.

description:
HOLY SHIT I'm mad at the community. Why does this place have only 4 stars??? Okay. I'll tell you what to order. 
1. Guac and salsa (great pick) ask for both on the side they give you more. Then ask for a side of carne asada and damn you'll thank me later. 
2. Beer battered fish taco (I hate fish but I come here twice a week for this) get it nicks way because then there is guac on it and stuff and hell yeah let's party. 
3. Salad is great and fresh 
4. Soup is so perfect. Especially when we have poopy weather ya know? But even on a warm day I'm D
5. I tried a bite of the quesadilla twice and both times good. I've never ordered because I'm just not that type of person but roommate swears by them. WARNING they take longer than other things to make 
6. Tip. Don't get a burrito here it's just not the best thing on the menu. but anything else is incredible. 
7. The workers are like Serbian but I love them and they are so nice 
8. Bubbly water on tap. 
9. The owner is chill 
10. Friendly. Great. If you read this whole post add me on insta @rachman93 and dm me and then I'll give you a prize.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I was craving tacos, so the roommate and I decided to order Tacko for dinner on Sunday, June 12th. One of my coworkers raves about this place, so I wanted to try it. We ordered delivery via DoorDash. Placed order at 8:30pm and it arrived at 9:06pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Elote con Queso (Corn on the Cob w/ Cheese): Fresh corn on the cob brushed with lime salsa and dusted with Cotija cheese and cayenne pepper. ($3.95)
*Mexican "Street-Style" Tacos: Three authentic Mexican tacos, One each of carne asada, carnitas and pollo, topped with cilantro and onions on small corn tortillas ($8.50)
*"Baja Style" Fish Taco: One taco with beer-battered fish in soft corn tortillas, with cilantro, cabbage, red onions and roasted tomato and lime salsas ($5.50)
*California Burrito: A SoCal special, Your choice of meat, french fries, cheese and pico de gallo ($10.95), add Carnitas (+$3.50)
*Quesadilla: A crispy flour tortilla with your choice of meat, melted jack cheese, & pico de gallo ($9.95), add Chicken (+$3.50)

I like the tacos at Underdog's, so I was happy with the street tacos. All were meaty and flavorful. I normally like the fish tacos there too, but this one was more batter than fish. Maybe I got an off taco, but I was a little disappointed. The elote was good. The corn super tender. The roommate enjoyed his burrito and quesadilla. I tasted the quesadilla and it had a good amount of chicken and cheese. Was a nice melty bite. They also gave us a small bag of chips and two different salsas.

Other than the fish taco, everything else was as good as I remember. Glad I can also get tacos Nick's Way from another location if the craving hits.
author: Elena N.

description:
San Francisco is pretty stacked on good taco spots, and while Tacko is large, clean, and exceptionally comfortable, I'd be lying if I said the tacos were up to the exceptionally high bar set by places like Street Taco and El Farolito. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

You know those small, sometimes questionably clean but definitely authentic bare-bones taco spots that are prone to being discovered as real gems of Mexican cuisine? Tacko is most certainly not that, but that isn't a bad thing with respect to the service and atmosphere. Tacko has instead adopted an interestingly East Coast vibe that's even reflected on their menu with dishes like Lobster Rolls and guacamole without chips. It's different, but it's exceptionally clean and comfortable. You place your order, take your number, and wait to be served soon after. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

I'm a huge fan of authentic Mexican street style tacos, so that's what I lunged at when I saw a trifecta of street tacos on the menu for $7.50. These tacos weren't large, but at $2.50 they weren't unreasonably priced. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

So I ordered three cream puffs:

You know what these were just okay if I'm being honest. the tortillas were good, but the meats didn't really bring the flavor in a way that I'm used to with Mexican street tacos. The chicken taco in particular needed some serious salsa to keep it from being dry and relatively flavorless, and both the carne asada and carnitas lacked that sort of moist and pungently flavorful quality that you find elsewhere. Single Star Granted.

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Tacko is a neat concept, and I understand why it gets the attention that it does, but I can't honestly say that the tacos themselves are on par with some of the elite offerings in the city. No Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description:
If you have any allergies, do not order from here, because they just don't care about modifying that for you. Honestly I am scared to order tonight. I would love your goddamn Baja burrito, but for some reason you think that EVERYONE in the whole SF area can absolutely digest creamy milk, despite an allergy. I have thrown away over 4 burritos from you bc i cannot eat them, DESPITE MY REQUEST EVERY TIME!? What's up, is it lack of attention or lack of any care? It is CLEARLY one of the two. My BC loves it, because he has NO requests for change,  so I am stuck getting an order I can eat 30% of the time. I guess if you are lactose or can't do meat, you don't get a sub, and you will get nothing altered despite your requests.

GOOD LUCK TO YA'LL!! You got a 30% chance they will read your sub or alterations requests. Hey Kitchen, some of us are not trying to be assholes against the end you created, WE JUST CANT EAT YOUR SHIT WITHOUT LITERALLY BEING ON THE TOILET ALL NIGHT IT IS CALLED AN ALLERGY.
author: Nika C.

description: This place proves that you don't need to be from Mexico, or start your restaurant in California, to have good Mexican food.  I snagged a chicken and a beef burrito as I headed out of work and wasn't expecting much.  I got a little more than I expected, but would have preferred more....anything.  The tortillas are higher quality than the standard, but the pinto beans and meats tasted really dry and there wasn't enough guacamole in the burritos to cover this up.  I still ate half of each hence the A-OK rating, but this is not a meal I would stay at work late for.
author: Brooke R.

description: This place is so interesting- it's a taco joint but the entire interior has a Massachusetts/Nantucket/beachy vibe. Two things I would normally not associate together. Besides that, the food was pretty good. I got their tacos and really enjoyed them! I wish they were bigger but overall I would go back. It's in a super cute area in the Marina as well!
author: Amanda F.

description: The carne asada taco Nick's way. Yum! Alternating the green & red salsa makes it even better. Craving it even after finished eating.
author: Ruth C.

description: My boyfriend and I went here for an late lunch-early dinner at 4:00pm. Upon arriving, I was pretty confused because the decor of this place makes it look like it serves po' boys and clam chowder. Like the walls are literally lined with posters of Nantucket and yachting magazines. There's actually a lobster roll on the menu under the tacos section which is questionable. That's when I knew I probably wouldn't get an authentic burrito from this place. However, I was delighted to see that Tacko makes burritos in different styles. They offer it Mexican style, Mission style, San Diego Style, and California style (comes with fries). My boyfriend ordered the California burrito while I ordered the San Diego burrito, both with chicken. Too bad my worries came true. We ate the whitest tasting burritos of our lives..The chicken was dry, bland, and all breast meat. Even the sauces that were at the table didn't have much flavor or spice at all. I found myself dousing each bite with sauce just to add flavor and moisture to the burrito. Even without the addition of sauce my burrito tasted mostly of pico de gallo. I kinda wish that I had gotten a mission style burrito or something so that there would be more flavor from the rice and beans. I wouldn't come back here-- it's overpriced and the food is flavorless.
author: Kelly Q.

description:
Pretty darn good, but the complementary chips are hilarious.  I received a bag with a total of 4 chips.  What a joke.  Save the paper.

Update:  complementary chip quantity has been improved.  Thanks Chris!
author: Douglas R.

description: The tacos were on point, especially having it "Nicks way"!!! Highly recommend this spot. Although I minus 1 star for the Sangria.  It was a bit dry and unsweetened that day. It needed some sort of  syrup, sprite or something.
author: Fred Z.

description:
Literally one of the best burritos in SF! I'm partial to any place with chicken breast over thigh, so I'm biased here and I realize it makes it a bit less authentic, but I really don't care because the quality of the chicken is insanely amazing! 

Love how it's shredded chicken breast. 
The salsa is also amazing! Especially the red salsa. 

I literally went twice in three days after trying for the first time. Kind of embarrassing to admit, but it's that good! :)
author: Emily F.

description: This place is AMAZING. First of all, just know that when I first got to San Francisco, I took a 20/30 min walk just to get to Nick's Crispy Tacos. If I had known this place was so much closer and did the tacos "NICK'S WAY" I would have come here! I like this ambience better. Still a counter service type of situation, but definitely more chill and there's outdoor seating unlike Nick's on Polk/Broadway. 5 stars for the Baja fish tacos nick's way. I could eat like 5, or for the rest of my life... BONUS: they have about at least 20 different hot sauces available. A spicy queen's dream come true.
author: Courtney M.

description: Baja tacos today with a bowl of beans and rice! Very good. Started with chips salsa and housemade Guacamole which is amazing. Daughter had Connie Asada burrito San Francisco style and my other daughter had chorizo quesadillas which she said was really good
author: Jason S.

description: We found this place while walking endlessly through the streets of San Francisco. I love love love their lobster roll and elote con queso. Must try!!! A little pricey but worth it.
author: Mimi L.

description:
As many other Yelper's have mentioned, Tacko is like Nick's Crispy Tacos with a Nantucket vibe. You can have your agua fresca with a San Diego inspired burrito, while your friend has a lobster roll and washes it down with sangria. It's a little random, but it works!

I appreciate Tacko's huge menu including SoCal staples like the California burrito (stuffed with fries rather than rice) and Cape Cod favorites such as the lobster roll. You can also order tacos 'Nick's Way' which is always the best way to go. I'm a sucker for carnitas, and Tacko does carnitas well. Hot sauce junkies should also enjoy the assortment provided here.

Tacolicious seems to be the neighborhood favorite among my friends, but I'm still 100% team Tacko!
author: Chelsea P.

description:
This place deserves 5 stars.

Don't come here if you are looking for traditional Mexican tacos. However, if you want a good taco or a good burrito that doesn't cost $15, this is your spot.

Fast and friendly service. This place is always busy and is great when you want something tasty in a pinch.


Try the chorizo tacos and get them nicks way.
author: Maura M.

description: This place is solid!  Love the carne asada Nick's way taco and their hot sauces.  Quesadilla on the other hand was not that great...
author: Kennedy T.

description: I'm a SF native, and I'm judgy about Mexican food. Ever since I discovered Tacko, I pretty much don't go anywhere else. The food is incredibly fresh and delicious. The guac is out of this world. Every time I'm back home I go a couple times. Nomz.
author: Sydney A.

description: DELICIOUS! Go! The guacamole was killer and so were the tacos. Clean environment, spacious, fast, and friendly ... we can't wait to go back.
author: Dee M.

description:
Ah, two of my favorite countries - Mexico and Nantucket. You know I'm all about the #mashup places: sushi AND karaoke, fried chicken AND milk tea, Korean food AND no kpop, or in this case burritos AND lobter* rolls.

(-_^) Lobster Roll $17.50 (http://bit.ly/1N3BKTx)
No mayo. Got a claw! #coolaf

(-_^) Mexican Burrito $8.25 (http://bit.ly/21v4xtU)
Gracias for no-rice options.

(-_^) Iced Yerba Mate $3? (http://bit.ly/1XGVr8H)
Tastes like mashed lentils.

Plus dopest music ev. Marina folk trying to work on laptops, text frendos, have convos & stizz; I was the only one dancing - can you blame me? Whispers, old soul, and Motown played the whole time. A little too energetic for the mellow crowd, but wgaf.

*Not a tpyo.**

**But that was. :p
author: Dan B.

description:
Came in on a rainy Friday night before closing and I was a little worried the kitchen might be closing, but the workers were really nice and didn't seem phased that it was almost 11 pm. 
We ordered the Mexican street tacos, elote, and salsa and chips. The street tacos were pretty good, small but good. They don't taste amazing like regular hole in the wall Mexican tacos, but I enjoyed them with some of the sauces they put out (the dark one was especially good, I've had better green sauces). My bf seemed to love the elote, and I agree that it was good but boy did that cheese smell!
Anyways, this was a fun taco place to try, I liked that they had a wall of hot sauces to try and the workers were nice.
author: Jenny E.

description:
Not really a big fan of Mexican food unless it's been a full night of drinking. For some reason, I was drawn to this place because it didn't remind me of the typical hole in wall Mexican establishment. It resembled a San Diego, oceanside town, maybe East coast fishing town kind of joint. The Nantucket art gave that away, but could be the picnic style tables with high bar stools. 

When you go in, it's pretty simple. Just approach the counter, order your food, get a number and they'll bring your order to your table when it's ready. For my meal, I got the Carne Asade San Francisco burrito for $10.25. A Mission style favorite, Carne Asada, rice, pinto beans, pico de gallo, cheese and guacamole. The burrito was HUGE! Like I said, I typically don't care for Mexican food but this was good! Lots of meat so I wasn't feeling like I wasted money. Very filling and satisfying. 

Tacko is super fast and convenient. It's next to all the Cow Hollow pubs and taverns so when you're in the area, stop by and get yourself a burrito. You'll be glad you did!
author: Rockne H.

description: Everything is fresh and delicious.  Great guacamole.  Nicely flavored fish tacos.  Friendly staff!
author: Mark D.

description: If you're looking for some top notch quality meat, this is the place to visit. I came here last night with my wife although it was really busy (to be expected on a Friday night) we still got our food in a timely matter. Given the meat was a little dry probably from standing aside on the grill the quality was still great. I had also ordered a strawberry margarita but given a regular margarita, they were so busy I didn't bother to ask them to change it. May come back next time if I'm in the area.
author: Alexander K.

description: Mexican flavors are right on point. Loved the salsa and guacamole with chips! My husband and I shared the San Francisco without meat burrito, which is perfect for 2. Disfruta!
author: Sheyla J.

description: From the beginning I had to get my own water and utensils! One of the glasses had red sauce on it! The chicken was quite bland and the chips were to hard! The tacos were quite good but the Mexican street style tacos were small! I would say the best thing here was the guacamole and big tacos!
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Honestly, the rating is more for the location and decor than the food. To be fair, anything corn isn't my thing and am not too familiar with Mexican food. I know, right? 
Anyway, I always end up wondering, so why did I go there? It was a very simple quick bite: chips and salsa and veggie taco. Just average fare, if you ask me and pricey - isn't chips and salsa complimentary in Mexican restaurants? Um, not here: $2+. Very generous portion though. 
1 veggie taco: $4+, tax included. Will surely snap some pics on next visit.
author: Moushumi K.

description: I don't know if we have been really unlucky me and my boyfriend, but we both had sever food poisoning from this place. We both got a burrito with Carne asada and the taste was very good. But the pain I have found myself in 5 hours after eating from Tacko is just crazy. Not gonna give you the details but i have been suffering from food poisoning for 20hours now and so is my boyfriend. I guess their meat wasn't fresh or something like that. But what I can say is to be careful when you eat there and personally, even though the food was good I am never going back to the place. Traumatized!
author: Constance P.

description: I love this place - great food & service. My favorite is the San Francisco burrito with chicken. My one gripe (and I see that the owner reads these comments, so maybe it will help) is that I hate, hate hate the "compostable straws." They fall apart in five seconds and paper + liquid...gross. While I appreciate the effort to be green, these are terrible and I would bring back the old straws in a heartbeat.
author: Anne-Elise F.

description: I got the 3 street style tacos...the steak one easy favorite. But overall, the quality of the food was ok. Service could've been better. The girl at the counter seems clueless and overwhelmed even though the restaurant wasn't even though it wasn't busy. Alas had the chips and salsa..chips were good but salsa was eh. The two salsa bottles at the bottle wasn't even spicy. Definitely have had better tacos. And don't think I'll be back
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Baja style fish taco 5/5 (big taco much fish)
Carne Asada 5/5 (American Kobe beef)
Lobster roll 3.5/5 (small, no sides, overpriced, good but not the best)

For tacos Nick's Way is the move
author: Eric L.

description: Best play is getting a burrito bowl San Francisco style with a piping hot tortilla on the side. Love how they put tomatoes in their Guacamole. This is as good as fast casual Mexican food gets
author: Kevin J.

description:
Been going here for a long time. The food has been pretty good but today the carne Assad was tough, chewy and grisly and the salsas were watery! What happened????
Hi Chris,
I appreciate your response and working in the food industry for over 20 years myself, I know how there can be inconsistency, and I know you will make sure your food is good every time it is served to the customer! For that I will come back because I see you cared enough to respond! I give you 4 stars just  for that!
author: Flora Y.

description: My family and I went to this place because we were craving some really good Mexican food. We ordered in the line, and got a table. After about 30 minutes of waiting, we still didn't receive our food (which was weird because it was such burritos). We told the lady at the counter and honestly she really didn't seem to care at all. She just said it was on the way. People had already came in and left at this point. Also, the people in this restaurant were all around 22 and super annoying. Not a comfortable environment at all. About 15 minutes went by, and we finally got our food. I got the San Francisco burrito. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but not worth the wait. I would definitely not come back.
author: Jane B.

description:
I've been meaning to eat at Tacko for over two years, but just walk on by to or from the Marina. Finally, we stopped in today--even though the Bay to Breakers crowd was there.

Service was a tad slow, but I'll give them a pass because of the crowd. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

I had the three taco platter with three different meats. All of them were delicious. Both the red and green sauces in the squirt bottles in the table were great too. A nice heat to both with solid flavor in each.

My wife had the burrito with carnitas: excellent and filling. The tacos were also filling because they were generous with the protein.

My son had the carnitas quesadilla, which was more than he could finish (he's 27, so don't think I'm talking about kid portions). He loved his food as well.

I also had a tasty margarita. Watch out for the bar crawl times if you don't like crowds. We are definitely going back.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I hate that this place is in the marina. In the land of no parking, tech bros (which is all of sf), and yoga pants. But the food is really good and there's free sparkling water on tap!!!!!!! They have a couple different house hot sauces that are on every table which are excellent. But they also have every other hot sauce known to man there too! 

The line can get really long. Even in the middle of the week. It can get to be a half hr wait just to order. They always seem understaffed. But food is delicious. My bf and I always get the chips and guac to start while we wait for our order. I tend to get the fish tacos or california burrito.
author: Jee Mee H.

description:
Maybe I have been spoilt by the mission but I found the tacos and burritos here a little bland.

We came here after a long day in the afternoon when it was a bit quieter. We scored a table inside at the front and we set ourselves up with a highchair and a selection of sauces. We had the "San Francisco" chicken burrito which was a bit flavorless and a bit too creamy and the Mexican "street" burritos which were also a bit boring, I liked the pork but my wife found it too fatty.

Price wise it is pretty good for the area, they have a good drink selection (variety of beer, cider etc) and the chips and salsa was quite fresh.
author: Tristan L.

description: This place made me uneasy from the beginning, I had a gut feeling it wasn't going to impress just based on it's weird Nantucket theme. I though I was petty, but not petty enough to keep myself and my girlfriend from getting food poisoning apparently. I had it the worst, vomiting my Baja burrito before bed and 3 more times after. In the restaurant, my girlfriend asked a waiter to heat up her burrito because it had solid blocks of cheese in it, who met her with attitude before the manager took over. On top of this we got two burritos and a Coke and it was almost $30
author: Nicole S.

description:
When I walked in, the atmosphere was awesome! I was ready for a gourmet taco. They're known for having tacos with a hard shell surrounded by a crispy shell. I ordered one filled with chicken. While it was pretty good, I was slightly disappointed. The chicken was cooked in such large chunks, that it was slightly dry. I honestly took scoot of the chicken out and just ate the taco parts. The crispy shell in the soft shell was really good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the meat. 

They have some homemade salsas on the table that are really good. The verde is surprisingly spicy!
author: Courtney O.

description:
Get this:
Grilled corn salad + chicken

This place has dropped into my weekly lunch rotation. Very fresh ingredients, great service (especially Yurick, who is professional, courteous, and on-point), and an open architecture make it a great place to go during the day. Also, there are two outdoor tables which are great for people watching.  I only wish they had a simple grilled fish taco, but you can go to Pacific Catch for that. Overall, great experience and a more laid-back vibe than most of this neighborhood. (And even better than Nick's).
author: Scott W.

description: Went to Tacko for lunch a couple of weeks ago, food was very fresh, delicious and authentic. We were greeted with great aloha from Ben @ the counter, who gave us wonderful service throughout our visit!
author: Mr. W.

description: Excellent little Mexican restaurant opened up by "Nick" of the renown Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Food is great, ambiance is cool, and just a nice little spot to get to a bite to eat knowing you're going to enjoy your food.  Recommend the Baja Style Nick's Way tacos and chips/salsa with guacamole...
author: Jill P.

description: The nautical theme is very nicely done. Interesting vintage magazine covers, fine art posters, maps for wall paper...it's a fun place to eat. Very clean, I've been there when it was really busy and they had the staff to keep it pretty darn clean under extreme pressure. The food is fantastic...Mexican food that tastes healthy...but not too healthy. There is a reason we love it. I had the taco "Jack's way"...excellent, different. There is a interesting story behind the decor...and why the taco is named after the owner/chef. The staff has told me the story twice and they are happy to share. A great place to eat...
author: Rodney M.

description: The street taco had good flavor. The grilled fish taco was over cooked and very dry. I ordered and paid for chips and guac..... I did not receive the quac in my Togo order. I did not receive enough chips to finish the tiny salsa.
author: J B.

description:
I have to update this review based on my experience  ordering takeout last night. 

I ordered a black bean and corn salad with carne asada, no cheese and no dressing. I live 2 blocks away so by the time I got over there to pick it up ~10  min later it was ready and waiting. 

The staff is always so friendly here - really nice people who go out of their way to help. No different this time, the server asked if I wanted chips and salsa, I said yes and asked for additional salsa which he happily gave me. 

So I get home and am eager to break into this delicious salad. But when I open it up I sadly realize there is no carne asada on it. This was a big bummer for 2 reasons: first, it's like $5 to add carne asada, and second, it's sooooo tasty. 

So I call up to ask about it. The lady on the phone is immediately very apologetic. She offers to refund the purchase in whole or offers that I can come back for a side container of carne asada. I opt for the latter since I'm only two blocks away. When I get there, she again apologizes profusely and hands over a very generous portion of carne asada in a side container. On top of that, she also says she refunded my transaction! 

The level of humble apology and service was totally unexpected and definitely made an initially unfortunate experience right (more than necessary, I would have been happy with just the extra meat). 

Just another reason to continue to frequent Tacko (on top of the delicious food!). Thanks!
author: Krista S.

description:
Yikes, what happened to Tacko?

Today I decided to get some pick-up after work. I called and someone put me on hold, after 10 min on hold I hung up and tried calling back but couldn't get through. 

Advice # 1. Please add the "call waiting feature", it's pretty annoying to be sent to VM because the phone is off the hook. Which means I would have actually been on hold for 15 minutes. More like forgotten.

When the call finally went through the man who picked up the phone sounded really sick or hungover (hopefully hungover?) But we managed to get through the order. 

Side note: you know when you say "thank you, bye" to the other person on the phone and they already hung up? Well, that happened. Which look, I've worked in busy restaurants before where I had to answer multiple phones at once. I know what busy feels like. 

Advice # 2. Don't hang up before the client says thank you and good bye. Those 2 seconds you might save in that moment, will cost you a lot more later. 

So I arrive to pick up my order. I was curious how busy the restaurant was going to be due to the weird phone interaction. To my surprise, not busy at all. Maybe understaffed, I don't know. 

***Well actually metaphorically speaking, yes, very understaffed***

The same guy I spoke with on the phone is the one at the cashier, pretty sure he's even a manager. The reason I think this is because he's the only one who was on his cellphone the entire time I was standing there, and he generally just seemed like he maybe owned the place too. You know, smug-ish. 

Yet unlike many other restaurant owners and managers I've known, he didn't seem very proud of his workplace. Wrinkled shirt, messy hair, and all around bad attitude. 
I feel kind of bad bringing this up... but it was honestly kind of shocking how bad of a look he had.

My whole order was wrong. He didn't even order my sandwich, and the sides were wrong and he also forgot the two drinks. He still charged me for the sandwich though afterwards. Even though I had to wait for them to make it. I think I barely got an apology or a thank you. 

Advice # 3. Don't do a job you hate so much, or find a way to love everything you do. You won't only affect your customers but also the other employees who work around you / for you. Be an example to follow. Smile at your customers. 

This place has been good before and I'm sure once they fix their internal problems it will be good again. Maybe I'll pop my head in a few months and see what's going on. 

Good luck Tacko.
author: Briana G.

description:
I use to love this place - was always amazing for some quick tacos. I came here just about every week for two years for taco Tuesday and sometimes on the weekends.

Unfortunately, the last three times times I've come here (over the space of 3 Months) the food has been cold when it's served. The Carne Asada was some of the best around - now it's lukewarm, chewy to the point of not being edible, and colder than the tortilla it's served on.

Not sure what happened, but I'm incredibly disappointed and won't be coming here / recommending to friends anymore.
author: Kevin O.

description: Being from MA I had to check this place out. Nantucket theme and Mexican food? I was instantly in love. The carnitas tacos, chips and guac and margaritas were all great. Some of the best carnitas tacos I've had actually! The restaurant itself was very relaxed and had a friendly staff. Would 100% return!
author: Cara S.

description: such a nice place to just sit, eat tacos, and hang out (if you don't mind it getting a little loud during dinner time!) a few friends and i hit this place up once in a while and we could literally just sit and talk for hours and the employees never bother to kick us out, of course we voluntarily leave when it starts getting busy though. great vibes and great food 10/10 recommend
author: Joanna W.

description: This is one of the best burrito spots in San Francisco. It would be smart to order ahead if you're ordering between 6-8pm. This place gets packed during dinner. I suggest the chicken California burrito with a nice cola.
author: Matthew C.

description: Tacko is some of the best quick mexican food in all of SF!  The carnitas are excellent, as are the baja tacos, Nick's way.  You cannot go wrong!
author: Micaiah F.

description: I'll start by saying the food here is good. The service could be faster and the prices could be better but that's just life in SF. I'm only writing this review in the hopes that the manager sees it and changes this infuriating policy: They have items with both pinto and black beans on the menu, but they won't substitute black beans for pinto beans. Picture the scene: you order a taco and ask for black beans, but you're told that tacos come with pinto beans and that black beans are only for salads. What?! Who are you, the God of Beans? Dining in San Francisco will certainly expose you to a wealth of asinine policies but this definitely tops the list. PS they will offer to give you your taco with no beans and then sell you an extra side of black beans to put on yourself. Awesome customer service, guys.
author: Cole I.

description: As my friends and I wandered the streets, we fell upon a place called Tacko and fell in love! Even though i reaaallly wanted a fish taco, the chicken taco, nicks way became a new love for me. I will say they reset the tone for tacos for me!! I will travel for you Tacko!! Great service too!! Great setting! Even beautiful customers. They made my night!!
author: Frances O.

description:
I went into Tacko with high expectations, I had heard great things and it was one of the top things on my list when I visited the city. I was most excited for the guacamole, which everyone raves about and receives high praise. There was hardly any line, which was surprising because of everything I read online. 

Our group ordered chips and salsa with guac. As expected the guac did not disappoint, it was perfect texture but could have had a bit more of a kick. The chips on the other hand were flat out stale, they were hard to eat and not too enjoyable. The salsa was average pico de gallo.  

I ordered the Nick's Way carne asada tacos, which were pretty good. The shell of the tacos were very weird, as if they weren't properly cooked, they had a soft top shell but a hard under shell. The carne asada was delicious but there were beans in the actual taco and it wasn't listed on the menu posted. I'm not a big fan of beans, and I never order them so I was a little irked, but I powered through. The guac on the tacos was the best part. The tacos came with no sides and it wasn't clear at the time of ordering that everything was individual order. 

I wasn't too impressed and I was shocked that there were so many awesome reviews after this experience. I would say it's not really worth the time.
author: Nicole C.

description: Constantly disappointed at this restaurant. Not only do they charge rediculous amounts for their mediocre and small portioned "California style" Mexican cuisine, but the service is just awful. Would highly recommend going anywhere other than here. If you like waiting close to 30 minutes, for a small overpriced burrito that is often the wrong order, this is your place!
author: John R.

description:
This place is amazing! One of my favorite SF eateries. I got the three taco plate: great selection and taste with the carne asada, chicken and carnitas. Their rice is authentic and tasty. Will definitely be returning...probably every time I cross the Golden Gate or Bay Bridge.

It's popularity makes it a little crowded but don't get discouraged - it's worth the wait!
author: Danielle A.

description: Walked from downtown and was a pleasant stroll. Had the San Francisco burrito with pineapple juice and it was very tasty!
author: Daniel P.

description:
Called on a Sunday afternoon around 4:50pm. The phone line was busy. No biggie. Tried calling again 5 min later. Still busy. 10 min later, still busy. I called from multiple different phones over the span of an hour and fifteen minutes and nobody picked up the phone. Busy line the whole time. I couldn't place my order. 

Went in person at 5:50pm to order to go and placed my order only to be greeted by a rude cashier who was shockingly unapologetic for the phone mishap. I get it, it's a human mistake, the phone was off the hook- the least you could do was apologize for the inconvenience. 

They should be thankful their delicious food beats their less than impressive service and surly attitude.
author: Julia-Rose K.

description:
This is the best place.  And has the best carne asada burritos I have ever had in my life so far.  I literally didn't ever think there could be a best burrito.  Burritos seem simple and to the point yet these burritos have immense flavor and the quality of ingredients is top notch.  
I don't think I can look at a burrito the same way after having one here.  They are that good.  They set the bar high!  You've been warned!
author: Nicholas B.

description: It's very sad to see the quality of your favorite local restaurant get really bad. We used to love their carne asada but over the course of the last few months the quality of the meat has gotten really bad to a point that it's inedible. We still love their fish taco hoping they won't mess that up.
author: City T.

description: Service is very friendly and fast! Very cute decor and well-working layout. Super great prices and even better food. Delicious guacamole, and House-made horchata is amazing. Definitely headed back.
author: Sofia V.

description:
Incredibly good tbh! I was pleasantly surprised by this weird sounding place. I suggest getting tacos "Mike's Way" which is a soft shell wrapped around a hard shell and filled with all the goods (guac, salsa, other stuff that's good). 

Clean restaurant and probably the best tacos I've had somewhere it's apparent they follow every health code.
author: Austin H.

description:
Good, clean, delicious & affordable (especially being in marina. Food is always prepared fresh & they have very friendly service. What I like the most is their portions sizes, for example the burrito (see pic), is filling but won't stuff you. But if you want go for even lighter snack, try their Mexican "street style", tacos or "baja fish taco". 

Overall a simple low profile place with food food quality & taste of any 4+ star Resturant.
author: Mark Z.

description: I had the guac and chips and it was delicious! My boyfriend and dad had the fish tacos and both said they were really good. Will definitely come back next time we are in San Fran
author: Lexi K.

description: The food is super tasty and ranks as one of the top burritos in the city in my mind- however AVOID on weekend evenings or face throngs of drunk Marina goers who fulfill a nostalgic college party dystopian nightmare (or paradise as it may be in another eye) in this area. Drank.
author: J K.

description:
A cool trendy 'fake' Mexican spot! 

Plenty of vegetarian options, and I was starving, so I asked the guy for a recommendation. I went with a veggie taco and a side of rice & beans instead of the veg burrito. The veg taco was really good (I think 2 or 3) and well flavored. I wish they had a soy meat option though to make the taco a little more filling and flavored aside from the veggies. The rice and beans had wayyy too much cojito cheese (also surprising they didn't mention that in the menu) so it kinda took away from the rice & bean action I was excited for. After the 2 or 3 tacos and side, I wasn't that full. I was starving so I wanted to be fulll especially for drinking later that night. I guess you have to get some chips and salsa action up in there. 

They also have beers and agua fresca which is cool! Their beer selection is pretty good :D I would come back, and maybe just order more comida.
author: Aria S.

description:
We went here on a Tuesday hoping to find some good taco tuesday deals. They have $2 street tacos and $2 tecate !

I liked the ambiance of the place and the service was excellent. The restaurant is cute and clean even though the neighborhood was too quiet for my liking at 830 PM.

Personally i found the tacos to be a little bland.. i tried the Nick's style and the street tacos and i thought the flavors were missing..
author: Anju J.

description:
This is one of the better burritos spots I've tried in SF (and I've tried a lot). I usually can tell if a place has good Mexican food based on their salsa. And I looove Tacko's red salsa! It's not spicy but it's not sweet either. It almost had a smoky, chipotle flavor to it. Super yummy!

I got their San Francisco burrito with carne asada. The meat was delicious. The burrito was pretty big and came with chips which is always a plus. My only comment is that the burrito had way too much cheese in it. I took one bite and felt like all I ate was cheese. But other than that, it was really good, especially with the red salsa!

Their California burritos looked really good so I plan on trying that one next time! Staff was very friendly. The place is big and clean. I'll be back!
author: Chisholm T.

description: The BEST tacos. This is one of our go-to food spots in our neighborhood. We always bring friends from out of town here and they LOVE it. Growing up in Southern California, I know a good taco and Tacko does not disappoint. For the perfect size meal, for me 2 Nick's Ways tacos and for my boyfriend usually 3, sometimes 4 Nick's Ways tacos if he's really hungry.  The Elote con Queso (corn with cheese) is so delicious and tender too. The lobster roll is just "ok" because the bread gets too soggy, but the amount of lobster makes up for it and puts a smile on my face. If you are really hungry, the San Francisco burrito is a beast and SO good. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. But if you are only here once, get a Nick's Way taco. You are welcome.
author: Julia L.

description: Tacos made Nick's way. Carne asada quesadilla is my go to. Paired with a tall extra lime Dos Equis. Many locals and kid friendly.
author: Chris C.

description:
WHOA. WHOA. WHOA. Okay, I may be new to the city and I may not know much about "authentic" Mexican food...but I do know what good Mexican food, and this is it my friends! Located in quaint little Cow Hollow lies this little Mexican gem. What do you mean I'm not in the Mission?! The vegetarian burrito from this place is everything I dream about and more. Instead of meat, you get guacamole. GUACAMOLE. No extra charge! I'm crying real tears of happiness! It had pinto beans, Monterey Jack cheese, pico de gallo, cabbage, red onions, and GUACAMOLE. HOLY GUACAMOLE, WAS THERE GUACAMOLE. I also loved how they grilled the burrito, very nice touch. Needless to say, I ate all of it. 

For someone like me who isn't vegetarian but prefers to eat meat-free as much as I can, this place was a dream come true. I could get a full-sized burrito stuffed with yummy ingredients for $7.95. Now that might sound like a lot but this is San Francisco...so you just gotta deal with it I guess. 

If you're ever in Cow Hollow and craving some bomb Mexican food, I would definitely recommend Tacko. Especially if you are looking for a vegetarian alternative. I don't know how their meat holds up, but if it's anything like the vegetarian option...you have nothing to worry about!
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
I love Tacko but they always overcook their carnitas and chips. I just picked up a salad to go and water pooled to the corner when I tipped the box slightly (and that with dressing on the side). 

Their burritos are great and the flavor is incredible I just think there needs to be more attention to detail. 

I'm giving two stars for their burritos and another for the red salsa because it is bomb.com. Wish I could give five but my experience was less than ideal and the carnitas are too delicious to be overlooked all the time.
author: Katie B.

description: Overpriced, not a great selection for vegans, the cabbage in the burrito is kinda nice for a change of pace but the whole marina douchebag vibe is off the chains in this spot.
author: Morris G.

description: Was hoping for some good Mexican food, but this place lacked flavor and was over priced. Nothing special about it. I ordered a margarita and felt like I was drinking lemonade. Good place to go to if you want Americanized Mexican food.
author: Rosita S.

description: This was probably the most overrated taco place ever. The salsa was bland, i had to add salt to everything I ordered. I ordered the mexican trio taco, which had chicken , carnitas and asade. Everything was bland, meat was too chewy and chicken one I couldn't even finish. I added too much red and green salsa to add some flavor to the taco, but both the salsa didn't have any flavor to begin with. I would recommend adding some salt and herbs to their food preparation. The place felt more like a bar then food joint.
author: Promita C.

description:
