Went here for dinner. Place was lively with continuous inflow and outflow of customers. We ordered burritos soft tacos and nachos. 
Their salsa was bad and so liquidy that just in couple of minutes, chips were soggy beyond one can eat.
Burrito was decent.
Tacos were bad with stuffed mainly with salad.
Overall very okayish experience.
author: Pratik G.

description: I love Tacko's food, service, and location. Always is my go-to when I want some chips and salsa!
author: Kelsey B.

description: This place is lit. Shoutout to all my supporters of tacko. One ring to rule them all!!!!
author: Preston A.

description: Good portions and good prices, but we were so confused with the Nantucket theme! Coming off a plane from New England, where it's kind of known for not having great Mexican food, it makes no sense! Also, the stools we were on were off-kilter so we had to hold on to the table the entire time in order to not spin away from each other. Awkwardsauce! All-in-all, it was decent but I've had better tacos in SF.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
For months my hubby and I ate at Tacko once per week and it was always good. It does take a while to get your to-go order (sometimes 20 minutes +) but we didn't mind as we always run into a friend there and would have a beer while we waited. Food was always on point. Love the San Diego burrito. 

Unfortunately we moved and I don't get over there much anymore so when I can get in and pick up some burritos, it's a treat.  And unfortunately my order has been wrong 75% of the time in the last year. It's usually chicken instead of carnitas. This has happened at least three times. It's happened so many times it's now a joke between my friends - weather or not the burrito will made correctly and if it will be chicken. Sadly there actually usually is always something wrong. Other times I will make an addition on the burrito which I have yet to receive. Tonight over half my burrito was a huge chunk of meat the size of my fist. You can tell in the food that the cooks are busy and just blatantly don't care. Disappointing as we used to love this place.
author: Ashley E.

description:
I work close to hear so it's nice to get burritos for lunch and sometimes my company will order it for everyone.

The food is good, definitely over priced but it's a pricy area. My main issue is they don't customize your order and for everything you want extra they charge you. Obviously extras cost more but if you want a healthier meal with no cheese, sour cream, beans, etc, it would be nice to get a little extra rice or lettuce so my $15 dollar Buritto isn't a tiny.


Since they charge a lot and are br accommodating I likely will stop going. It's just too overpriced for how small the food is.
author: Aaron K.

description:
If I could give it a zero I would. Any business that does not offer vegetarian rice may be traditional but Tacko is not. Covered by Nantucket posters (?) this is in no way traditional- it is just shitty. 
And the gal behind the counter was snotty and rude.
Tell Nick and every other person that works there they need tell people the rice is not vegetarian- 99% of people wouldn't think about it. 
Seriously, skip it.
author: Hi-d M.

description:
Great burrito and taco spot in the Marina/Cow Hollow.  Their California burrito is fantastic. I'm not a snob about burrito/taco authenticity, only what tastes good - and their food tastes great.  

Their red salsa has a nice kick to it and is great with both chips and with burritos. My only complaint would be that the prices are 10-15% too high for what you get but thats just the Marina/SF premium.  Easily the best burrito north of Market St and it can definitely hold up against some of Mission's best fare as well.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
Has VERY delicious food and awesome atmosphere, great aqua frescas (we got the limeade) but small portions and slightly over priced...Over all really great food! Plus the guac is bomb!!! :):) 
**at least tacos are two dollars on Tuesdays!! Lol**
author: Lexi C.

description:
OH. MY. GOD.

Favorite taco place in SF by far. Crazy good prices, crazy good food. You don't need a wide selection (though their selection is very decent) -- when the things you offer are that amazing. The mexican style street tacos (one taco of the three different selections of meat) are a must. A little taste of everything :) They have a huge wall with a selection of 20+ different kinds of hot sauces -- an impressive feat. They also have free sparkling water on tap -- it's the small things that matter :)

I've gotten their tacos, corn on the cobb, chips and salsa, and horchata -- all of which are the best I've had in my whole life.

The intererior is spacious and cute, the people are nice and the location is superb. Located right by my Don't Worry Be Yonce dance class, in the hub of the Marina, it's situated near anything you might need -- drinks, shopping, grocery stores, etc.

I love this place!
author: Meghan Y.

description: Tacko is so so so good, definitely the best taco place in the area! All of their ingredients are super fresh and healthy(ish). I never feel like a bum after eating it. The chips, salsas, and agua frescas are all house made and divine together. Thank you Tacko for satisfying my taco craving without ever making me feel regretful!!
author: Lily J.

description: I like this place. Tacos of the world, we can debate on forever. Obviously the more authentic the better, but who cares about that. It's dull to live by the same criteria always. It has a curiously Californian vibe, place and food, people & service are good, and so all is good with the world
author: Juls C.

description:
Beach theme taco shop! 

Their Elote Con Queso is a must get from their menu!  It's corn on the cob that is buttered, mayo-ed and sprinkled with cheese and light chili pepper!  It tasted so good after a couple of drinks from a bar nearby!  Well, anything tastes great, I would suppose, after drinking!  Get that and some street tacos!  It was Tacko Tuesdays, so street tacos were 2 for $2!  Steal deal!  I liked their carnitas taco more than their carne asada taco!

They have a grand selection of hot sauces to delightfully choose from!  I love hot sauces and feeling the burn!  Yummy!

Spacious seating and surprisingly self-serving up sparkling water!  Fancy!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Darn good #burrito ! The San Francisco style chicken burrito, featuring free range chicken, (because San Francisco) really hits the spot. And at $10.25 plus tax, my expectations were pretty high. The salsas were made in-house and had just the right amount of kick and the jamaica is a refreshing counterpoint. Service is fast and efficient and the restaurant was super clean.
author: Carole B.

description:
I really enjoyed this place!
Great part of town, cool look from the exterior, patio, plenty of indoor seating, and,....they had a great beer available from my home town; Pizza Port Shark Attack Red Ale, from Carlsbad!!! Score!
(See my photo!  Yippee)

Oh, and the tacos were legit! (evidently Mexican is a challenge for San Franciscans)
I had the Street Style combo; I each of carne asada, carnitas, and pollo. All three delicious. My daughter had a Nick's Style Vegetarian, and professed it to be really good!

There is an apparent Massachusetts vibe which is both odd and hilarious, and most assuredly the source of the clever name; Tacko. (Think phonetics)

I'll be back!
author: Darrin D.

description: Great little non-chain Mexican restaurant. The street-style tacos were delicious and the chips and salsa comes with some of the best pick de gallo I've had in California. Simple combinations full of flavor across the menu
author: Chris W.

description: I went here over a year ago with a friend & the food was incredibly delicious & the employees were extremely nice & super professional. WILL visit again on my next trip to the Gold Coast.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I've been coming here for years. It used to be a decent burrito but the quality is just so subpar now. 
The meat preparation is poor (overcooked many times) and everything just tastes salty.  
The salsa they provide used to be good but now it's watery.  The place is always busy so i think they just need to turn over so much food they've stopped caring about quality. Meh. Such is the way business goes sometimes. I'll be going elsewhere from now on. 
The staff is always nice though. Couple stars always for that.
author: Rob R.

description:
Warning I'm a burrito snob.

Ordered the San Diego burrito with carnitas. Had it delivered by postmates which arrived earlier than expected.

Taste: Compared to San Diego burritos or any socal burrito this was okay but nothing amazing. Tortilla tasted store bought. 

I liked the chips that came with my order and the salsa was fresh
author: Joy M.

description:
One of the best places for Mexican food in SF.

The food is extremely tasty and this is the joint to go out with friends or on any occasion.

Their Nicks Way Quesadeas are hands down the best, I would recommend to anyone.
author: David G.

description:
A pretty good place! The place seems like a restaurant frequented by locals, which was nice to know. It took a while to order, but once the order was placed the food came out pretty quick. We got the burritos and chips/salsa. Salsa was a bit salty but still tasty. Burritos were very tasty but wish I got more rice in it.

We also ordered some drinks, one of which was a mango drink and the other was a horchata. Both were quite refreshing!
author: Susanne Y.

description:
So good!!! I didn't have any problems finding a vegetarian option. I loved the fast dining approach. It was a nice change of pace from other restaurants in the area. The decor was nice too. 
Guacamole was insanely good and the elotes was cooked to perfection. 5/5
author: Brooke F.

description:
I've always raved about this place, so I'm sad to update my review with 2 stars. 

I wanted to dine here after The Bold Italic's microhood event in Cow Hollow. I hadn't been here since February of this year, so I was looking forward to getting a grilled fish taco Nick's way and elote. 

The place was busy, at least in my opinion because it was usually empty whenever I went in the past. I placed my order and the food came out pretty quickly... Perhaps too quickly....

The crispy shell was stale, so it didn't have that crunch I wanted. I sort of had to gnaw on it so I could take a bite. The fish was overdone, so much so I thought it was chicken. I was about to bring it back, when my roommate assured me it was fish when she looked at the texture of the meat. She ordered a fish burrito and she had the same problem. Her fish was overdone, and there was one part that was so burnt, she couldn't eat it. The only saving grace was the elote, which was delicious with the right amount of spice. 

I'm not sure if they cooked ahead because it was busy... But I'd rather wait for a perfect taco.
author: Vira P.

description: Tacko is delicious, but depending on the day they can skimp on the fillings.  The inconsistency in the kitchen cause it to lose a star, but other wise it tastes great.  And I love that they have a lobster roll in case you don't feel like a taco. :)
author: Kara S.

description: I give 4 starts because the quesadilla was amazing but the distance mural is false, deceiving and full of lies. Beware! Make sure you get guac and sour cream on your dilla. Ok bye now
author: Alexander S.

description:
My boyfriend and I are Tackoholics. We go here at LEAST once a week to indulge in the fine casual Mexican dining experience that exists among paintings of Nantucket on the wall. I usually order carne asada tacos (Nick's Way or bust) and he orders a carne asada San Francisco burrito. Add a side of chips with guacamole and salsa and two beers and we cease conversation to savor the taste of Tacko for a good 25 minutes. 

The establishment itself is VERY clean and well kept. The staff is great and attentive and have probably started noticing how often we frequent this spot. Guilty as charged. The service is quick-- our food usually gets brought out to us within 10 minutes of ordering. Even on Cinco de Mayo with a bustling crowd standing in a line out the door, they did a great job of efficiently serving everyone and handling the Marinaites.

I rate this restaurant 5 stars and will be back again. Probably tomorrow. Thanks Tacko :)
author: Cassandra L.

description: Great casual taco spot. Kind of a go to when in the area and need a filling taco...trust me, 1 - 2 is enough.
author: Andrew K.

description: Yum. Walking in SF, beautiful day, and really hungry.  Walking up Fillmore, we noticed a very unassuming awning that listed tacos and lobster rolls.... this was intriguing.  Went in, ordered one of all of their tacos, to share, and Loved them!!!!  Fresh fresh pico de gallo, and the meats were delectable.  Variety of agua Fresca's, beer.  Relaxed.  Did not try the lobster rolls, but there must be a back story on that.  There are pictures of Nantucket on the walls. Would highly recommend if you like great casual Mexican food.
author: Peggy M.

description:
Hmm.. I expected a little more from this place based on the reviews. I wasn't necessarily disappointed, but coming from LA where tacos and burritos are more ample than trees in a forrest, it was just so-so. 

Tons of cyclists and other hipster-types waiting around by the register, so it took a few minutes to figure out who was actually trying to order vs. who was waiting for their to-go orders. There are a good amount of options on the menu, and I settled with the California burrito (no pico) since it's one of my favorites from back home. 

Food was delivered pretty quick, and aside from the two salsa options at each table, there are tons of hot sauce options. The burrito itself was just okay. The tortilla was a little too crunchy and dry, and combined with the meat and fries (which were super-seasoned homestyle potatoes) and lack of sauce - it wasn't really a pleasant texture. I had to keep adding salsa to aid in chewing all those carbs, so it probably would have been best to add guacamole or some sour cream.

Since it was packed, we got stuck eating at the bar counter next to the front door. The stools are crazy uncomfortable, mostly because there is no foot rest so my feet were dangling a foot off the floor like a little kid. Luckily, someone at one of the bench tables left so we nabbed it in the middle of our meal. 

If you don't mind forking over $10 for a burrito, this place will do the trick if you're in the Marina. Otherwise, it would be worth looking for somewhere a little more authentic.
author: Kate K.

description:
I liked the food here; although it is not a cheap deal. The deal breaker for me: the last two times I've been in, they managed to forget my order. This most recent time it took more than half an hour (at a slow time) to make my food. When I brought it to their attention, the cashier offered me chips. After I had already eaten the chips I'd paid for while waiting for my order. 

I cannot justify spending my money here any more.
author: Katies F.

description: I stopped at Tacko for a quick bite. Mexican, tacos specifically, is my favorite food #whyaminotmexican? So naturally I ordered the street tacos which came with 3 tacos (chicken, carne asada, and carnitas). They were good (because they are tacos) but nothing to write home about. The red and green sauces at the table added a needed kick. I paired it with a nice cold Tecate #ballingonabudget. I left with my hunger satisfied but really wasn't too impressed. If I ever find myself at Tacko again, I'll give the burrito a try.
author: Josmauri T.

description:
Without question, San Diegans are Mexican food snobs and proclaim that the best Mexican food in the world comes from our city in the sun. Yep, even better than Mexico. It is a bold statement but I have yet to find any other place with as many quality Mexican food spots as SD. With this being said...

Official press release: San Diego is going to adopt Tacko, rough it up a bit and bring her down our way. Thank you, San Francisco. 

Okay, that is taking things a bit far but it is better than any other Mexican joint, taqueria or taco truck in the Bay Area. It's way overpriced but is a pretty solid fix for Southern Californians looking for a little slice of home. 

Naturally, I ordered the San Diego burrito which was loaded with cheese, pico de gallo salsa, guacamole and carne asada. It rang in at $8.25, which is a bit hard to stomach the burrito itself definitely was not. The tortilla was more cooked than I am accustomed to but everything else was pretty damn close to what we find in SD. Something that you don't often find down here is a place that can serve fast casual Mexican food and beer. They are few and far between but Tacko comes correct and will sling you a Tecate for a few extra bucks. 

The worst part about this place? The lack of salsa. They do have a bunch of different hot sauces in bottles but a salsa bar with a variety would do them some good. All in all, Tacko takes the cake, err, taco for as close as they come in SF.
author: Brad B.

description: It's nicks taco but in a better environment and more margarita selections. I have been here a few times and it doesn't disappoint. I've been here to drink with coworkers and friends a I've seen families here with kids. The neighborhood is awesome but parking might be difficult. Overall a great place for "gringo" Mexican food done right. Peacado nicks way is the best fish taco I've ever had. Grilled is good and the carne asada taco is awesome too. A fav is also the elote!
author: Bryant L.

description: I love tacko. I get the corn/bean/avocado salad. Also, they give you a free bag of chips with takeout orders (if you ask for 2 they'll give you 2!)
author: Molly G.

description: Three tacos from Tacko is a perfect-size lunch. Watch out: the homemade chips are addictive. I like the unlimited do-it-yourself refills on bubbly water.
author: Nate B.

description:
If you're looking for good Mexican food and a beer, this is a solid option. Their tacos are excellent and the portions are decent. Two tacos should be enough, three max if you're supa hungry. 

They have a decent selection of beer on tap. No Corona though, which was weird (to me?). They serve Modelo instead (eh, it works). Also, grab a cup of their "Agua Fresca." It's sort of like lemonade, but they have flavors ranging from Lime to Sangria. 

Be cautious on a Fri/Sat night around 8 or 9, this place gets crazy busy as people are getting ready to go out for the night.
author: Daniel B.

description: I yelped today while acting as tour guide for a friend from southern Spain. He wanted to eat a"Real Burrito " SF style! He's a vegetarian - I'm not. We were in the Marina heading for Marin Headlands GG Recreation Area. Tacko sounded like a good spot for us. It was excellent! His Vegetarian Burrito was just as good as my Carnitas Burrito. He talked about how much he enjoyed it, for the rest of the day.
author: Richard D.

description: The food here was good but I thought the chicken tacos were a bit soggy. My picky 9yo was taken aback when his quesadilla came fried instead of the usual grilled but he ended up loving it. The place had a good vibe and it was crazy busy.
author: Kim F.

description: Found this place as a tourist wandering about. These tacos were insane. The serving per taco is pretty big. All of the typical options but the ingredients are all very fresh and high quality. Everyone on the east coast complains about how they miss west coast tacos. I get it now!
author: Jessie H.

description:
Broke my Nicks / Tacko cherry over the weekend during the Union Street Fair. I was pretty hammered so things were blurry. 

However, my one remaining vivid memory was the frustration of not being able to shovel these tackos into my mouth fast enough. 

I ordered the carne asada, the fish taco, and corn on the cob. My mind was blown. The food offers fresh flavors that bind well together. Very clean. Think Chipotle versus a Mission taqueria but of course significantly better and has unique, individual flavors versus the mass produced chipotle.

They also have a myriad of hot sauces and salsas to further tailor your experience to your liking.
author: Peter T.

description: Best tacos and everything wrapped in SF. My new favorite place. This puts SF back in league with SD for tacos and burritos. Thank you nicks tacos for making tacos awesome again in sF
author: Jude N.

description: Great Mexican style burritos.  All the agua frescas taste fresh, not too sweet.  The staff is friendly, easy going, great for children.  We bring the kids here frequently because it is easy, good and fast.
author: Zoran M.

description: My favorite burrito place in the city! Not cheap but quick service, great options, and excellent food.
author: Miro M.

description: Very delicious carne asada burrito,the environment was very inviting and relaxing especially needed a place like this after driving 12 hours, will come back before we leave back home
author: Gilbert N.

description: The only food item I order here is the "Nick's Way" taco. It's soooo good. The chips, salsa, and guacamole is a huge serving and pretty good. Pretty much the only taco I'll eat in the city that serves the taco shredded white breast meat. I'm sure the carnita and asada are just as tasty! Another SF winner!
author: Ny H.

description: Very good vegetarian mexican food! Pretty cheap. It also has a ton of different hot sauces to experiment with!
author: Neil P.

description:
Omg. Maybe I'm just biased because tacos are my favorite food, but I love this place! If I lived near it I would order take-out all the time.
The street tacos are fantastic. I really like their carnitas and the huge selection of hot sauces. They are speaking my language! The sangria is pretty good as well.
It's an "order at the counter and take your number" kinda spot, so if you're in a hurry, this is a good place to stop in. My coworker and I stopped here before a comedy show an hour before it started and made it to the show in plenty of time. 
SO good.
author: Ina D.

description:
Carne Asada San Francisco Burrito.

Red Salsa.

Perfection.
author: Bryce F.

description: My favorite Mexico food. Love to come and have a burrito chips and salsa. Drinking Mexican margarita
author: Vivi T.

description: If you're in the Marina, this is an easy yummy spot to get your Mexican fix. I like the Quesadilla Suiza or Nick's Way Tacos (both are great for vegetarian's)! Oh -- and I am a condiments crazy person so I love all the spicy sauces you can add on the side.
author: Nicole D.

description: Straightforward menu and quick service. The burrito was big and delicious and paired with a cold beverage made it even better. The reviews about the place were great and not at all what I imagined the decor to be but it was super clean and nice. Friends tried other menu items and enjoyed theirs as well!
author: Lucy P.

description: Really fun spot to visit-- great location and vibe inside. Good selection of salsa and beer. Overall there tacos are pretty good but not great. Admittedly I've only had the "street tacos" but need to come back and try their other tacos and wide selection of burritos. Overall a great spot for reasonably priced Mexican food in Cow Hollow.
author: Dana B.

description:
Somewhat expensive for what it is. But it looks clean. 

The strawberry fresa is super delish. It's full of strawberry and some what thick so it's not your typical watery sugary mexican juice. Totally recommend this.

As for the $2 taco tuesday, I would pass on those. Your better off getting tacos at Lolo in the mission or a st taco truck. I most definitely will not pay full price for these tacos. The steak was a but tough and the carnitas was just so so.
author: Carrie Y.

description:
Sorry but this is Mexican food for people who think Chipotle is authentic. 

What really peeves me about this place is the size of the food for the cost. I ordered the Mexican Burrito and I could quite literally connect my index finger to my thumb around the burrito. It was SO SMALL that I had finished the meal in the time it took to walk across the street and half way down the block. 

But before I ate that incredibly small burrito, I showed the register attendant how pitifully small it was. He told me -and I'm not joking- the following: "what can i say, its overpriced."

And I don't think I could have said it better. 

Pat
author: Patrick W.

description:
I'd put this place in the category of "Marina Mexican Food" but that's definitely not a bad thing! The food is amazing! If you're looking for a more "classic" burrito, I'd go with the San Francisco (my go-to). The chips, guac and salsa are always worth it. The tacos (Nick's way) are also fantastic. For me, the tacos are best eaten there, fresh, but the burritos travel perfectly. 

I live a few blocks away and honestly still love the place. If I'm not eating there, I tend to order online (and pay!) ahead of time so I can skip the line and long wait.
author: G R.

description:
The Nantucket posters on the wall are all you need to see to know this place does not know how to do Mexican food. 

I'll gladly bring a real burrito to anyone who thinks this is good. The k in taco stands for keep away!
author: Peter B.

description: Everything that Nick's Crispy Tacos used to be, but with a slightly weird Nantucket theme.  Nick's way is still best.
author: Joanne G.

description:
They need a huge lit up neon sign that states wheat tortillas are the normal tortilla for burritos. If I hadn't skipped lunch I would have thrown the burrito back at the white boy who handed it to me. This is what I get for ordering a burrito from a place that isn't my go to spot in SF.

Nothing good ever comes from leaving your comfort zone. I already know the best spot, why did I try this trash out? Their red salsa was weird too. Had a sweetness to it. 

It's probably my fault for not reading the fine print, but when I go into a burrito spot that touts a mission style burrito, that thing better be wrapped in a flour tortilla, and it better be the size of Barry Bond's steroid needle.

It came out triple wrapped in foil, and wasn't very big. I don't have a problem with gentrification, but things like this cross the line.

Whatever, lesson learned.
author: Matt M.

description: I do like the relaxed vibe here and the food is pretty good, too. I came here after a run with several friends and I got the street taco platter, with three tacos (chicken, carne assada and carnitas). I would say the carnitas was my favorite, with the carne assada #2 and not a big fan of the chicken. They bring the food very quickly and there are plenty of hot sauces to choose from. The two house hot sauces (one red and one green) are great, too. Definitely a keeper!
author: Alice W.

description:
I've never given a Yelp review, but had to after having my first taco 'Nick's Way'. 

Simply put: top five food item I've ever had. If you're at home trying to decide what to eat and have stumbled upon this review, please do the following: 

Drop your phone. 
Get to Tacko however you fastest can. 
Order a taco(s) Nick's Way. 
Eat the glory. 
Dwell in your happiness.
author: Adam C.

description: Ok yes- this place is in the Marina. With that said, it comes complete with Marina prices and Marina people. Never have I ever paid 35 bucks for 5 tacos in my life. However, those were the best darn tacos I've ever had. Nicks way is just genius! I had the fish, shrimp and a chicken taco nicks way. Definitely full of deliciousness and flavor. I seriously had no problem dealing with the fact I was in the marina once I started eating. Definitely in love
author: Heather S.

description:
Great dine in experience; love the chips and guacamole and the tortilla soup is amazing! I'd give it more stars but through various delivery services as well as pick up in general, there's been a downward consistency for what you are charged for and what is delivered/given. 

Best advice: possibly save time and money but only eat in to ensure you get your money's worth which dine in version of Tacko seems to be able to deliver on much more effectively than take out.
author: Alexis B.

description: Their guacamole and salsa is SO good. I like the fish tacos as well but they aren't anything spectacular.
author: Molly B.

description:
Best Taco. Better than any I've had in the mission, tacolicious, and in my opinion better than Nicks even though they are supposedly identical. I also really liked their California burrito. Aside from that, they have an epic hot sauce selection, and the salsas at each table are awesome. I can never get just one taco here (and the tacos are a very generous portion) always end up pigging out. Also it is kinda cool how it is all Nantucket themed. 

The point is I eat here more than I'd like to admit but it's absolutely worth it.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Really yummy food and high quality. I almost never eat meat but recently had a side of their pastured beef "carne asada". It was fabulous and cost a mere $6.50 for a whole bowl. Their lobster roll is better than at some other more famous seafood places like Woodhouse. 

The only reason i don't give this place five stars is that the noise level is often unbearable from screaming kids and/or packed house of loud customers. I'm happier getting take-out or at least remembering to bring earplugs.
author: Ellen H.

description: Huge portions of delicious, fresh food. Loved their chicken and tortilla soup which has almost a half chicken's meat in there and is perfect for sharing. Wish their tortilla chips had a little less oil, though
author: Amrapali T.

description: Good Mexican food, nothing super creative but well done basics. Good lobster roll, weird at a Mexican place but so is the Nantucket themed decor which is actually fun and refreshing in this area, almost novel. Huge variety of bottled (store bought) hot sauces. Reasonable prices, neighborhood feel, good variety of aguas frescas.
author: D. H.

description:
Awesome and disappointed at the same time. I stopped in here while walking by and noticed the massive line. Ended up ordering one of each of their street tacos and a Baja fish taco. Now my rating is based on all the tacos overall if I just ordered beef it would be 5 stars. 

Beef taco was 5/5 it was amazing. I'm not normally a beef taco fan I prefer shrimp fish or pork but this was by far the best. Awesome. 

Chicken taco 3/5 it was ok, nothing too special. Have had better but also have had much worse. Generally chicken are my least favorite but wanted to give theirs a shot. 

Pork Taco 2/5 was really disappointed. Anyone who has had real Mexican street tacos knows that pork are always the best and most authentic/popular. They are also usually my favorite but these really lacked any flavor and the texture was too chunky IMO. 

Baja Fish (nicks way) 3.5/5 this was pretty damn good but the fish itself lacked flavor and or seasoning. It also tasted quite 'fishy' in the way fresh fish should not. It was also missing the pico that was supposed to come with the nicks way. 

Overall it was a great choice and I would go back for just the beef tacos and maybe try a burrito.
author: Matt M.

description: Good place to get some "gringo" Mexican food. The San Franciscan burrito is soooooo good and packs fresh flavors.
author: Leanna P.

description:
This was my favorite burrito spot until they messed up my order 2 out of my last 5 trips. The first time I ordered a vegetarian burrito and they put meat in it. I sent it back after taking a bite  and they shrugged it off like it was no big deal, but the replacement was just fine. 

This time around I got a vegetarian burrito to go, drove about 20 minutes home to eat it, bit into it, and again, wrong. I called Tacko to let them know and again, the service... the person on the other line just said, "well all I can say is that I'm sorry and you can drive back and get another one."

No thanks.
author: Danielle L.

description: Great casual quick service spot to grab a burrito or taco. I believe it's the same owners as Underground Tacos in Irving. Staff is friendly and helpful. Good for solo or group dining.
author: Shea T.

description: One of the male workers was extremely rude and legitimately made my friend cry. He should not be working in customer service because he bringing down the establishment.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I got the "street tacos" (1 pollo, 1 carne asada, 1 carnitas). They were pretty bland... And dry!  I had to douse them with hot sauce.  DON'T get these!

My husband got the "California burrito" with carnitas, which was MUCH better. I wouldn't compare it to anything you'd get in the Mission, but if you come here, I would recommend it.

Margaritas were ok. Not very flavorful, but at least they had a decent amount of tequila.

Overall just an ok place.
author: Riz W.

description:
Walk in the door and the first thing you'll notice is that Tacko (love the name) isn't remotely Mexican.

That's one of my favorite things about it: Honesty. Finally, a burrito shop that recognizes that burritos are American food. Invented in San Francisco, really. The regional menu includes San Francisco and other American cities like San Diego. Even the map on the wall is, somewhat inexplicably, of part of Massachusetts.

The burritos are excellent. I've had both the carnitas and chicken San Francisco, and they even include a nicely toasted tortilla that has a bit of crackling crunch to it. The horchata is served in a generous 16-oz serving. It is a tad on the sweet side, but very tasty.

It's becoming a favorite go-to place for me in the neighborhood.
author: Craig G.

description: I was referred to have lunch in this spot & I am so glad I did! I ordered a chicken taco (Nick's Way) and let me start off by saying ordering ONE was my first mistake! I should have ordered like, 3! Ha Ha! It was some of the best guacamole I've ever had! They serve cola's in the old school bottles and the place feels fresh and airy. Quick service around lunch time even tho they were pretty busy. I will definitely be back! Great work Tacko!
author: LeeAnn C.

description:
Excellent! We got grilled fish tacos, shrimp quesadilla and chips & salsa. They also have a wide selection of sauces. Sparkling  water is a sweet bonus!
Highly recommend. Def be back!
Thank you!
author: Tatiana G.

description:
Baja style fish taco! Baja style fish taco! Baja style fish taco! 

There's a long line, but it's because it's great!
author: Clay P.

description:
Hmm coming from San Diego, I was excited to hear this place had a San Diego burrito. when I read there wasn't rice or beans in it , I was very confused. I ended up getting the carne asada SF burrito for like 10.75 - what a rip off. Anyways the burrito wasn't bad but it wasn't real mexican food. It's SF mexican food. So if you want a pansy burrito with pinto beans (wtf) and you are used to papalote grade burritos then this is your place. 
Side note this place is a NAUTICAL THEMED Mexican food restaurant...First time that has happened. Should have known.
author: Britt T.

description:
Miam!!! Really good, fresh ingredients, reasonably priced & people are really friendly there!

The place is also great and has a great vibe! 

Their fish burrito was yummy as hell!!!
author: Arnaud D.

description:
Nick's Way tacos more than make up for any shortcomings this place may have. It's not the coziest locale -- order at the counter, etc -- but they have beer on tap. 

I'm a fan. I'll be back.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Last weekend, I walked over to this fast-food restaurant for some Nantucket style burritos. There was a long line, and quite a long wait to get my food. I ended up ordering a Grilled gulf shrimp burrito (Marinated & grilled with cilantro, cabbage, red onions, poco de gallo and tomatillo salsa).

I think I was waiting for a total of at least 30 minutes (either in line or waiting for the food). SO SLOW! Not sure if it's entirely worth the wait.

However, I must say that the shrimp they used was definitely jumbo. I'm glad I ordered the gulf shrimp burrito, since it was refreshing and tasty at the same time. This restaurant is located in the Marina area, and just bustling at all hours. If you want something quick, this is not the place to be - but if you are willing to wait, then you will not be disappointed by the shrimp burritos here!
author: Yonnie C.

description:
Service was a little slow, even at 3-4pm (non peak hours). Similar Nick's Crispy Tacos, On all tacos you HAVE to get 'Nick's Way'! 

Pros:

Nice (3 table) outdoor space. Modern interior with many 'Nantucket' references .

Yummy, warm, and soft San Francisco burritos. Not as good as the mission but perfect for a quick lunch or dinner.

More then a few hot sauce options, including a red and green salsa already on your table.

Cons: 

For the quality of food, the price is a little high...it feels like your paying for the location more then the actual food.

The menu board is large and may be a little complicated. 

Many people waiting around counter, hard to tell who has ordered and who hasn't ordered.

OVERALL:

-Come if your in the Neighborhood, not nearly good enough to travel across town for.
author: King H.

description:
I give it a 3.5 , very attractive taco but did not amaze me in the inside . The flavor was just not there for me , actually I will give it a 3 out of 5 since it was expensive-

#latinopalette
author: Thomas P.

description:
Marina, Marina...Where shall I go you have flavors of everlasting Life.
I love this place with the whole fishermen theme it could give place like Long john slivers and Red lobster a run for it's money, and Rubios as well.

Alot of the food comes of as being very healthy, and that's okay.
I these days and ages the world loves healthy! Yet, don't be fooled this place have wonderful lobster rolls., and various types of tacos. 

I became a fan of their guacamole, you can tell if a place uses fresh ingredients 
so I give them the thumbs up on that note, this place has tortilla soup and drinks in a bucket, the only reason for a lack of a star....

Is I ordered A Burrito without "sour cream", and heaven forbid
It came with sour cream, come on gentlemen, to my own health benefit
IF I WAS ALLERGIC TO IT, YOU WOULD'VE KILLED ME!

I only yell that, just so you could be carefully about it, 
from this point onward ;)
author: Michael R.

description:
I am so beyond disgusted and disappointed with Tacko.  Let me tell you how it went from 5 star to 1 star in my eyes.

Tacko has COMPLETELY LOST me as a customer due to their unhygienic practices and their complete disregard for customer service and awareness.

I was eating here and ordered a fish taco. I took a bite and as I went in for my second, a COCKROACH crawled out from inside the taco.

I'll let you let this sink in for a second.

GROSS!!!!! I was shaking and so upset.  I went up to the counter to show them what had happened. The gentleman behind the counter looked at me without any concern and said they would simply make me a new taco.... ARE YOU FRIGGING SERIOUS?!?!?! I don't want a taco, I don't want anything from this place! I want you to be as upset as I am that there is a COCKROACH in my FOOD! How do you miss this?! My beloved Tacko place is now ruined forever. Not only that, they did not apologize, offer my money back or tell me they were going to correct the issue.

I hope the health department reads this because one way or another, this place needs a rude awakening. TAKE TIME IN PREPARING YOUR FOOD AND WATCH OUT FOR YOUR CUSTOMERS BEST INTERESTS! otherwise, you won't have any more customers to support your business.
author: Whitney S.

description:
Get:

Fish burrito - huge and bountiful.

Lobster roll - packed with a good amount of lobster meat.

Chips + Salsa + Guac $6.50 - Chips Thick and fresh,  Fresh pico de gallo, good guac.



Avoid:

Taco salad - Lacked a good amount of meat, the salad was quite plain besides the huge dollop of guac.  There was just lot of better items on the menu for $3-4 cheaper..
author: Steven F.

description: Great tacos! I got the taco salad and my husband and daughter got the tacos "Nick's way"! It's the best way! Quick, clean nice environment in the marina area.
author: Claire B.

description: They take way too long for your order, even when there seemingly no one in line. Food is still pretty good.
author: Mark A.

description: soggy burrito. picture made it look cripsy/toasted
author: Bharath B.

description: Very good lobster roll no mayonnaise involved ! Just like the one I had in Portland Maine , pretty happy right now. Cute place too. Very clean
author: Kristin K.

description:
It amazes me how many times I've been here, and  never written an actual review. At one point, I became a duchess, but was finally dethroned by some guy who has checked in for a whopping 38 times!  But I digress...

This review will be my collective top 10 tips on Tacko:

1- cantaloupe juice (when in season) is a MUST!
1.5- pick the red salsa. always the red salsa.
2- quesadilla suiza plus extra shrimp (you pay more but damn it's so worth it!!!) 
3- just add tequila...I do wish they would serve tequila, but their margarita-ish hits the spot every time. It's made from agave wine. 
4- Like shopping for that luxury purse, don't even ask how much their lobster roll will cost (market price).  Just take out your credit card, pay the good man the toll and say Geronimo! This ride will take your first bite from Nantucket to SFO within 15 mins. Like that girl group  Fifth Harmony sang...."baby I'm worth it!" Every bite to the penny. That buttery lobster goodness will make you wet (in the mouth..)
5- Guac over everything. 
6-Elote con queso: I've never been so full off $3! it's the best and cheapest lunch in the marina!! 
7- want a taco? When it's not Tuesday, ALWAYS make it Nick's way. 
8- ARE YOU HUNGOVER? get a San Diego burrito with the fries inside and Watermelon juice.  That food baby will keep you afloat working for the rest of you shift without taking your nunchucks and whacking a customer (writing from experience).
9- Call in your order and its ready for pick up within 10/15 mins. (Usually)
10- Lastly, The people working here from the owner to the cooks are all damn awesome humans-  Period! Never be that typical douchey drunk Marina folk and give them a hard time. Chill bro, just stuff your face with more GUAC!
author: Melanie D.

description: I LOVE this place. I don't live in San Francisco and my friends still comment that I come here too often. Carne asada is the best I've ever had and I used to live in what is essentially little Mexico. Quesadilla is bomb and the sangria is a must. The staff is really friendly and accommodating. Pro tip: get the sangria topped with a little watermelon juice--big thanks to the chic working there who recommended it the last time I was there. See you soon Tacko :)
author: Mikala W.

description:
We parked right in front of this place without the intent on going in. We were searching for food but the RIGHT food. Being that we were visitors of SF, it only made sense that while in the area, we experienced some of SF's best food options. 

I myself was on a self proclaimed 'Eat Pray Love' mission, so the eating part needed to be something I would not be able to get at home. We strolled around the street and found nothing to our favor. I will say this is not the area (imo) for tourists looking for a food place to peak their interest. That would be closer to Pier 39. This area seems to be better for people who are familiar with SF and know what they want. After walking up the block a little bit, we decided to double back and try our options here. GREAT CHOICE! 

When you walk in, the menu is pretty cut and dry with choices of Burritos and  Tacos and combinations, as well as Quesadillas and a few other typical options found at a Taco joint, including corn on the cob with a Mexican twist. We stared at the menu for awhile and decided to go looking for food elsewhere, but while we were here, we would get something to hold us over until we found 'the place' we wanted to be. My travel brother and I were both starving at this point. We ended up both ordering a chicken taco and I added the corn on the cob to my order. 

To our surprise, ONE TACO is VERY fulfilling. Inside was a hard shell and the outside was soft. The filling was abundant & flavorful. I ate the entire deliciousness that was this chicken taco before tasting my first bite of the corn on the cob. It was delightful. Seriously, I would have ordered another if only this one didn't fill me up so greatly. They have unlimited water that is served from some sort of water device that offers spritzer-like water as well as 'spring' water. The spring water was great and this is a big deal because if you love water like I do, then you know not all sips of it are created equally. Now about this corn: It came with some sort of cheese crumbs all over the outside of it. I don't even remember the combination of outside yums that were attached to this corn, but I do remember it was incredibly great ! One bite in and I couldn't stop. I kept biting and eating away even tho my stomach told me to stop. 

We both left extremely full and had to do some walking just to try to get our lives back together. My total was about 9 bucks with for both the taco and the corn on the cob. I caught a glimpse of someone's burrito and it looked LARGE and great !  

My only sadness is that I have to catch two planes just to get another taste of this food. I liked the atmosphere too. There was outside seating available and inside, pictures depicting Nantucket were all over the wall. It was clean and crispy and the guy behind the counter was friendly and helpful. Even the customers were nice and friendly! I have no complaints......- 

- ....well, that one about catching two planes to get there again....
yeah, that's a complaint. :/ 

They get the elusive five stars because as many tacos as I have had, some with double shells, I've yet to have one that was this good and this fulfilling.
author: Januarie Y.

description: Great spot for a quick bite in the Marina/Cow Hollow area! The "street style" tacos are yummy - and it's nice if you can't make a decision about what kind of taco you would like (which tends to happen to me). You have the option of chicken, carne asada, and carnitas. The guacamole is good as well and they always give you a heaping portion - definitely big enough to share. Another favorite thing on the menu is the mexican salad - most of the time I don't even add the dressing because the flavor is so good on it's own. I typically get it with carne asada! Overall a nice place to stop in for lunch or a quick weeknight dinner.
author: Teresa C.

description: The first time I visited SF, the friends I was staying with celebrated their Burrito Friday and ordered us all burritos from Tacko. In that week long trip I managed to go back to Tacko two more times. A year later when I visited again, I made sure to come another three times. Their guacamole is fresh, and their special sodas are delicious (the lime one is my particular favorite). I can't wait for my next trip to SF and this restaurant is one of the main reasons.
author: Dana V.

description:
Good burrito
Whole wheat by default is a plus
Free sparkling water
Nice people
Clean
author: Captain B.

description:
Been to Underdogs to try Nick's Crispy Tacos and liked them...came to Tacko a few Fridays ago because I had an appointment in the area...and I wanted to try their lobster roll!  Bf & I shared & ordered: the lobster roll, the fried fish taco done Nick's Way, & a California Burrito (with Carne Asada).

*Fish taco ($5.50): I don't even like fish (but am trying to eat it more) but fried makes everything better!  The avocado & of course just the fact that it was done Nick's Way made this taco so yummy!

*Lobster roll ($18): Filled with nice succulent pieces of buttery lobster meat in a nicely toasted buttered roll!  I've only had one other lobster roll, which was at the Lobster in Santa Monica, but I enjoyed this one so much more.  Don't give me a mayo lobster roll, show me the butter!  It was served with a bag of Cape Cod chips, wish it was served with homemade chips or fries.  

*California Burrito ($8.25).  It wasn't truely authentic and as good as Lolita's in San Diego or even Iguana's in San Jose, but it wasn't horrible.  Fries were more potatoey than crispy.  They also didn't include sour cream which is a major ingredient.

I don't think I would come out of my way to eat at Tacko, but I wouldn't mind coming back when I'm in the area.  Lobster roll...*drool!*  Fish taco Nick's Way...*drool x 2!*  

The wait for our food wasn't that long and though it's self serve the people working here are friendly.  And yes, it totally sucks that it's cash only...it's Marina for heaven's sake!
author: Cat C.

description:
I am sad after my California burrito from here.  

I lived in San Diego my whole life, born and raised. Recently moved up to SF after finishing school, I began to be burritosick and needed some comfort from a good ol' California burrito. I found this place from a few websites claiming "top burritos in SF" and luckily Tackos was just a couple blocks away from where I lived. 

Right off the bat, I already knew this wasn't an what it would be by reading the description: *Your choice of meat (strike 1, this should only be carne asada with an underground menu of Adobada), french fries (half strike for being thick cut), cheese (what kind of cheese was this? Did not blend well with the meat. Another half strike), and pico de gallo (strike 3). 

For those who want a quick review:
Wouldn't get the California Burrito again. 

Continued Rant for those who are interested: 
Where's the sour cream? The cheese? Too much cheese. Try spreading the cheese around, I bit into a chunk of it; also the cheese didn't go well with the meat. The meat had too much flavor that it was overwhelming. Also why was the burrito "toasted" on the bottom from the grill? To keep the burrito from opening? That's not how you keep it from opening, you use a bigger flour tortilla to help keep it closed. Also, what kind of tortilla was this? I'm expecting a floury, warm, soft tortilla. 

Saddened to say, I have yet to find my California Burrito twin up here in the Bay. 

The search continues.
author: Robbie P.

description: Just had a grilled fish taco nicks way and it was really mediocre.  Sad cause I actually used to like this place.  The fish had no seasoning and was overcooked.  I tried my husbands tacos as well and they were all really bland.  The oil that they used to fry the tortilla was also really old, leaving a bad aftertaste.  Food alone was 3 stars but the $8 price for a taco drops it to 2.
author: Olivia T.

description: I wish I would've taken a picture of the San Francisco burrito when there was something left... But after drinking all day at pride, this burrito hit the spot! The carne asada, pico de gallo, and guac was PERFECT!!! Even though I usually get refried beans in my burrito, (they didn't have them) I couldn't even taste the difference w pinto beans. Now when I go to Fillmore, I know where to go. Thank you Tacko for one of the best burritos!
author: Adrianna T.

description: SUPER IN LOVE WITH THE HORCHATA!!! I had the California burrito and I wasn't super impressed but the other items my friends ordered were really tasty. I recommend the tacos there. Oh and the red sauce that they serve was pretty addicting. Defiantly coming back again.
author: Giselle J.

description:
Fish tacos, watermelon aqua fresca, and margaritas are all great!

Was disappointed in the California burrito.
author: Kristen T.

description: Nothing fancy, but i liked it for a convenient lunch. Had options to eat outside or inside, reasonable pricing, and the food was tasty.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Just like nock's tacos or the tacos shop at underdogs. I prefer both to tacko though. Fish taco was just ok, sangria pail was cool but definitely had better else where and the chips and salsa was just it - chips and salsa. Definitely not your authentic Mexican restaurant, but I wasnt expecting it to be. 

I asked if the lobster roll ($15) was good. Shame on me for asking, shame on me for believing and shame on me for paying for it! It was this dinky roll, about the size of my palm. Ok so it was kind of good, nice pieces of lobster, and the roll was nicely toasted. But it did not fill me up! They knew this too since it came with a small bag of chips. 

No repeating.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Love LOVE LOVE. SO fresh tasting, big portions. The Nicks Way Taco is AMAZEBALLS  When Im Back In SF i Will Def. Stop Here Again .
author: Elise C.

description:
...Still great food, Still great taste.....I forgot to mention about all of the chilli condiments one can choose from....many placed don't give you this choice. They also have non-rice with whole wheat tortilla burrito....this is a nice option for some pre diabetic folks
Keep up the good work guys!!
author: Alex W.

description:
If you like Nick's Crispy Tacos, you will like it here. They serve the tacos "Nick's way", which is the only way. They have a lot more options on the menu and a variety of drinks. The chicken tacos and the fish tacos were good. The elote con queso ($3.50) was tasty! 

You can't really go wrong with their guacamole, so be sure to give that a try. The place fills up though, the line quickly formed out the door when we visited on a Friday night.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Nice place, easy to find, parking is a bit difficult in the area. 
Nice and spacious layout inside.

Friendly service, it was kind of odd that the waiter stopped us and handed us our food while we were still figuring out where to sit. I suppose that just means its really fast service which is a plus in my book

Cost: kind of too pricey for the portions. $14 for quesadilla and horchata
Taste: street style tacos: chicken needs more seasoning other than salt, carne asada and carnitas tacos were delicious with great flavors. didn't even have to add any additional sauce to the carne asada meat. Quesadilla had a lot going on. The outside seemed nicely fried yet felt very light and not oily. Ingredients were very fresh, salsa was great and the meat was yummy. 

Overall it was a good experience, I would come again but probably not too often to break the bank.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
1ST WRITTEN REVIEW EVER and hopefully the last worst experience ever!
I AWOKE OUT OF MY SLEEP AT 4:35 A.M. to sign up for Yelp and get this out there!

This was the worse burrito experience ever! They need to tackle some fresh products first off! 
The Gulf Shrimp where not sliced and cleaned properly and offered a horrible taste. Compiled with a LOAD of their cabbage mix. I am horribly pissed off. 
I eat well on a regular and was tired after work and tried it just because of the name and prime location. Well that's all they have going.

Quality, Preparation, Presentation and Flavor Matter. You've been warned! 
1* is to satisfy the comment process only. Dead serious
Signed Very Disgruntled
author: Najwa R.

description: Love love love this place! So good! The Burritos are amazing - specifically the SF Burrito with chicken. The green and red sauce it comes with are delicious, the chips are great, and I crave their guacamole daily. GET THE GUACAMOLE!
author: Amy L.

description: Great place for authentic burritos in the Marina. Get the guac and share with a few friends. The beer selection is quite good also. Try the carne asada!
author: Kim O.

description:
The knocking of stars for not being authentic is beyond me. Why would anyone expect authenticity when the biggest indicator (the decor) that Mexican authenticity is not what they are going for is apparent as soon as you walk in the door? This would be like going to Olive Garden and knocking them for not serving up authentic Italian fare. 

But wow. Whatever stereotype of the Marina crowd that has been conjured up were all present at Tacko. It was July 4th and everyone there was feeling extra festive and probably saw more drunk guys in sunglasses in American flag shorts than I ever care to. 

I've managed to enjoy my watermelon fresca and inhaled 2 of Nick's tacos in between girls yelling their orders across the room to their friend waiting in line (really?!), the guy showing off his "007" order number and some guy who either had Tourette's or was just being an obnoxious asshat yelling out profanities randomly throughout his meal. (My sincerest apologies if it's the former) Everything got just too loud and too much so we got out of there as soon as possible. 

Besides that the food is really not so bad in my opinion. I'd take this over Chipotle any day.
author: Esther A.

description: The food is fine.  Better than most Mexican places in the Marina.  However, be warned it is very expensive.   Three burritos, a beer, and a Horchata cost $53 .   They are not messing around here on prices.   I recommend sticking with the burritos .   The Mexican street food tacos are another way of saying super small tacos and super big price.   Nice environment to sit and eat though.
author: Bill S.

description: Excellent good! My favorites are the fish tacos and carnitas quesadilla.
author: Summer A.

description:
Good enough but not great.

Had a fish burrito here, and although the fish was fresh, it just had way too much cabbage.  it was a good sauce, but the slaw altogether was just completely masked the fish.  Although the salsa and hot sauce rounded things out nicely, the fish was really gone from it all.

I also had some horchata here, which I thought was way too sweet.  It was nice and buttery, but over-sweetened.

This is indeed more New England, like the pictures on the wall, than Mexican.  You can do better in the City.
author: Mark M.

description:
Couldn't really tell if the burritos were good or bad.  I want to say that they're like a mixture of something you'd find at a hole-in-the-wall place in the Mission and Chipotle, but my taste buds were going nuts......... mostly because I wanted to try as many of the hot sauces on the hot sauce wall as possible.  

And even though I ended up with heart burn, it's a must-do.  Where else can you try a million and a half types of hot sauce / salsa!?

You'll want to alleviate the fire in your mouth with some of their horchata, too.  Or margarita.  Just don't go with the white sangria because it tasted like nothing.......

In any case, I highly recommend coming here after / during / before day drinking in the area.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I can't help but just love this place. Their burritos are delicious (recommend the San Francisco burrito with carne asada), and their green salsa is amazing. 

And now if you will excuse me, I need to get another one ASAP.
author: Jane F.

description: A burger with French fries?!? These people are truly after my heart. The prices are really affordable for being in S.F. And the food is great. I only wish the place was a little bigger as all of the tables were full when we dined here. It was a little loud inside when we came, which was perfect as we brought the kids and their screams were not ruining anyone's meal. All in all we will definitely come back when we are in the city!
author: Chris M.

description: Glad to find this Nantucket twist on the San Francisco burrito scene. The toppings are fresh and the meats I've tried have been tender and deeelicious.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Wow, great tacos and guacamole with chips and salsa.  

Had two tacos -
1) carne asada which comes Nick's way - two taco shells, a crispy fried taco enclosed by a soft taco shell.  Piled with jack cheese, pinto beans, salsa, and guacamole.  
2) the Baja fish taco - beer battered fish on two soft corn tacos with slaw.

Given a choice, I'd go with having every taco Nick's Way.  $1.50 extra if not served that way.

Plenty of seating.  Select seating from several counters on high bar type stools or grab a table which is picnic table style.

Compostable flatware and food served in plastic baskets.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Basically identical to Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk & Broadway, with the following differences-

1) They run their own alcohol and have some nice beers on tap (as opposed to Rouge handling the booze for Nick's)

2) Slightly expanded menu

3) Seems a bit more organized and the order seemed a bit more 'smoothly executed' than what I get from Nick's

4) They accept credits cards where Nick's is CASH ONLY.

In a vacuum, I'd pick Tacko over Nick's, but they are basically identical and I'll continue going to Nick's only because it is closer to my apartment!
author: Andy S.

description: If you like fish tacos you'll love this place. They also have yummy giant burritos. Can get busy during lunch and dinner time so I try to go in the off hours. Always on my list when we visit S.F.
author: Candia M.

description: Very good food!!! Nick's way tacos are great, mainly the carnitas one. Burritos are also awesome.
author: Ingo A.

description:
8pm on a Tuesday night.  Dropped in here for a quick bite while on an aimless walking tour of the hood.  The 30min wait in line was not bad... it gives the eyes a chance to acclimate to the universe that is this strange, strange place.  The walls are white.  Everything is perfect, like a magazine.  They have a nice accessible water-station that you can hit up while in line for the ride.  At this amazing oasis of refreshment, not only do they have REAL glasses, there's also have a machine that dispenses fizzy-water(all for free).  A woman comes to the front for a pick-up order, cradling a dog in her right arm... some little exotic breed with frizzy fur.  Once edging closer to the front of the line, you will have finished your water, prepared for the visual onslaught your eyes will experience.  Behold the aguas frescas.  Wow.  So many colors.  I want them all.  But the woman behind the counter is staring at me.  I need to order, but I can't hesitate and cause a rift.  I haven't even glanced at the menu yet.  Maybe I should have spent less time staring at the huge painted map of the kingdom of Nantucket on the wall, wondering if they're ruled by a benevolent leader who is wise and brave.  "One American wagyu kobe beef carne asada california burrito for me... and a taco vegetariano for my attorney"  Did I read it right?  At this point, I'm reconsidering my decision to have eaten the entire cookie before coming here, but the rule of irreversibility is definitely at play in this case.  The show must go on.  The food seems to be taking an eternity, but time moves in a different fashion here.  The hot-sauce choices are so numerous that it takes up two entire shelves on the wall.  Turning to the dining room, in front of you unfolds a montage of guys with boat-shoes.... and woo-girls with dyed blonde hair.  While the well-rehearsed laughs may seem hystrionic at first, they are actually marina mating-calls.  It's important that we don't disrupt them, lest their natural predators become aware of their presence.  The burrito comes.  It is amazing.  With restraint, one can make two meals out of a it... but wait, they already thought of that too!  At the dish/utensil depository, there are foil sheets you can use to wrap up something for later.  Perfect.  

Reflecting upon the experience, I admit the prices are a little beyond-proletarian, especially if you indulge in their extensive selection of beverages.  I'm guessing a certain portion of the clientele pays from "expense accounts".  

Tacko is the latest and greatest venture of Nick Fasanella.  He's a good guy that got short-changed in a business deal secured only by handshake.  There's an interview of him somewhere online, but that's a rabbit-hole - all you need to know is that this is his inspiring comeback.
author: Mike R.

description: Terrible experience. Waited 20 min for a $14 California burrito which ended up having no French fries and sour cream inside although I clearly asked for it on the side. Also, even though they are the same price, this over-priced joint refused to do half chicken, half carnitas. Terrible place with terrible service.
author: Patrick T.

description:
A good, somewhat quick stop for quality tacos. I have only gotten the Nicks tacos, chicken. Its loaded w shredded chicken thats full of smokey flavor and topped w delicious pico de gallo, gauc, and cheese (no beans for me! #pickyeater). 

All taco orders come w a handful of crispy chips and two salsas, a green and a brown one that i cant figure out what it is but its absolutely delicious. Its perfect for topping your taco off or dipping your chips, spicy, smoky, and just so addicting. All for like $5! Pretty filling for a "small" order.
author: Negra T.

description: A California style carne asada burrito is the way to go! Highly recommend adding chips/guacamole to the meal!
author: Rob F.

description:
Love this place!

They use fresh, quality ingredients and the portions are great. I love that each ingredient is well thought out and prepared. I'm a fan of their corn and black bean salad with steak. They also have tasty fresh house made salsa and a huge selection of bottled hot sauces available for use. 
 
Their staff is also awesome! Today I ordered take out and when I got home my order wasn't right. I called in and the staff was very helpful and went out of their way to fix it. They even went so far as to offer me extra sides for the trouble.  

Highly recommend!
author: Hayley N.

description:
Walking into a taco shop that's Nantucket themed is a bit disorienting at first. I questioned how could this place have any decent Mexican food... boy how I was wrong!

Service: The service is great. The line can get a little long sometimes but the food is always out in a couple of minutes. The staff is very sociable as well. The bus staff is really quick as well (they're most likely trying to flip tables since it's so busy there, but I appreciate the attention to clearing up tables).

Food:
I personally love the California burrito. I come home from work on bad days and crave the crispy goodness. The potatoes are perfectly crispy and they crisp the outside of the burrito too. It's one of those burritos you lay awake at night and dream of.

The tacos are small - but they're street style so that's to be expected. They're good tacos, and are an especially good deal on Taco Tuesday (don't forget that $2 Tacate on Tuesday too!). 

This place has become a staple of mine since moving to California. I highly recommend this for a quick high quality food option. Sure there are move unique and fun places in the mission, but this is the perfect close to home option.
author: Pierce S.

description: NEVER EAT HERE if you are a vegetarian or selective in which meat you eat. The "cooks" made a mistake and put beef in my burrito and when I found it by taking a big bite and told the workers they told me it must've been a mistake and not to worry about it. They were not at all concerned about the fact how someone who hasn't eaten meat in over 15 years would feel about this "mistake" no refun, no nothing. I used to be a fan, but will never be back along with everyone I came with
author: Alison S.

description: My mom and I actually stopped here for a beer at night because it was 1 min away from the house we stayed. We had street tacos with a side of guacamole and draft beers. They only had 4 draft beers but I think they had pretty wide selection for bottled beers. Anyway, we loved the tacos. I'm not a big fan of tacos but their carne asada taco was so good. The staffs were friendly too. I would come back for here for tacos anytime!
author: Jessie J.

description: It was okay.  I was excited to see a San Diego style burrito.  I grew up on the border and am used to my burritos without the rice and beans in them.  The pico de gallo was way too juicy.  My tortilla was a soggy mess.  Next time I will definitely have them hold the pico de gallo.  Otherwise, it would have been pretty good.
author: S. Y.

description: This place was just a-ok....if you love yourself some dirty Mexican tacos this might not be the place for you...if you like modern style tacos then this place is aight.  Ordered two tacos chips n salsa and a beer and it came out to be $23.  Pretty sure I can get all that for 12-15 bucks at any authentic taco shop.  Ok I'll stop comparing, but I ordered the fish and shrimp tacos.  My advice is to always get it nicks way.  I got one with and one without and wish I had got them both nicks way.  You can skip out on the shrimp it was meh. The end
author: Vince L.

description: I had been pretty pumped about Tacko's lobster rolls before, so went back recently. Sadness. The quality went out the window. Now the lobster is overcooked and rubbery. Hoping it was an off-day.
author: Eli B.

description: Seems to be a very nice place, but I'm kinda turned off. Standing in line I could see into the open kitchen. The guy with the black clothes constantly licked his fingers and then touched the food again without a glove while also constantly eating from the food he was preparing. I was really grossed out. Someone like this doesn't belong into a kitchen.
author: Alex S.

description: Some of the best burritos I have ever had - and that's including those found in the Mission. Generally busy but that's because the food is amazing. Worth checking out (and coming back weekly)
author: Prateek K.

description: Nope, place feels tacky for a taco joint, food only moderately over priced but there are better places to get Mexican food nearby.
author: j d.

description: I'm a fan of the carnitas and the carne asada nick's way tacos. My only complaint is that cilantro is built into both the pico de gallo and the guacamole, and as someone whose tastebuds firmly believe that cilantro ruins everything, that's not ideal. Two usually do the trick for me, even when I'm hungry.
author: Megan B.

description: Pretty solid. Vegetarian here. Don't get the street tacos (vegetarian) because they're not filling enough. But the Nicks Way veggie tacos are awesome.
author: Nitesh D.

description: Had the salad with shrimp added and it was DELICIOUS!!! I sat at the bar seating area near the kitchen and the chef happened to be standing there and was helpful in answering some of my dressing/ ingredient questions as I'm going to be doing a Whole30 soon and wanted to see how this salad could be modified. But YUM for the salad with some of the spicy habanero salsa added, the roasted corn and cotija are nice additions to the flavor
author: Sarah A.

description:
They were right to call this place Tacko and not taco cus you aint gonna get a real taco in this joint.  The food isn't bad but it is certainly not authentic.  It is a white guy's idea of what Mexican food is or should be.  Bland but hearty.

Having said that, I will ease up slightly and say that the food we ordered was okay.  Not great but definitely eatable.  I just don't like Mexican restaurants that cater to the douche bag Marina types.  Come here one time and you will see what I am talking about. (People staring at the menu for 10 min holding up the line asking lame questions about ingredients etc. You can literally smell their entitlement.)

One other issue for me.....I happened to be there on an evening where some of the locals had a large group.  It was so loud and obtrusive that the staff should have told them to calm down and stop with all their Alpha Beta Pie Secret handshakes and chanting.  I think they were literally too scared to tell them to shut up.  Come on Tacko.....I think you are better then this.

Will I be back?  Probably not.
author: Brian S.

description:
Personally, I think the Mexican fare in my hood is pretty lacking with the exception of tacko. I've been several times now and have found my fav to be the fish tacos "nicks" way. The burritos are good too but the tacos are where it's at for me. The lines can be long so here's a tip: order online on the way and skip the line. 
The large interior with lots of table space is a plus for me too. Additional they have a couple seats outside.  Grab some friends and a pitcher of modelo and enjoy!
author: Mark N.

description: Probably the best burrito in the marina, though a little bit pricier than other places. I get the San Francisco, and the ingredients taste very fresh, also the salsa verde is amazing!
author: Robert P.

description: Fresh amazing food, best non traditional Mexican food in the area hands down. This location is always clean and has a good chill crowd. Get the Carne Asada  San Diego burrito or the fish tacos nicks way.
author: Alexis A.

description:
The food is fine.  I like the atmosphere and I appreciate the concept, but I just don't really like their food.  It is bland. The seafood is over cooked every time I go.  I have had it in tacos, salads and even the lobster roll but that is all.  The meat might be delicious.

I just don't think it is worth it.  I would eat somewhere else.
author: Courtney C.

description:
Got two baja tacos nick's way - they were good. I like the sauces on the table to dress them up. HOWEVER, coming to this place after going to Underdog's ruined it for me I think; somehow, the tacos weren't as good. The place was loaded with really loud, drunk Marina people on a Wednesday night.

+ fresh fish, good amount of guac
+ self serve water - VERY important


- shell wasn't as crispy as at Underdog's
- longggg wait times
- chips + salsa = soggy by the time they got to us
author: Sarah B.

description:
Note: I have only ever gotten the chicken SF burrito here, since why would you need anything else, so this review focuses on that!

This is a good place to go to if you need fast counter service and want some tasty burritos. The burritos by default come with a whole wheat shell, and the whole wheat is done well, not overwhelmingly dry as whole wheat can be. The chicken is white meat, so it can also be a little dry... But I do feel healthier after eating this burrito than at other places!

The place is Nantucket themed, which I don't fully understand how that fits in with tacos, but it's cool.

The seating here is a little odd. The majority is bar stools, where the stools dont move and are an awkward distance from the table (for me). They do have some booths, but those fill up first.

One of my favorite things about tacko: sparkling water on tap! Free bubbles!
author: Emily L.

description:
Food is good, a bit pricey.

Nick's way tacos are awesome. One is enough for most, two is enough for me. The salsas on the table are pretty good, too.
author: max m.

description: As a proud Bostonian visiting SF, this place made me feel at home. The restaurant's theme is Nantucket, MA. I ordered the chicken taco Nick's way. It was pretty solid, except the chicken seemed like it was boiled. However, I tried some of my friend's carne asada quesadilla which was UNREAL. Not your typical flat quesadilla. It's more of a fried burrito. I'd definitely come back for the quesadilla.
author: Kevin L.

description: Second time going to Tacko for lunch. Really wanted to love this place but the disappointment of today's food will probably keep me from coming back. Got the Mexican tacos and elote. All the meat was pretty average. Chicken was the best. That doesn't say much though because the carnitas and carne asada were dry and flavorless. I didn't eat the carne asada since I didn't see the point. I filled up on chips and salsa, which were the best part of the meal. Red and green salsa are tasty. I don't like to much spice so they are my kind of salsa. Elote was fine. Probably better to eat in the restaurant though. Kinda feels like I flushed $15 down the drain. The decor of the place is lovely. I wish the food was too.
author: Mag L.

description:
Enjoyed my 'Nick's Way' carnitas tac(k)o and sparkling H2O. Clean facilities and friendly service were also appreciated. The name is fun to say as well.

To the woman who connived with me to snag some Chupa-Chups yesterday (5/2/2015) around 8:30pm, I'm single and not drunk anymore. Message me or something.
author: Jake L.

description: Really tasty! The tortilla soup in particular is excellent and portion is huge. The Nantucket theme was really cute and the service was fast and friendly. Would definitely go back!
author: Caroline B.

description: This review is for Chris, the owner.  Chris demonstrated a high regard for customer service in the way he handled a problem that I had.  I've been eating at the restaurant for quite some time, and have always enjoyed the quality of the food.  i didn't realize, however, that the respect I was given when a problem arose would be so superb,
author: Ellen M.

description: It was a dark and stormy night when my girlfriend (JennyEatsSF) and I decided to go watch a Beatles Tribute band. But things got stranger as the night went on. After the concert, we ended up at a taqueria. THAT HAD POSTERS OF NANTUCKET! And this taqueria served corn. BUT NOT JUST ANY CORN! :O It was corn that had been rolled in parmesan cheese!!! :O :O :O We proceeded to finish our Nantucket tacos before walking outside only to see groups of young people dressed up to the nines for a night on the town. I turned to her and said "Toto...I don't think that we're in college anymore..."  o_o
author: Joshua F.

description:
Tacko has amazing quesadillas and great service! 

My experience at Tacko exceeded my expectations even though I had heard great things. We had the Mexican "Street Style" Tacos, the chicken quesadilla, and the chips with guacamole. Everything was really good, but the quesadilla and the guacamole will definitely make me come back next time I feel for mexican food. Also, the server who took our order was very nice and added to the experience.
author: Erica W.

description:
I quite enjoyed my visit here today. Not too crazy busy during lunch and plenty of seating. 

Got the salsa and chips and chicken taco Nick's way. Minus 1 star because the salsa and chips should really be called salsa and pico, not really my thing. The taco? AWESOME. Major om nom nom. The guacamole was delish- wish there had been more on there! Plenty of chicken and cheese too. Crunch and soft tortilla combo is an excellent touch. I highly recommend!
author: Rose R.

description: Whoever owns this place is a prick. They don't accept out of state ID's. The food is great, but so disappointing a well-known place in San Francisco won't buy an ID scanner to test out of state ID's. Definitely will not be returning.
author: Ryan L.

description: My favorite San Francisco taco/ burrito joint hails from Nantucket?   Sounds like a limerick.  I recommend the San Diego style and the grilled shrimp burritos. The skinny guacamole -- a must.  Great food, great place, truly friendly and attentive service -- too bad it's filled with drunks on the weekend -- but oh well, that's a critique on the Marina District and not this place.  What else can I say other than Tacko meets my picky standards, food is delicious and fresh!
author: Marlene E.

description:
I can see why some people might call this "whitewashed" Mexican food.  After all its in the Marina right?  Seriously who needs authentic when you have this place?  The best part of Tacko is that it's high quality food at reasonable prices.  They take all of these excellent ingredients and put them into great tacos and burritos.
