I went recently and had a plate of great fish tacos along with some awesome chips y salsa y guacamole too. (always a good yardstick and the chips+guac did not disappoint.  Plus the restaurant itself is a nice clean place. 

I dream about having these fish tacos again. They are that good!!
author: David Z.

description: To go order as well as online orders. Seems to be most of the time crowded. No line around 5:30PM. Large variety of taco combinations and good selection of drinks. Grilled fish and American Kobe beef burrito's and tacko are excellent.
author: L. G.

description:
solid solid solid. a little pricey for mexican food. (i used to live in LA where the tacos were a buck and burritos 4 bucks) but the quality is great!

will be coming back!
author: Eric L.

description: Food is okay but service is not good. They take forever and if you order to go from the store, they put you behind all the other Togo orders, including online and call-in. If you have 30 min to wait for a burrito, try it out. If you're looking for a quick bite, stay away.
author: Kristy M.

description: In honor of Cinco de Mayo i will post this belated review. the burritos here are really good...i love the san francisco burrito. the green sauce that comes with it is my jam too. they also have a easy online menu and ordering system if you just want to take out. It is my go to spot int he hood if I am not heading to my secret (well not really secret) spots throughout the city. yay for Tacko!
author: Derek S.

description:
Okay so people are going to hate me for this review but I only speak the truth and in all fairness, Tacko is beyond overrated and it under-delivers on all counts. 

Seafood baja taco you ask? Ummm it's flavorless and chunky in texture. I tried some of my friend's chicken taco and it was rather bland and undercooked as well. 

I compare Tacko with Chipotle and have to say that Chipotle is infinitely better. Since there isn't a Chipotle nearby, however, I would recommend checking out Tacolicious or even Nick's before coming here. 

Don't waste your time and mullah on this mediocre and subpar Mexican "fast food" spot.
author: Priya S.

description:
Considering Marina prices, I'm just glad I can get full for $8 somewhere in the neighborhood.  I get a cheese quesadilla (suiza) with rice and beans on the side.  I'm stuffed all day.  Thank you Tacko.

Avoid: horchata, tacos, fish facos.  these are pretty damn awful.
author: Amber R.

description:
Fresh food, quick service, and cute ambiance!

I ordered the mahi mahi burrito for $9.50 and it was very large and tasty. It was a little spicy but I have a very low tolerance! 

My friends ordered a chicken quesadilla (which was good but a little greasy) and two San Francisco burritos. We also got the chips and salsa (1.50)
author: Roya B.

description: Good place, I tired the 3 cheese quesadilla and it tasted average. I have had better and worse so it didn't really stand out. Chicken tacos are pretty good. If I return I would try something different.
author: Alex T.

description:
I really love Tacko. If you're coming for Mexican food, don't bother. If you're coming for whatever this is, like  Mexican food done via the Betty Crocker Cookbook circa 1963, it's perfect. Tortillas that are deliciously toasted with a buttery, flaky crisp edges (what? In a burrito? Wtf?) And, of course, my favorite:  Nick's way Shrimp Crunchy/Soft double tortilla throw down. Best of all is the huge array of aguas frescas which can all be mixed and matched for further expanding your drinking options.

Protip: Jamaica/Lime and Watermelon/Lime mix particularly well.
author: Logan B.

description: I regretted giving a 15% tip, the service was terrible.  They forgot to put in a ticket for our order, we waited almost 30 minutes for a taco while we watched others who came in after us get their food.  Granted it was a busy Saturday night, but between poor service, marina bros and expensive tacos ... I think I'll pass next time.  One last thing, I don't get the Nantucket themed walls, it's SF and you are selling tacos!
author: claudia v.

description:
same delicious food at Nick's but in a quieter environment with more seating, yeah!

I love the skinny guac; veggies and guacamole with a salty/spicy lime flavor

one thing I want to mention to management; there are a lot of families with kids in the Marina - the bathroom is really big and has room for a child's changing station, please put one in! I had to change my newborn on the floor today (put down paper towels and a changing pad) and it was really awkward... but I didn't want to change her on the table or bar counter where food is served...
author: Beth P.

description: After walking around for several hours I was craving some Mexican food. I am so happy I found this place. I had the very yummy vegetarian burrito. It was a pretty good size which I liked since everything in the Bay Area is so expensive! I really felt like I got my money's worth. They have every hot sauce you could possibly think of! Sriracha, yes please!!! The only thing that I did not like was there was only one bathroom! Toilet seat down! I am talking to all men here! That is all.
author: Lindsay S.

description: I had here the better burritos in my life! The guacamole is good and huge portion ! Staff was very friendly .
author: Donna K.

description: I ordered 2 Nick's Way Carne Asada Tacos and did not leave disappointed. The two tacos were big enough for an entire meal. There was a long line but it was definitely worth the wait.
author: Shane M.

description:
One of the best burritos in the Marina area.  Their meat in particular is delicious, and this is one of the few places I know of in SF that has California burritos (something I miss dearly from my days in San Diego).

The chips and salsa they give you are also great.  And if you eat there, they have a massive number of hot sauces to try (score!).

It's a bit expensive, but not unusual for this part of town.  Get over paying the extra $2 for a burrito and just enjoy.  Plenty of seating inside and some outside too, which is convenient.
author: Tristan Z.

description:
I've been to Tacko a dozen times and love it. Fresh, clean, flavorful ingredients without too much grease. Two of my favorite orders are their Taco Salad with chicken and their Vegetariano Burrito with chicken added. Perfect for a casual lunch or dinner. 

Some might call it 'bland'... If you're looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant then you should probably head to the Mission.
author: Katie V.

description:
If you're planning on getting a burrito, you are making a mistake.  The quesadilla is basically the exact same thing, but it has been fried and has an awesomely flakey crusty shell.  

The chips and salsa are a great deal, and the chips are good and homemade.

The two other big highlights of Tacko are the hot sauce collection and then the fact that they have good carbonated water on tap.

Good ambiance, good food, good perks.
author: Zack H.

description:
I just ate at Tacko for the first time and I was very impressed! I was looking all over Union street for a good tacqueria and finally gave up when I found this place. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in and saw the food proportions on other customers' plates. I ordered two crispy chicken tacos "Nick's way" and let me tell you they were sooooo tasty! They were very generous with the guacamole and the cheese and pinto beans add a really nice flavor. The cripy shell with the soft corn tortillas on the outside are a great combo and are definitely the way to go. I will definitely be back to try more items on the menu!

Service was good and the guy at the cashier helped me in ordering just two tacos instead of three (he told me that would've been too much, and he was right). Also, the girl who called my order when it was ready was sweet and I felt like she was really genuinely happy to be serving me. Great overall first time experience!
author: Rachel P.

description:
Friendly place. Tried their Carne Asada - California style. Delicious!

Burrito was roasted to my liking. Most Mexican places steam it.
author: R G.

description: This place is just disgusting. Would rate it negative if I could. The burrito was beyond inedible, I couldn't even finish more than a 1/3 before having to throw it out. I wish this place would close and a decent restaurant would open
author: Brian F.

description: I am used to get my burritos in the mission. So I try the San Francisco, the "mission style" burrito with carne asada. First the burrito was tiny (especially for the price) and they forgot to put meat into it! It was not even busy! Saw that once back home. And as for the taste I had way better in the Mission. Last time I go to this place.
author: Adrien P.

description:
By far one of my favorite taco spots in SF. If you get a taco be sure to order it "Nick's Way!" The quality of meats they use are evident in how juicy their tacos are. I love the setup of the place. Normally taco
Spots have a Latino flare but this spot was a nautical theme.  

When you sit down all the pictures and artwork are congruent with the theme. They had a TV which had the Warriors game on (always a plus). I love the sauces that they put on the tables too! Whatever you get just use what's on the table In their clear bottles. They have a wall of hot sauces but honestly just stick to those. 

The prices may seem steeper than a usual taco at first but when you see they pack on everything you realize how flavorful each taco is and you're no longer thinking regular street taco. I like this place way more then tacolicious. I'm willing to drive in the city and find parking for these tacos. And that's saying something!
author: Kanoa U.

description:
Finally tried Tacko today after many years of being a fan of Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk. 
I saw on burritoeater.com that Tacko got a very impressive rating for their "slab". I was actually somewhat surprised by this because the burritos at Nicks are pretty good but not stellar.
NIck has done it right at Tacko. I ordered the same slab that got the highest rating by burritoeater, the San Francisco carne asada. It was astounding. Totally tasted exactly like a great slab from the Mission. It is fantastic. 
I'm leery of the cockroach alert and the Marina hipsters so I probably won't be a regular but I'd gladly go back. LIke hipsters, roaches are an unusual problem lately that experts say can't be easily controlled as before. They also have developed immunities to common extermination attempts, so cut 'em a little slack here (and we all ate bugs at some point in our history).
author: Matt H.

description: Great food with a laid back atmosphere.   Emote the tacos and especially the quesadilla.  Also,  try the elote.  Very fresh ingredients.
author: Chris B.

description: Really enjoy going to this place. My go to is the SoCal burrito with carne asada as the French fries really add a nice touch. We've been going here a bunch on the weekends after playing basketball in the marina and found it to be a really casual place to grab a bite to eat after the game.
author: Jay G.

description: Overpriced and mediocre Mexican food.  No refried beans.  Head to the Mission instead.
author: Kevin C.

description: Great corn soft tacos and guacamole suitable for celiacs. Shrimp salad and burritos looked great too for others in group! Will visit again when we travel from Australia back to San Fran! Thanks!
author: Wendy R.

description: Best Mexican food in SF! Must get the carne asada.....its kobe beef!
author: Ben S.

description: Ordered to-go and by the time I got home, two blocks away, my three, very expensive, tacos were soggy to the point I had to eat them with a fork and knife. This has happened many of times before. They take very little care in prepping food to-go. Too often have my tacos arrived soggy and cold - they will no longer be getting my business.
author: Josh B.

description: $14 for a to go salad the size of a coffee mug (or a small Chinese to go box if you will.) No thank you...sure, I added shrimp but this is a rip off. I'd be better off going to a taqueria in the Mission and feeling full after my meal. And don't expect free chips or salsa ;)
author: Shirin M.

description:
My "go to" at least twice a week.  Stuck in the chicken quesadilla with sour cream and guacamole.  Its huge for a quesadilla...stuffed with a ton of juicey chicken...it almost looks like a deep fried burrito.
Sangria as well....
author: Scott T.

description:
I really love the food and ambiance. I order the San Francisco burrito. 
It is really nice that they have Mexican sodas to switch it up, that being said, they still have Coke...
author: C B.

description: Sort of what you expect out of a place like this, food is good but not spectacular. Place isn't cheap but it's certainly not too expensive. Staff is always very friendly which is always a positive. Only thing stopping me from giving them a 5star review is that on separate occasion they messed up my Togo order. I am a fan of the chicken tortilla soup and the chicken quesadilla both are good and pretty consistent.
author: Dmitriy G.

description:
Mmmm, upscale tacos in The Marina? 

Yikes? No. Yum : )

As Amy J. put it so well in her review (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tacko-san-francisco#hrid:jgLpDl2J_FrJUjqb0PJg_A) she and I found ourselves hungry and in Cow Hollow (or was it the Marina? hmmmm).

We wanted a bite to eat and walked past Tacko. It's bright, clean, and minimalist interior beckoned us in, as did the reasonably priced menu.

I asked the guy in line behind us what he recommended, just 'cause he looked like a regular who was antsn' for some tacos and burritos. He made a few recommendations. 

We went with the San Francisco burrito filled with Carne Asada, Pinto Beans, Cheese, Rice, Pico de Gallo Salsa, Guacamole, and Sour Cream on the side.

I swear, it was one of the best burritos I have had. Even after splitting it in half and sharing, I was still full (what!?)

The servers were friendly and looked happy to be there, and the food showed up at our table pretty quickly.

They also had several shelves filled with every type of hot sauce that you could imagine!

According to the guy, next time I will try the Mexican Street Style Tacos and the Chips and Salsa.
author: Diana V.

description:
Diana V. and I were hungry so we stopped in here on a whim. I'm glad we did because the staff were super friendly here. We ended up splitting the San Francisco burrito with carne asada. It was recommended by a guy in line who had been there before.

It seemed much healthier than most burritos because I didn't have that I feel gross I ate too much feeling afterward.

Ingredients seemed fresh and I would definitely go here...even make a special trip to eat here again. I know, gasp!

They even cut it in half for us and put them in a separate tray.

It's definitely one of the better places in this 'hood.
author: Amy J.

description:
Surprisingly good Mexican food in the heart of frat-town. Great guac and awesome fish-tacos. 

Besides for Roam Burger, probably the best cheap, casual food the Marina has to offer. So good I may or may not sometimes go two nights in a row..
author: Rachel L.

description:
Living in the Marina, there's not a lot of fast casual options. Tacko is a legit place for lunch on Saturday or Sunday, especially if you don't want to wait for a table at Tacolicious. 

Carne Asada tacos are excellent as are the Mahi Mahi and Pollo. Don't get the burritos - not what they're known for.
author: Count C.

description:
I love the tacos at this place (Nick's Style chicken or carnitas is the way to go). They also have pretty good burritos and really nice chips and salsa verde. 

If you do take-out, make sure they give you your whole order and get it right. We've had a few things missing or done wrong recently.
author: Molly P.

description: This is some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. They have the best chips and salsa that you can buy extra to go with your tacos or burritos or whatever you order. There are great salsas on each table that are packed with flavor and every time I go here I'm never disappointed. Highly recommend going here.
author: Bobby B.

description: One of the best vegetarian burrito I've had in the Bay Area. Super good size, good quality ingredients and a great price! The fish tacos are also really good, and a decent size!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Love this place! A little pricey but great food! 
I always get the three street steak tacos with a side of guacamole. The salsa at the tables is definitely worth a try.
author: Micah W.

description: Ordered a grilled fish taco with guac and it was delicious! Wasn't the best, but i really liked how the fish was cooked and the guacamole was great.
author: Samantha T.

description: Amazing place and staff is super friendly. I stop by for takeout every few weeks. California burrito with Carne Asada is great. Give it a try....feels like I am home in SoCal.
author: Drew P.

description:
I don't find myself in the Marina too often, but after leaving a swanky Yelp Elite Event last night and looking for a quick bite before walking up that massive hill on Fillmore en route to Lower Pac Heights (seriously, that hill could give someone a hear attack!), I remembered that I'd bookmarked Tacko to give 'er a go the next time I was within spitting distance, and to my delight, my path led me right past the old Kasa Indian space, and right into this East Coast oasis I'd been eye-balling ever since the ribbon cutting ceremony. Score!

I'm no stranger to Nick's Crispy Tacos, and even though I was born and raised on some of the best Mexican food on the planet outside of Mexico in San Diego, I actually quite enjoy his stuff. Sure, it's not authentic Mission or Baja-style Mexican food, but it's a bit of a niche food staple that certainly pleases my palate. However, I live right next to Tortilla Heights where I can get my hands on a taco done "Nick's Way" as often as I please, so with this jaunt, it was all about diving into the already much-talked-about rockstar of the menu, the glorious Nantucket lobster roll.

Everything on the menu at Tacko rings in under $8 or so (which is great for this part of town)... except for the lobster roll. It says "A.Q" on the menu, and upon inquiry, I learned that it has a price tag of $18. Sure, in comparison to the $4.50 carnitas taco, that may seem pricey, but it's lobster. I almost wouldn't trust consuming it if were any less expensive to be honest with you. A bit of a splurge, but hey -- you only live once.

I can't really make a comparison to an authentic Nantucket lobster roll, but in this case, I totally enjoyed this staple of East Coast comfort. Fresh lobster made with butter, not mayonnaise like so many other places that feature lobster rolls, piled high atop a grilled Acme hot dog roll. Simple, yet absolutely delightful! I'm notorious for not finishing my entire plate of food when I dine out, as I buy into the law of diminishing returns when it comes to eating, but with this bundle of joy, it was good to the last drop. 

An extra bonus to my dining experience at Tacko last night was getting to meet Nick of Nick's Crispy Tacos himself! Style-wise, he looked every bit of the kind of guy who'd be eating lobster rolls in Nantucket, and it was a pleasure getting a chance to rap with him for a hot second. Not sure how often he's hanging around on premise, but if you catch him there, be sure to say hello. Cool dude for sure.
author: Ruggy J.

description: If Ronald Regan and George HW Bush decided to have their wives cook Mexican food the cuisine here would be inspired by their wives creations.This was the whitest Mexican food I could have ever imagined. The flavors were toned down to cater the needs of the clientele that live in the area. If you or your family were born anywhere north of New York State. This is your place.
author: Hisham Z.

description:
I eat here 3+ times/ week.
I order one thing: Carne Asada SF Burrito w/ double meat.

Food: 5/5
Staff:  5/5      (Nick, Emily, Amy, and Carlos are a few of the standouts)
Decor:5/5     Eric Holchs, NYC/OHC burgees, varnished countertops, map off main, and ACKtual murray's aprons, TACKO nailed it.
author: M P.

description:
Round 1 & 2

Positives: 

The Carne Asada burritos use very good quality meat but the rest of the burrito is so so

Parking is difficult in the daytime but fine in the evening (they're open till 10 p.m.)

The decor: Bizarre use of Nantucket memorabilia on their wall but it's nice. Someone parks a nice old black Schwinn bicycle inside.

Negatives: 

Their salsas suck

The main daytime waitress is not very friendly...B word would apply

Taco Tuesdays are a disaster, really really bad tacos, almost shocking they would serve it

Round 3

Positives Their Kobe beef "San Francisco" burrito is definitely large (it should be for $11)

The cashier and their night time waitress are cool

Negatives: The cheaper $7 Mexico is actually better tasting than the San Francisco, which is good for your wallet

Round 4 - 9

Their Carne Asada quesidillas are more expensive than their Mexican burritos but I'd say they're the best item on their menu

The main cashier is super cool, I need to tip her the next time I go
author: Jonah H.

description: Great location right next to Comet Club.  Ingredients are fresh and excellent composition and mix.  I always get the San Diego style burrito (without rice).
author: Tom F.

description: Strong fish taco, damn good guac. Cool but weird east coast inspired atmosphere. Cheese quesadillas were awesome. Free water! I would return.
author: Mike M.

description: Watch out for the blond lady at the cash register with arm tattoos and one on her wrist.  I asked for extra salsa and she threw it in my bag and gave me a staunch glare.  The tacos are amazing but the service can be a little pokey to say the least
author: Brad P.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday May 29, 2011 @ 4pm
Location:  Former Kasa
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Cow Hollow+Marina Bro's in Pink & Green Polos or Pastel Striped Shirts w/ Sweater Knotted Over Shoulders & Deck Shoes Accompanied by Trophy Blondes in Fitted Nautical Striped Tops w/ Miniscule White Shorts or Candy-Colored Short Dresses w/ TOMS Wedge Shoes
Vibe:  Chill
Music:  80's New Wave
Decor:  Nantucket-Inspired:  Maps of Massachusettes, Framed Prints of Nantucket, Yachting Magazines Adorn the White Wainscot Walls, Tables & Benches Made of Boat Planks
Service:  Hot Guys in White "Tacko" Polos, Khakis and Dock Shoes
Imbibe:  Spiked Agua Frescas & Sacaty Scorpion Bowls
Devour:  SF Burrito(Pinto Beans, Cheese Rice, Sour Cream, Pico de Gallo Salsa, Guacamole w/ Choice of Carne Asada, Carnitas or Pollo) & Lobster Rolls(Whole Maine Lobster Poached in Butter w/ Toasted Acme Torpedo Roll & Cape Cod Chips
Total:  $43.06
Note:  Brought to You By the People of Nick's Crispy Tacos
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Im more of a fan of Tacko than Nicks. 

This place has everything you need including horchata, different flavored margs, beers and hot sauce. Definite must try if you're in the marina. 

Very clean, friendly and they have great super burritos. Usually theres always room to sit. 

My recommendation: light mexican bite.
author: Heather H.

description:
Completely unsustainable.

This is important: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sustainable_fishery

But Tacko does not seem to care. Otherwise more attention would have been paid to the size of the grilled mahi mahi in my taco. It was huge.

Wrapped up in corn tortillas with cilantro, salsa and the unnecessary additions of pinto beans and shredded chicken. It was delicious.

Hopefully they leave some for the rest of the world.
author: Jason B.

description:
Hipster taco joint, need I say more?

Probably... I wouldn't know what kind of conclusion to come to with that statement either. I found myself here after getting lost trying to find parking in the area. Two tacos is a full meal. I went with their fish and shrimp soft tacos - delicious. The establishment takes on an east coast theme. It's clean, well-lit, and there's good seating for both small and large parties.

But seriously, this is the cool cat of taco shops.
author: Francis L.

description: WOW. Just ate two of the best tacos I've ever had. Got a chicken taco and a steak taco, both "Nick's style". Topped with salsa, guacamole (fresh, good), beans. The chicken and steak were both delicious - juicy and flavorful. Also, at $5 a piece, pretty generously sized. My margarita was also great! I'll definitely be back.
author: Nikki G.

description:
Food = amazing. 
Service = so-so



The gentleman at the front counter was rude and intolerant of our questions. It was our first time, naturally we wanted a little guidance on the menu. I personally like advice to maximize my first experience at a restaurant. However, he was not kind or helpful. 

The woman running the food, on the other hand, was really great. 

Carne asada was KILLER!
author: Jenna W.

description: Service takes forever, place is filled with marina bros, and the margaritas taste like straight Mr T's margarita mix. Fish tacos nick's way weren't any better than Nick's crispy. Very disappointed.
author: Alexei I.

description:
Came to this place last night for some dinner. A really lively place that has a nice open space and many tables as well as bar seats. 

[THE FOOD]   4/5
I bought the Mexican Street Styled Tacos for $7.25. I was pretty happy with these. A sampler of 3 different kinds of tacos including carnitas, pollo, and carne asada. There are a couple of sauces on the side of the tables as well as hot sauce readily available which was great. The tacos had tons of meat and filling inside. So much, that the corn tortillas almost didn't hold it all. Fresh taste and overall delicious. However, could have used maybe a tad bit more seasoning, to make it excellent, but I was definitely satisfied. 

[THE VALUE] 4/5
You're in a nice area. You're going to have an elevated price for the menu. Although it wasn't dirt cheap, it wasn't terrible either. I do think that I would not have been satisfied with the tacos if I was very hungry coming in, but then they have burritos and other entrees for hungry people and $7.25 is honestly fair and how much you usually purchase appetizers at restaurants so it's not a big deal for me.

[THE SERVICE] 4.5/5
Although this wasn't a sit in restaurant, I was pretty impressed with the service. They came to pick up our empty baskets from our table when we were still sitting at them and were really helpful and accommodating for me when I needed a box. 

[MISCELANEOUS COMMENTS/TIPS]
I like that their self-serve water is it's own dispenser, offered in sparkling or still water. Water glasses are glass rather than plastic, and there is a wide variety of drinks both alcoholic and non-alcoholic that makes this place a great place to have a few draught beers or juices, making it a nice middle ground for family friendly/casual dinner for pre-gaming a late night out. 

Overall, I was quite satisfied. I'm not a huge Mexican food kind of person, but if I'm ever in the area and craving some guacamole I'll definitely remember this place!
author: Cara O.

description: Good food, great sangria, solid pre-bar food right next to the triangle bars.
author: JP N.

description: The taco salad is AMAZING.  Good quality meat here--love this place!  You can sit inside or out, it's super casual and the food is super good.  It's definitely Mexi-Cali food--not authentic but it's GREAT nonetheless.  Enjoy!
author: Katherine K.

description: Not really "Mexican" food. The Nantucket posters should have been my clue. Decent salad but thought my fish was chicken. And of course being in the Marina - the usual Marina crowd - we were the only people of color - other than the busboy ! Typical Marina joint - typical Marina vibe !
author: An N.

description: The food is awesome, but they just stop answering their phones when they're busy, and lines on Sunday nights are just nuts. Manager appears drunk, dropping to-go orders on the counter & floor, and the girl at the check out counter keeps giggling as the manager calls other customers trying to pick up phone/online orders "you're a dick".
author: Kate H.

description:
Nick is back, and he's crispier than ever!  Best of all, he's even closer to my buddy's place in the Marina for all my visits to SF.  It's everything you loved about NCT, made by the man himself!  As a non-resident of The City, it's one place I have to visit every time I'm there.  You know it by now, get all the tackos Nick's Way, you'd be crazy not to.  Burritos?  Salads?  Lobster rolls?  Couldn't tell you, still too addicted to the tackos to get anything else, but I'm sure they're amazing as well.

Make sure to ask for their habanero hot sauce if you want to add a little fire to your b-hole!
author: Sean L.

description: Love the San Diego burrito!! Very friendly, helpful service. Super casual. Great spot to get a delicious, inexpensive meal and a drink with friends.
author: Caroline C.

description: Popped in for the first time today to have lunch with my friend who works around the corner.  I like the boat/nautical interior design.  It's clean and has a lot of individual seating with some 4-tops and a large communal table.  We sat outside since it was nice out.  I ordered the "Mexican" burrito with chicken and told them to make it spicy.  The burrito tasted really good and the spice level perfect.  They offer tons of hot sauces which I used the Tapatio.  Even without the hot sauce, the burrito had a nice kick.  The tortilla was cooked, so these are the kind of burritos you hold and eat with your hands, no cutlery needed.  I also got their guacamole appetizer which contained veges instead of chips.  It was ok - nothing bad, nothing wow.  Would I order it if I were eating alone?  No.  Would I eat it in a group, yes.  All in all, next time I visit my friend or happen to be in the neighborhood, I'll come back.  I recommend it!
author: Shaun W.

description:
I did not like my first experience with this place. The guy who runs the cash registrar should go to another business to see how a cash registrar and line is run. Really random and confusing, he had two lines and seemed to randomly pick customers from one or the other. (After asking, apparently take-out orders stand to the left, and sit-down orders to the right. Unless you called ahead, then you cut everyone) When I was finally to the front of my line, I was ignored for minutes. Just that alone puts the you in a bad mood. $30 bucks for 3 tacos, a quesadilla, chips, a coke, and one beer. 

Food takes a REALLY long time to come out. And they have a ton of people working back there. 

Food was meh. wasn't bad... but I don't think it was worth the struggle to order, the wait, or the price.

Go to Tacolicious, at least it's worth the wait.
author: Keith B.

description:
This review is for the pail of margaritas ONLY. 

Ordered one for myself because I was really thirsty and stuff. For what it lacks in flavor, it certainly makes up for in.. well.. tequila. Highly recommend.
author: Casey M.

description:
First time there and wanted to like it but...

Chips and guac - chips are thick and overcooked.  Guac was bland.  I asked if this is how the chips are supposed to be and the waitress said that's how they've always made it.

Mahi mahi Baja style (2) - fish could have been cooked a little longer to be a bit crispier.  The slaw was bland.

3 Tacos Street Style - beef was OK, pork was a little better, and chicken was the best which is surprising since I'm not a fan of chicken tacos.

Add a Coke and the large Abita beer and tip, it was in the low $40s which is a bit much for some subpar tacos.
author: Keaton N.

description: Love them! Tackos are good and juicy and not pricy. Always quick service.
author: Svetlanko I.

description:
We visited San Francisco for the first time a couple of weeks ago. Our local friends suggested Tacko. The chips and guac were great. They're thicker and crunchier than your typical "restaurant" style tortilla chip and we loved them.

We both had a Nick's Way Carne Asada Taco, as recommended by our friends, and enjoyed it a lot. If we lived out there we would be back for more.
author: The Trot L.

description:
I love this place and come here at least once a week to get my carne asada San Diego burrito fix. The margaritas are strong, the food is delish (American Kobe beef and Fulton valley chicken) and the customer service is efficient and super friendly. 
The only down side - the pretentious Marina douche bags that cut the queue and think they are more important than everyone else.
author: Sally T.

description: Pretty good tacos! Today was my first time here. Lunch with a friend on a sunny day. If you have a dog like I did earlier, you can sit at the patio tables. We had a really nice time.
author: Helen W.

description: I love the nick way tacos. They are filling with good meats. The corn on the  cob is also excellent!
author: M H.

description: Don't order  chicken burritos ... Boil chicken with no flavor. Sorry but I'm not coming back.
author: Juvi C.

description:
Tacko has everything I look for in a restaurant except for a parking lot. But seeing that street parking was fine for a late Saturday lunch and there is a paid garage near by, this place is pretty golden in my mind. 

Tacko is a Mexican place with an east coast vibe. I loved the white wooden benches and beach decor. You order at the counter and then pick a place to sit. I had the San Diego burrito(carne asada with pico de gallo) which turned out to be a bit smaller then I was expecting, since I'm used to chipotle/ sd burrito sizes, but it was actually plenty for me. AND I LOVE THEIR RED SAUCE! yumm. And the best part is that most of the items are under $10! a nice quality meal for under $10 in a cute restaurant is a great day for me! :) Now if only Tacko would move to the South Bay.
author: Sarah S.

description:
These tacos are $4-5 each but seriously large, with great ingredients and balance of flavors. One taco is enough if you're not so hungry, two if you're starving. You can get them traditional Mexican or Nick's way, Nick's being one crispy fried tortilla nestled inside one soft one. The Baja fish is delicious, especially with a few squirts of the red and green sauces they put on each table.

Tacko seems to be styling itself in the San Diego way, so I don't understand the whole Nantucket theme they have going on with the decor. But the space is big and clean, good for eating all by yourself or with a huge group. If the latter, try the sangria bucket.
author: Cecilia L.

description: I am a major fan of Nick's Crispy Tacos so when I heard that this place had opened, I was looking forward to trying it out even though I'm not in the Marina too often.  I like the feel of the place because it's pretty casual and laidback.  I ordered the Mexican street style tacos and they were really tasty.  My wife had a taco Nick's way and enjoyed it as well.  An easy family place where lots of folks like ourselves had their kids with the.
author: Blake B.

description: Tacko is a better alternative to Nick's! Clean, ample seating. They also feature Taco Tuesday's -- I'm a fan and would come again!
author: Siv L.

description:
Food is yummy. I got the California burrito and it was good..could use sour cream and maybe something else added but it was fresh and delicious. 

The restaurant is clean and that is what I appreciate at a good establishment. The atmosphere is not too loud and is chill.  The bathroom was also clean. :)

The gal that took our order didn't smile and didn't seem to like working but she was not unkind or rude..just not "friendly."
author: JD W.

description: I can't believe I've never been here in the 2 years they've been open! I've found my new favorite lunch place in the Marian! Friendly staff, food was delicious & quick! I'll be back to try more things! $2 tacos is a great deal, especially before 5:00!
author: Jillian S.

description: I am addicted to Tacko's burritos, especially the San Francisco and California (carne asada and chicken are my go-to's). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
author: Kevin H.

description: Honestly this is my first review, I've ever had to write in the negative.  I've been here 4 times or so, and today made me realize that I will never come back again! The "manager" who claims to have been working 8 hrs a day plus told me that they can't put the meat that comes with my burrito on the side! Yes I know it's weird but I am a veggie and my friend isn't and so if I am paying for something I expect getting  it whether it's inside the burrito or not!!!  The previous times I've been here, they have had a no problem and I told the "manager" that and he told me that my workers aren't doing their job right!! Are you kidding me!!! Any person working at a job is to satisfy their customer! It's all about customer service. Ask any business owner that! The way this person treated me was horrifying. I will never come back again and expect him to learn from his mistake!
author: Akash V.

description:
I frequent Tacko more times then I would like to admit but it's a great feeling when I am greeting on the phone by a happy employee. Even better when they know your name by your order. 
Every time I walk in the staff is very kind as I am usually in a rush grabbing a To GO order. 

I also have food sensitivities so they are ALWAYS on the ball making sure my food has not been cross contaminated. 

Love Tacko!
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Ah, nothing makes me think of tacos like .... Nantucket(?)
Tacko's food is decent (but far from the best in town), but my problem is that they keep discovering new ways to screw up my dining experience. There was a summerlong streak there where they messed up or forgot my order about one in three times (yes, it happened often enough that we started counting). Credit where it's due, that doesn't seem to happen much anymore, but now there are more creative issues. This Saturday I splurged and ordered a side of (overpriced) guacamole to go with the handful of chips that accompany the burritos. What do I discover when I finally get back and open the bag? Guac, but no chips. It's like a cruel form of torture. I went back and discovered that their fryer was broken so they didn't have enough chips to go around. They said that they'd have to charge me for chips (which was not explained while I was at the register, of course). I should have asked if I could charge them for my time spent hungrily going all the way back to their shop. We could have made it an even trade: my time for the meal I'd ordered in the first place.

Tacko, we shouldn't have given you so many chances in the first place.

From now on let's just do ourselves a favor and go to La Canasta: nicer people, better prices, faster service, fewer screw-ups, and MUCH more authentic food.
author: Some A.

description:
Tacko is a solid option for a quick bite in this part of town. Nothing in the Marina is cheap it seems, and Tacko is no exception it's more expensive than your average Mexican spot, but not overly pricey.

I always get my "Tacko's" Nick's way, I really like the crispy aspect and the Carne Asada is bomb!!!  Also the Shrimp "Tacko's" have huge juicy shrimp and are a real treat.  Another bonus is the salsa seems extremely fresh.

I have no qualms bringing friends here, I'm confident they will enjoy it.

Also, you can buy buckets of beer at a decent price.  

One time the owner Nick came in wearing a kilt and was pretty obliterated (Pub Crawl my guess), someone in line made some comment about something and he yelled at them something like "Well than you can just get out!" 

Now, my buddy and I always joke when we are in there What would Nick do if someone brought in Taco Bell!
author: Alex B.

description:
This place is hardly "Mexican," the people who worked here were rude, and my food took forever.  The only cool thing about this building is it's the historic Galley Six.  But just like anything in the Marina, no one would ever know due to the lack of any culture.
But really... this place sucks.  If you're one of those people who never leaves the neighborhood and you want Mexican... I guess this is the place for you.  But it really wont kill you to go 15 minutes for some good food.  I would give it one star, but it's worth another star to pretend you're Ginsburg and went back in time to 1955... it will last less a minute once the odd New England decor jerks you back to reality.
But really... a big "Double-Tee-Eff" on the interior design
author: Kelly N.

description: Not only is the food good..  But they treat people right! We waited a little longer than expected, due to the NBA Finals (Go Warriors); and our meal was on them. Totally unexpected and appreciated! Kind of place you wanna go back to! Keep it up!
author: Bryan M.

description: Awesome food, we always get the California burrito, chicken soup, and nicks way tacos. The salad is great too, and they have a pretty decent beer selection that they change up. This is one of the few places in the city that has a California burrito, and it's a good one!
author: Maggie H.

description:
I don't normally give 1-star reviews, but this place takes the cake.

I walk by this place every evening on my way home from work. I really wish this place was great, because if it was, I would pick up take-out for me and my wife at least once per week, probably twice, because we are usually too tired to cook.

Why do I feel this way...?
1) False advertising.
2) Inconsistent take-out orders with a side of attitude. 
3) Shrinking food size

What do I mean by this...?
They advertise "Taco Tuesday" - $2 tacos. But what they don't tell you is that this is only if you're eating at the restaurant, not takeout. I go up to the register and say that I'd like to get the tacos for Taco Tuesday. The owner rings me up. It comes to more than the number of tacos I ordered x $2 + tax. I ask why. He says I have to eat inside the restaurant in order for the tacos to be $2. Wouldn't you tell me this as I'm ordering? I told him that's not what is advertised and no where is there a sign that explains this. He said, "If I had a sign for everything I wanted to say, there'd be signs all over this place." Hence, the side of attitude I mentioned.  I was too tired to argue so I just decided to move on with my evening and not to go to this place again. 

So I'm waiting for my tacos. A neighbor couple I live near walks in and I say hi, etc. They order something for eat-in and sit down. My food is finally ready (took a long time) and I sit down for a few minutes to chat with them. I take a bite of a couple of chips that are in the bag with my tacos. My neighbors' order is ready. When it gets to the table, my neighbor says, "oh, they forgot the chips." Goes up to the register. Owner says, "You only get chips with takeout orders." My neighbor says, "that doesn't make any sense, I just want a few chips." Owner says, "ya, too bad, you can place an order for chips if you want." My neighbor says "nevermind" and sits down again, whereupon he says, "Never comin' here again, they just nickel and dime ya, and aren't exactly nice bout it either!" I said, "Yes, I know exactly how you feel"

I get home. Tell my wife the situation. We open up the bag and start laughing. The tacos are the size of a coaster or a hokey puck (whichever visual you prefer). My wife is 120lbs, 5' 7" - she's going to need about 8 of these things to constitute dinner. We throw a frozen pizza in the oven and call it a day.
author: Mason K.

description:
For those lamenting how it is not authentic, no shizz...it is a Nantucket themed Mexican restaurant, for crying out loud.  There are nautical flags and sailboats everywhere you look.  This is as far from authentic as it gets, and I don't care, because ultimately it's delicious and it's five minutes from my apartment.  People, get off your  high horse and let myself stuff myself full of kobe beef in peace!

I am a quesadilla fanatic (read my review of El Toro Taqueria for further details), and the carne asada quesadilla here is a joke...stuffed to capacity with meat, in a way I've never seen.  You will legitimately have kobe beef falling down your chin with every bite, they do not skimp out.  So good, and they always have some interesting beers available too...not a huge selection, but something good on tap for sure (rare for the Marina).

In short, authentic?  No.  Gooey, delicious, and supremely satisfying?  You bet.
author: James S.

description:
I've been here three or four times now HOPING that I would someday order the meal that would change my mind about this place. My friends all love it and can't believe I refuse to go anymore.

I LOVE mexican food. No, this isn't real mexican food, I know. But, it is as close as it gets when I am craving a burrito. Every burrito I've had here, or sampled from a friend, has been just "meh." Not much flavor... and no kick.

You will find me down the road at Los Hermanos.
author: Yum N.

description: I absolutely LOVE their steak/carne asada California burrito with guacamole. Try it now, you will love it if you are from SD and miss a good ol' California burrito.
author: Thomas A.

description: The best Horchata I have ever tasted, it actually made my day better. The taco salad with carnitas is great, but that Horchata just blew me away, great job!
author: Michael A.

description: I like this place's burritos a lot more than their brother restaurant, Nick's. This place has a fun vibe and the food came out quick.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Food awesome, service  a bit pokey. Nick's way tacos are the best!

Great casual restaurant in the hood, reasonably priced.
author: Brad S.

description:
From a girl who's never been to Nick's Crispy Tacos (but must go there soon), this was definitely a pleasant look into Nick's taco ventures.

The pollo taco was off the hook, as was the sauce selection! I loved that the chicken was actually flavored, unlike many of the taco joints that just give you plain, shredded chicken. One taco is definitely a generous portion, so it filled me up for lunch -- keep that in mind when you order. The tacos are wrapped tightly and neatly, so despite been loaded with ingredients, they never fall apart!

I loved the New England vibe! What a great place to hang out, grab a bite, and socialize. Can't beat lunch for $4.50! Definitely a worthy use of space, unlike its lame predecessor, Kasa.
author: Mansi A.

description: Their tacos are good for the Marina/Cow Hollow area. I prefer this place over Tacolicious but don't expect their tacos to be something out of the Mission. I came here for Taco Tuesday and got their street style tacos, which includes one of each of the carne asada, carnitas and pollo topped with cilantro and onions. Pollo and carnitas were seasoned nicely. The steak was a little chewy but still tasted great. I will definitely be coming back and trying other things on the menu. One thing that threw me off was the random lobster roll on their menu and their whole nautical, martha's vineyard, nantucket theme. It doesn't really scream Mexican?
author: Hana K.

description:
If you live in the area and understand the environment, then this place is great for Mexican food.  Compared to other places in the bay area, it doesn't live up to the rating.  It's definitely a more white washed version of Mexican food but that's pretty typical of the entire area.  The price is a little higher than most Mexican food but it's on par considering it's located in the Cow Hollow district.  

I work in the area and frequent Tacko almost every week.  I usually get the San Francisco burrito with carne asada.  The salsa in the burrito isn't that great and sometimes the carne asada can be burnt.  Overall, they are pretty consistent.  Their red salsa is really good but I'm not a big fan of the green salsa.  

The one problem I have is with their stinginess with the salsa.  I order for a few people so we typically order 3 burritos.  I normally tell them no green salsa and only red salsa.  They usually give you one of each but if you only ask for red, they will only give you one red salsa per burrito.  It's a small container with barely enough salsa for the chips.  With an average salsa on the burrito, they could at least give me another red salsa!  I've even asked for more salsa and got one additional pack.  I had to ask the cashier twice and it was almost like I was asking for some huge favor.  I try to always place my order online and it works great.  I wish there was a note section so I could write "MORE RED SALSA PLEASE!"

When you eat in, they have huge bottles of salsa at the tables.  Unfortunately, I don't have time to eat in since work has been killer.
author: Ken W.

description: Delicious! I ordered the carne asada burrito San Francisco style, minus the beans. The flavor and texture was spot on, and the red and green sauces are the icing on the cake! Definitely worth the trip to the Marina/Cow Hollow area.
author: Angela C.

description:
I tried the delicious Nick's Way tacos, which are hard shell inside a soft shell. I got the carnitas and the chicken but like the carnitas just a little bit more than the chicken. Both were FULL of flavor though and went well together. They fill them with plenty of meat and have about 100 hot sauces to choose from.

Food didn't come out very fast but it tasted very fresh and just cooked to order, which is probably why.
author: Clair C.

description: When the mood strikes for "casual" Mexican food we know we have only a few options if we want to stay close to home.  We've been going to Tacko since they opened and have been relatively happy with the food and service. But this is the second time I've ordered food to go and have noticed that the quality of the food has majorly declined. A few notes to consider.... The carne asada is terribly chewy and overly salty. More then once, my food has had a fishy flavor when no fish product was supposed to be in the meal. The taco salad portion size has been cut in half.  I encourage Tacko to get back on ball, especially now that there's a new kid on the block; Bonita.
author: Erin M.

description:
I seriously think these are my favorite burritos in the city, and that's saying a lot for someone who has grown up in SF over the last 2 decades. My childhood was chicken and cheese burritos, so I know what's up. Not only do they stuff the burritos full of what they should-delicious, fresh ingredients (tons of guacamole, juicy chicken, tender steak, tender beans, rice, I could go on...)-but they expertly fold them AND grill them once they're folded. This adds a delicious, crispy exterior to the burrito unlike anything around.

Their quesadillas are basically the same exact thing as the ones over at Nick's Crispy Tacos, which makes sense because the ex-owner of Nick's (yes, Nick) is the owner of Tacko. Whatever he does for mexican food, he needs to work that magic at every other restaurant in the world. Seriously, he does it right. 

Friendly, helpful, hard-working staff. Although I've occasionally waited 30+ minutes for orders (both as a sit-down and for take-out), the wait always seems to be worth it. Never have I ever regretted waiting for their burritos, tacos, or quesadillas. This place is relatively new (maybe about a year) and I don't know how I survived before without it. Tacko makes my world go 'round.


PS San Francisco-style burritos are where it's at. Get everything in your order Nick's Way, you won't regret it. Also, you can get chicken AND steak in your burrito, just ask.
author: Griffin H.

description:
I enjoyed it, although innocuous enough it took me some time to remember the business lunch.  It's fine.  The "please don't compare us to the chipotle concept because we are a higher end low end street taco concept so please don't" but I still will compare, and they do a fine job.  I will also related what was written on the menu, in lieu of complaining about parking, knowing you need a parking buddha warrior to calm you and make patience a friend:

"peaceful revolution; Gandhi.
                         Orange revolution

Mubarek?"


At least it was a positive vibe in 2011.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Got a $8 chicken burrito that tasted ok but not great. It was also on the small side. I don't mind paying $8 for a burrito but I should at least get full. I had to go down the street to get a slice of pizza to be satisfied.
author: Craig G.

description:
People are raving about this place! I probably ordered the wrong thing, but I wasn't that impressed. I thought I would spend a little extra for a mahi-mahi taco and a grilled shrimp taco. Both seemed more substantial than the street tacos since they come with pico and cabbage on top. Man, was I disappointed! Both tacos lacked any flavor at all. I couldn't even taste the seafood, which is why I wanted them in the first place! I doused them in the green and red sauces they put on the table to no avail. Just tasted like sauce (which was good, granted). I had some buyer's remorse and wished I would have just done traditional street.

I do like that they use very fresh ingredients, and you can tell. They were generous with the shrimp and fish, I just wish I could have tasted them. 

Their guacamole, though, is the business! Super cheap and really delicious. Margs are pretty tasty too.

My friends are die-hard fans of the burritos, so I'll have to try one of those next time!
author: Jadeen Y.

description: I was hoping for better. I had a salad with chicken. It was mostly romaine with not much flavor. Just OK. Won't go out of my way to eat here again.
author: Donna P.

description: I came here after Bay to Breakers so while the details are a little hazy, i do know that the chips and salsa with guacamole was worth every penny. I ended up ordering it twice. Would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for good, somewhat quick Mexican food.
author: Alexandra K.

description: Nice ambiance, quick service and delicious food. The carnitas taco Nick's way is everything a taco should be. Hands down one of the best tacos I ever had. This place is worth checking out!!
author: Diana H.

description: Pretty decent place with a casual vibe for my Taco fix!  Well organized, fast, good service, happy people and great food!
author: Shweta M.

description: What happened to this place??  It used to be wonderful. Is it under new ownership perhaps?  Less of an eye on quality?  The Baja style fish taco was in a word.."gross". It has always been my favorite fish taco in the entire world..Yes..."world".  I went in today for my usual fish taco fix and took a big bite into "mushy, brown fish hell".  What the heck?  The usual crispy light bear batter was mushy and soggy and tasteless. The fish which is usually a delicate white fish was some other filet of light brown not-fresh tasting fish.  A few other details about the actual taco's were different as well.  A completely different staff. While I was in line I noticed that one of the dishwashers came out to the front counter to pour himself a large glass of punch and returned back to the dish-room  but not before sticking his dirty hand deep into the open vat of fresh chips to scoop up a handful to take back to the dish-room with him..."S U P E R  G R O S S " ! What a sad loss.  So much for that joint. Another great spot shot to hell.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Had to come back and give it 5 stars for great salsa, consistently good food and a good atmosphere.  

Maybe not as good as some of the spots in the mission but if you live north--the convenience off-sets.  I think it is far better than the spot on Fillmore.
author: Zack M.

description:
carne asada tacos were legit, but the baja burrito....not so much.  Whole wheat tortilla!?!?  Damn, that is a sure way to ruin any burrito.   I think thats what started that mess down at the Alamo - everyone was getting along and then someone has the bright idea to serve whole wheat torillas and all hell breaks loose!

 I'll be back, but be warned about whole wheat - that's just wrong.
author: Scott L.

description: Tacos are great here. Order them "Nicks" way to make them even better. Good for a chill taco Tuesday, nothing to crazy if ur looking for a crackin spot but good!! Every Mexican bottled beer!
author: Jake F.

description:
Just ok. With so many REAL mex food place in the city, I wouldn't likely eat here again. My complaints:

1) Tortillas are sweet and taste like the local grocery variety
2) Mahi burrito was small and pretty pricey at $10.
3) Quesadilla was greasy and stained my kids clothing...
author: Jack G.

description:
OMG!!!!! SO SO SO GOOD!!!! San Fran no sour cream carnitas burrito makes my world go round. Add a lot of haberno sauce and it makes me one happy happy asian. Unfortunately no jalapenos, but it's ok, I'll just drown my jalepenos woes in sangria.

;) :) wink wink yes i'm being super asian right now
author: Alex L.

description:
This is a long overdue post, but I still wanted to give the team at Tacko their props!!!  I threw my husband a birthday party at the wine bar next door and was lucky enough to have Tacko cater the food.  They not only worked with all of my food requests to customize a menu for me (I was serving a bunch of "San Diegans" who always complain about the mexican food in the bay), but was able to work very closely with the wine bar to make sure everything ran smoothly and was set up for us (including plates, utensils, a variety of hot sauces, to go boxes for leftovers, etc...).  

Now for the food - My favorite is the Elote / corn (reminds me of our girls trips to NY), but everything was really good... Even the Sd guys approved of the food (which is very rare for bay area mexican food! hahah)!! Best part - there was so much food that even after everyone ate, we had some leftovers for the next day (Football + Tacko leftovers = Sunday Funday!).
author: Jen D.

description: Really good.  Cool spot.  Went on Taco Tuesday for $2 tacos and $2 Tacates.  Tacos are pretty small so get 3 - 4 of them.  Vibe is cool.  Everyone really friendly.
author: Josh V.

description: The food is okay, but the service is slow and chaotic.  Been waiting for 20 minutes for a vegetarian burrito. Besides running out of time to eat lunch the experience is aggravating.
author: Karim D.

description:
15 min to make 2 tacos??? Pretty slow....

The tacos are big size but the taste is just not that good. Guess I've been to good Mexican places that this place just didn't cut it for me
Thier chips were stale too...
author: Ella B.

description:
After not wanting to wait at Mamacita or Tacolicious, I decided to try out Tacko for the first time.  I'm glad I did because I think their tacos blow the rest of them away!

I ordered the chicken, carne asada and the mahi mahi taco...Nick's Way of course with the double shell, cheese and guacamole.  The carne asada and mahi mahi were standouts!  Meat was seasoned really well and everything tasted really fresh.  The guacamole here is OUTSTANDING.  Definitely thick and pasty like and kinda reminds me of Chipotle's guacamole minus the corn.  The tortilla chips are fantastic too...really crispy, fresh and thick.

The only negative is that it's kinda pricey....three tacos and an order of chips, salsa and guacamole came out to be $24.00.  It was tasty though and I look forward on eating here again.
author: Joel C.

description:
The carne asade tacos Nick's way is good. The lobster in the lobster roll is tiny, dry and bland. That pissed me off. Definitely doesn't warrant the price. I guess it's my fault for ordering that in a Mexican restaurant.

This place reeks of marina douchebaggery. Great place to go to be amongst the arrogant jocks that frequent this establishment. On my next visit, I'll know to dress appropriately. That is, a polo, shorts and flip flops in tow...even when it's 45 degrees out.
author: David D.

description: I've been there for lunch a couple of days ago. Craving a burrito, I had to ask if they use garlic in their Guacomole since I have a food allergy towards garlic. The server said they did so I decided on a burrito with only beans and rice, no guac. He talked to the cook to make sure this one is garlic free which it was not since they use garlic in the rice, beans and meat marinade as well.... I was very disappointed first since I REALLY wanted a burrito. The guy was super nice, super friendly and ended up putting together a special burrito for me. Fried unseasoned fish, fresh avocado instead of guacomole, fresh tomatoes and some other ingredients. After food was served he even came to our table to check if everything was alright... A serious food allergy sucks and is no fun when it comes to eating out... I really appreciated their service!!! Never wrote a review on any restaurant before but this one really deserves it!!
author: Jenny J.

description:
I know I'm from SoCal so I've pretty much been spoiled by the wonders of authentic Mexican food at my door step for a buck or two, but this place doesn't cut it.

I got the Mexican Street Style Tacos, which consists of:
1 Carnita taco - which was too dry and underseasoned. Just tasted like stringy meat.
1 Pollo (chicken) taco - which, although white meat, was also dry and underseasoned.
1 Carne Asada taco - this was the best one, hands down! The meat was flavorful and best of all, tender.

All the tacos came in two small corn tortillas that was a bit too dough-y tasting. Each taco had a sprinkle of onions and cilantro. Because the meat didn't have any sauce or flavor, eating them as is was just plain awful due to its dryness. 

There are two bottles of sauce on the side - a green one that's like salsa verde that was light and refreshing, and a red one that, I'm guessing, is some kind of habanero one. But for the love of God, stay away from the red one! It tastes burnt, and is just utterly disgusting. 

I also got a pitcher of their white sangria, and opted to get it in their big pail! I liked the idea - it's super cute - but the drink itself was disappointing. First off, they filled the pail up with lots and lots of ice, not leaving much room for the alchy. No bueno. Second, the sangria had nooo flavor at all. I could barely taste any wine at all. I thought I was just drinking watered down...soda at best. And worst off? ALL THAT FOR $17.50. 

So if you're coming here hoping to get some bomb tacos, you won't. I highly recommend El Farolito in the Mission instead! But if you must come here...just remember:
1. Red or Green Sauce? Red = NO, Green = YES. 
2. NO to the white sangria, even if the pail looks super adorable! It's a trick!
author: Evelyn S.

description:
My boyfriend and I ate here today after a nice walk in the Marina.  Wish we spent our money elsewhere.  There is no menu outside so they force people to walk in to check out their menu.  

We ordered a fish taco and a California burrito.  The girl who was working the counter asked if I wanted my fish battered or grilled.  I asked for battered and I got grilled.  I asked for no onions due to allergies and she said the salsa had some and took it off my order.  She failed to tell me that they add red onion strings to their cabbage.  I was clearly upset, but I didn't say anything and picked out the onions with my fingers since there are no utensils in site.  
For my boyfriend's burrito, if you could call it that, lacked flavor and was not exciting.  The size is about half the size of what you would normally find in an authentic Mexican restaurant.   

If you're looking for good a good Mexican restaurant, this is not the place.  And the Nantucket/taco theme does not seem to mesh.  

They get 2 stars for being clean and taking credit cards.  They might be new to taking credit cards, the girl ringing up our order had to ask for help on how to swipe the card.
author: Myra E.

description:
Okay, I'm 400 miles away from San Diego, our home and home of the first fish taco in California. I just had the freshest largest chunk of MahiMahi grilled fish taco! Better than ANY grilled fish taco in San Diego, why?
It was fresh, and everything that came with it was fresh! S.D is home to Avocados, why was it better here? FRESH!
Great work, Keep it that way! Don't change a thing!
author: Judy S.

description: Burritos are amazing here once your able to navigate the loads of yuppies in the restaurant. But, it's the marina so not much you can do about that. Nonetheless, the food is worth it.
author: Paul N.

description:
What white people think Mexican food should taste like. Fortunately it doesn't usually taste like this. The actually food quality is good and fresh, but it's flavorless compared to Mexican food and it is also extremely expensive. 

Baha Fresh is better and cheaper.
author: Jacqueline A.

description: Honestly the best carne asada in town.  Every ingredient is high quality, and the service is extremely quick.  They have never messed up an order for me.  This place is on their game.
author: George O.

description: I had some delicious fish and shrimp tacos here. They have a large variety of hot sauces which I liked because I hate when my only option is tabasco. The place is not real big so get a table before ordering or get take out. I wouldn't recommend this place for large croups. It was pretty crowded when I was there so the noise level was rather high. It has an odd Nantucket theme which put me off a little but the food was great.
author: Sarah W.

description:
08.23.11 || bookmarked 06.06.11

I am a huge fan of Taco Tuesdays, and an even bigger fan of Nick's Crispy Tacos and Underdogs.  I was ecstatic to find another shop with the same "Nick's Way" tacos, and delighted to devour such tacos after an evening of Planet Granite rock climbing.

Seating is very limited.  We split up the group to hoard a table while the other half ordered at the counter.  They were cash only when we went - not sure if that changed.

The portions are pretty big for tacos - I could barely finish two!  I decided on the carne asada and the mahi mahi, both Nick's way.  You can't go wrong!
author: Jenny L.

description: I go there for the 2 dollar street tacos every Tues, my friend and I get the Chips and salsa with bubbly water. The staff is friendly and the service is spot on. Sometimes there's a long line but worth the wait.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
I once knew a man from Nantucket,
who told Nick's Crispy Tacos to suck it.
No, he wasn't a dick. In fact, he was the real Nick.
So it's Tacko for Nick's Way or f*ck it. 

* The use of this limerick is in no way intended to disparage, create ill repute, otherwise harm or distract one from the lip smackingly fresh & tasty fare to be enjoyed here - must haves include (but are not limited to); Baja Style fish tacos, fresh horchata, elote, chips & guacamole, carnitas tacos Nick's Way, and yes, go for it, the lobster roll.
author: wendella a.

description: If you like Mexican and you're visiting SF(or you just live here). You're in for a treat! This place have amazing food. Chips and guacamole are amazing and homemade. Don't leave SF without taking a trip here. The Aqua frescas are delicious and ice cold. Best tacos and burritos. I'm obviously a fan.
author: Nick S.

description: Carne asada Nick's Way, yummmmmers! Try it! Really good flavor to the meat. Also their guacamole is delicious. And they have bubbly water on tap for free. Can get crowded... but the counter service line moves pretty fast.
author: Kali L.

description: The burritos taste fine, but at the cost of very high salt and fat content.
author: Kevin M.

description: I was wondering in the Fillmore when I walked in to Tacko, they gave me the most warm and genuine welcome. I ordered three tacos, the duck, carne asada and shrimp. And all three were amazing, fresh ingredients and the right amount of seasoning. I also order a margarita, no to sweet not too boozy, just perfect. But I was most impressed with their hospitality and will to to above and beyond.
author: Yadira G.

description: My new favorite tacko's in the city.  I don't mind paying a little bit more for the tacko's Nicks way as they are huge taco's and with a side of chips and salsa (get this on the side not on top the chips).  You can eat pretty good for around $8.00.  Although I love the price, the chips are the kind that mom used to make and the salsa selection is wonderful.  The garlic habenero is my  favorite.  Must eat place, unfortunately its only in the Marina.
author: Ray A.

description: Not authentic of course but pretty decent tacos & carne asada. Huge hot sauce collection too!
author: Mj M.

description: Best Horchata I have had! It is so delicious and rich in flavor. I love their tacos... I always get the Chicken Nick's Way Taco. If I am in a rush they are quick in preparing the food. And if I have time to enjoy my meal, the place has a great atmosphere.
author: Megan B.

description: Still absolutely DELICIOUS!!!! Every time I come I order an "elote," the corn on the cob with Mexican cheese, and all the other patrons ask me what it is. Don't bother asking, just order it!!!! It's so tasty. I just made a daring move, though, and ordered something different from my usual Nick's Way chicken taco...I tried the chicken quesadillas. GREAT decision. My hubby did the same but substituted the chicken for mahi mahi and says he'll never order something else ever again - he enjoyed it that much. In case you're wondering they're pretty big. Imagine a huge tortilla folded in half and loaded with chicken, salsa, and cheese, fothen cut once in half again. Plus, they're lightly fried so the crispness gives a great texture and taste. Did I mention there are two four top tables outside so you can bring your dog?!
author: Kelsey K.

description: Taco Tuesday at Taco...three street tacos for a few bucks.  Great deal.  All fresh food, great tacos and burritos, clean, nice place with a good common table in the middle for a big group.  it can get crowded, so we show up early.  Also, if you aren't into Mexican, these guys randomly do a lobster roll...which is also pretty much awesome, and hard to find around San Francisco.
author: randal w.

description: Worst lobster roll I've ever had. First it cost $17 and change, the sandwich was like a think slice of bread with a slit cut in it like a hotdog bun. Salty fishy after taste was the flavor of the seven pieces of lobster meat. Oh and you get a bag of chips. Don't waste your money like I did.
author: Lisa-Marie C.

description: Quesadilla, XX and you are good to go. Tacko is a great place if you don't have too much time but still want to get some decent Mexican food. Btw, their guacamole is pretty good too
author: Filippo D.

description: Chips and salsa with the table red sauce was a definite highlight. Chicken was bland. Found a bone but the carne asada was delicious. Nice decor as well. Would return again.
author: Tommy W.

description: Oh my Yelp stars this place is fantastic. I stuffed my pie hole with their chips and salsa until they were almost coming out of my ears and then of course I remembered that I had a burrito to eat. So I shoved the chips out of my sight and concentrated on my mission style burrito. I'm not sure if this even makes sense but this thing melted in my mouth. Everything just blended together so perfectly, I've been dreaming about it ever since. Do yourself a favor and head over there. They also have a crapload of hot sauces. I didn't know there was so many. Happy Eating!!
author: Laurie K.

description: Would a burrito by any other name sound or taste as sweet. O' Tacko how I long for your burrito on a cold, windy day after my vapid day of cold calling . You are the reason I hum and I long to be reunited with your wonderful Carne Asada
author: Fayzan R.

description:
Great staff! Super friendly! Love the Nicks Way tacos! 
Always a line and well worth the wait.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos meets Nantucket pastels? -- I did not see this coming.

I could eat these tacos every day. I'd probably become a bit squishier if I did so, but that's neither here nor there. In a blind taste test, I could never tell the difference between Tacko tacos and NCT tacos. Both are excellent and keep me coming back. 

The scene is very casual and is great for grabbing a quick bite on the go. The Nantucket theme is bit odd to me, but to each his/her own.

Worth a go, and be sure to get your tacos Nick's way!
author: Peter C.

description:
This place rocks. First, a heads-up about what you're getting into: This is a counter-focused, sit-down-with-a-number-and-we'll-bring-it-to-you kinda place, so don't expect tableside service and baskets of free chips n' salsa and you'll do fine.

This brings me to my next point: Order. The. Tortilla chips. These things are thick, crunchy, and delicious, able to withstand the soggifying effects of salsa and guacamole alike with impunity. They are the Omega Chip, the tortilla fragments to which all other chips aspire. Seriously, they're good. Get them with guac or salsa or whatever, but GET THEM.

Dinner here was great, too. I had an enormous San Francisco burrito stuffed full of beans, rice, guac, and more, then delightfully crisped on the grill. My wife had a quesadilla jam-packed with carnitas and other fillings, to the point where it was more like a semi-flat chimichanga.

Finally, we had a 'Margaritaish,' which, as far as we could tell, is a really freaking strong Margarita with crushed ice. It was delicious, and for $6, you totally get your money's worth. Besides the great food, Tacko is fast, clean, and staffed by friendly people. 

What's not to like?
author: Matthew L.

description: Love the ambiance- felt straight out of Montauk. Their menu and selection were hard to chose just one item! Went with a shrimp burrito and modelo. Their tortillas are delicious!
author: Michelle Q.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos meets Barefoot Contessa for a one-night stand in the Marina (read: much cleaner, newer and nicer than the Polk St. location).

9 months later, Tacko pops out.
author: Tori S.

description:
Place is yummy, my friend explained that this is one of SF's top mexican food spots. He's a lover of California Burritos...so he said this place was a must.

You order your food at your counter & then it is taken to your table. Prices are a bit expensive, a burrito costs $10 in comparison to San Diego, where you can grab one for about $5. 

Food: I ordered the TORTILLA SOUP, i have to admit it was delicious, i will go back for more! It was a perfect portion, also included chicken so no complaints there.

Will have to return for soup, but burritos...rather grab a chipotle one for a lower cost.
author: Priscilla N.

description:
Tacko is like the Land Rover of taco joints...good location, nice looking interior, and costs twice as much as any other place.  Couple that with the fact that once you eat your taco and walk out the door, you realize your meal was only worth half of what you paid and, within a few hours, you may need some regular maintenance.  

Don't get me wrong, I think it's great that I can pay over $8 for a burrito that is the size of a twinkie or that three "street-style" tacos taste as if they actually made contact with Fillmore St.  The meat was dry and flavorless.  Tortilla was overcooked and chewy.  The accompanying salsa was watered down and tasted of bath water.  Perhaps adding taste was an additional $2 option.  Lastly, the drink selection, other than beer, leaves much to be desired...worst impersonation of "sangria" I may have ever had.    

But, hey, it's in the Marina (Cow Hollow) and it's got the current hip factor...too bad the Taco Bell a block away may be a better option.
author: Eric H.

description:
This review is mostly for the California Burrito (only thing I've tried) and it was bad. I really wanted to like it- I even lowered my standards and told myself not to expect anything. If anything maybe even lowered expectations too. 

But it was bad- bland, uninspired and not tasty. It strange the elements but together it just didn't work. Fries were soggy and I think tossed in some sort of seasoning (Cajun maybe?). Carne Asada was tender in texture but bland and tasteless. And the burrito was assembled poorly, I would get bites of only cheese with soggy fries and then random bites of what I can only assume was salsa. It was not good at all.

Overall- maybe try tacos or something else cause the burrito is not worth the effort or calories...
author: Rose T.

description: This place was within walking distance of our hotel. I'm not quite sure what they're going for as far as what the restaurant is supposed to be. It has a nautical theme with Nantucket decorations, they serve Mexican food, and the to go cartons are Chinese takeout. LOL  However, the food is AMAZING. This is the only place that we have come back to twice. The red sauce that they have on the tables is one of the best sauces I have ever tried. It is a smokey peppery sauce that I wish I could take home with me! We will definitely miss this place!
author: Tara T.

description:
1 word. Gringoria.  The chicken is watery and bland. All of the food is overpriced.  It has a clean interior, which is sort of nice in contrast to all of the mission taquerias, but isn't a taqueria supposed to be a lil dirty?  I give it 2 stars because they at least have $2 Tecates.

2 stars for Tacko.
author: Joe G.

description:
Yes, I am a Caucasian-American, but I've lived most of my life in Southern California. I like to think I know my way around a taco. I have seen the glory of Roberto's. I bore witness to the miracle that is King Taco. I know what a baja style taco is supposed to be.

I guess I shouldn't be so down on them because Tacko does not even purport to be at all Mexican. Somehow they have decided that the world needs a New England style taco, as evidenced by the mural of Nantucket Island on the wall. Apparently what this means is that you get a taco that is aimed at the jet-setting yacht race crowd, which is to say bland, tasteless, one meat indistinguishable from the last.

Is this chicken poached? Why was the carne asada chopped up before it was overcooked? Don't they know you cook the meat in larger flat pieces, *then* chop it up so it's not like eating giant sand grains?

I've never had a trio of tacos so overwhelmingly mediocre. I was there at lunchtime on a Friday. I should have known better when I walked in and most of the crowd consisted of 30-something, white moms with their off-road baby carriages. That is the palate Tacko is aiming for, and they hit that nail right on the head. The red sauce on the table tasted more like the green. Very mild. Very unassuming. Safely unoffensive.

Tacolicious is by no means authentico, and their menu is also very, very white. But at least their tacos have taste. At least there is some heat. Their chicken is like crack. In a town with so much good, authentic Mexican food as well as pretty decent gavacho food aimed at hipsters, Tacko misses the mark by a fathom.

UPDATE: BTW, cash only? Really? I can understand/expect that at a dumpy BBQ joint or food cart, but if you're attempting to be a high-class, east coast, yacht-club taco joint, you better accept the gold card. I can use a debit card to buy ice cream from a shipping crate on Octavia, I better be able to buy some high-class tacos with it.
author: Matt J.

description:
The food was delicious.  The salsas were delicious, very flavorful. service was friendly and fast.
