I just wish I had not gone in on a day when every annoying marina mom and their 2 toddlers and over-sized strollers decided it was taco day for lunch.  It think that is every day though...so avoid at lunch.  At dinner all you have to deal with are the Stepford, ahem, I mean the marina crowd.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Eh.  I can take it or leave it.  They get points for having a tasty lobster roll, but lose them for having lobster on the menu, yet being cash-only.  Leave the slummin' it theme to the places that have earned the right, not your Nantucket-cum-tacKo truck-Marina restaurant. The boats on the wall coupled with fried tacos just don't add up.  Maybe a small sign to explain? I don't even know why I care, but I am not alone in the wondering.

I do not understand the line out the door, either, and then there is The Manager. I assume he is the manager because he stands at the register and greets who he wants while barking at the ONE girl running around trying to service everyone waiting at a table.  We also witnessed him being Nazi-stern to the kitchen staff who was busting ass to serve up 800 tacos to demanding Marina-ites in fancy sweats.  To be fair, I will update this if I go back and things are more pleasant.

Note to you Mr. Manager:  We can hear it when you are rude to your staff and its not cool, its not winning you Yelp points, and it certainly makes your food seem less interesting.  I can go around the corner to Tacolicious and have a platter of taco-truck fun and use my checkcard.  

Also, a lesson in etiquette- if you are handing out drinks to a few customers because they look like they are tired of standing in line, it is extremely wrong to be select.  You asked the group in front of me, and then a guy behind me if they wanted a beer.  I had to question whether the outfit I had on was unnacceptable for this club-like mentality.  If you want to win loyalty you should be sincere and ask everyone who waited in that unnecessary line (then found they had to get cash from a telly) if they want a drink.  Duh.  I did not want your horchada, but it would have been nice to have been offered the nasty stuff and leave without questioning my looks.

My last question and comment is about the California burrito.  Why is it this particular burrito that gets the french fries? I am not complaining, it was mostly good but it could have used some beans to even it out.  Just like the theme here is confusing, I am curious as to why the California version is the one with fries inside.  Avacados or something may have been more appropriate- leaving credit for the "fries inside" to the Philly fans. 

TacKo is so-so.  They seem confused, much like the name.  I can't seem to say it out loud without sounding like a sarcastic "bro", which is annoying even when I am saying it solo without anyone around.
author: Kathleen P.

description:
I found it!!  After many months of searching, I have found my perfect taco place in San Francisco.  The food is amazing, and you do not have to wait forever to get a seat.  
We order take out, and dine in on a regular basis.  No matter how we order, the food is always great and consistent.
The street style tacos are a staple, and they are only 2$ on Tuesdays!  Steak is my favorite of the street style.  I also always must order elote (get that corn out of mah face!), and the baja fried fish taco.
Seriously well done guys.  Great food, great prices, no lines, and always consistent.  You can't ask for anything better than that!
author: Jean G.

description: Great little Mexican place in the Marina/Cow Hollow district. Unique take on their burritos. I had the San Francisco chicken burrito, it was pretty good they had nice big chunks of chicken breast in it. Went on a Thursday evening and they had dos equis on for $3 each! Yes please!
author: A H.

description:
Ever since I moved from San Diego there's been a hole in my heart the size and shape of a California Burrito. When I heard Tacko had a version of my much-beloved CA Burrito, I had high hopes that they empty void in my heart was going to be filled...but alas it's as empty as ever and my quest for a good version of the CA Burrito goes on.

Tacko's version of the CA Burrito is so-so and at $8 I was left thinking, "I could get 2 burritos in SD!". The carne asada isn't half bad, in fact better than at most any other Mexican place I've had in SF; the fries are crisply done; but the individual elements of the burrito (cheese, pico de gallo) just never come together...oh well...the potential is there but it just fell short.

Also tried my friends chicken burrito and it was worse than "meh". Chicken was unseasoned and seemed as if they simply boiled and then shredded the meat...blah...
author: David H.

description:
I refer to it as the Tacko Predicament.  

It is located right around the corner from my place (+1), its clean (+1), staff always cool (+1), has maybe the best habanero salsa I have ever had (+1) and you can phone in and jump the line (+2)!

But here comes the predicament part:

I live in the two blocks over and I pay rent here, so I know its not cheap....but $13 for a burrito because I added fries to it?  Ya, ok I throw the change and a dollar into the tip jar, but its not the employees fault, why punish them for the blatant Reganomics taking place.  It's a burrito, a carne asada burrito...and its just ok.  The carne is fairly sparse to be honest and the burrito itself will never be on man vs. food.  Maybe I'm just too spoiled having grown up in San Diego and having more than my share of cheap, giant and very tasty burritos over the years.  Maybe Im getting a bit more scrooge-like in my old age...but something about a $13 burrito creates moral dillemas for me.  (-3)
author: Mark C.

description:
Direct rip off of La Taqueria's tacos on Mission and 25th. To the penny. 

+3 as you are copying it well. -2 for not giving La Taqueria credit or a kick back.
author: Adam X.

description:
I like to think I am quite a polite and pleasant person to encounter, so when someone is unprecedentedly rude to me, I take quite offense. So I am very excited to get my revenge today by rating my first 1-star restaurant!! Yay.

Last night, after realizing my lovely Tacolicious was closed for a private party (shout out to T-lish woo!), we decided to try Tacko for the first time...and the rumors are true...Nick is a huge dbag. Food was alright, line was super long, and we sat at the center communal table where the barstools are very high and there are no footrests. After two buckets of beers, we were all in pain awkwardly dangling our feet off the extremely uncomfortable stools. 

So when we are finishing up Nick comes up and asks: "How is everything?"
Me: Good...why no footrests??
Nick: Looks like you are finishing up your food and drink...are you about to leave?
Me: Why yes we are...if i can stand up that is, since i cannot feel my legs.
Nick: Would you be leaving if there were footrests?
Me: Well no, we'd probably stay and order more food and drinks from your restaurant, Nick. 
Nick: This is an in and out kind of place, we don't want you lounging around, if you dont like it you dont have to come here. 

So for one I have never heard of inflicting pain and discomfort on your customers for a quicker turnover, but let's say the one star I give you goes to your creative business strategy there. However, let me point out to you, Nick, this is the marina, where we specialize in "lounging". You cannot place your business several steps from the triangle and expect people to rush in and out like its lunch hour in the financial. If you don't want people to stick around...don't serve alcohol! Especially don't serve alcohol in fun group sized neon buckets!! Next time I want to wait in a long ass line for shitty tacos, I will be sure to go to Nick's instead (which Nick is no longer a part of because his business partner gave him the boot).  I WONDER WHY..

Lounging is fun, rude people are not.
author: Laura M.

description:
Had a great meal here with a friend who is extremely picky about his food since he is a caterer.  We were not disappointed.

Went shopping for eyeglasses at See Eyewear  -- blood sugar was running dangerously low and needed to have lunch.  After looking up and down the street for a reasonable place to eat, we felt disillusioned. Didn't want a $15 hamburger with booze for lunch.  We wanted healthy food at a decent price.

I didn't get what the name "Tacko" meant (Nantucket + Taco), but the friendly owner Nick explained the concept of the restaurant, and some of his east coast background.

I also wanted foot-rests at the high table like one of the other reviewers.  I like to be comfortable while I eat.  I soon forgot that there weren't foot rests when I bit into my delicious carnitas quesadilla.

Food was very tasty.  Decor was really great too. Minimal AND inviting. Restaurant is extremely clean and well done - staff is attractive and friendly and used excellent food safety practices. 


Totally love the self-serve Carbonated water complete with carafes and glasses - for FREE :-)

Wish we had a place like this in the Castro.   I would definitely haunt this place for regular good eats. 

While Nick the owner is straight, he was definitely gay friendly and has really great taste in food and decor and is extremely personable. The extra touch of Nick coming to visit with us during our meal was a treat.
author: Ed C.

description: My veggie taco was STUFFED and overflowing with guac and salad - I thought if need a fork to eat it, but managed.  Loved the soft and hard tortillas sandwiched together.  High quality products make for tasty and healthy grub. Mexican with Californian sensibility and freshness. I would have ordered Lobster roll but not a fan of foccacia. Prefer crusty baguette to spongy Italian bread.  The fresh tender corn with spicy cheese coating was also YUMMY and quite authentic.
author: blaine s.

description: This place is great. I felt like I was in Nantucket. I had the fish taco "Nick's Style." It was the best tasting taco I have ever eaten. The place is clean. The people are nice. The service is quick. They have a good selection of beer, wine, and aqua Fresca, I mean what more do want? Give it a try?
author: Stephen B.

description:
Good Burritos, good tacos.  I don't get the connection with Cape Cod, though.

Service was really slow given that this is a Taco/Burrito place and the low customer volume while I was there.

Number one complaint is that it is cash only.  Come on, this is the 21st century and I don't feel comfortable carrying cash.  I see your ATM in the corner and don't feel like paying the extra fee.  Serve the customers better and get more stars.
author: Michael M.

description:
I come here for one thing and one thing only - Nick's carne asada tacos. Soft on the outside, crispy on the inside, and delicious everywhere else. The service also happens to be outstanding. They always go out of their way to be super nice and accommodating - offering chips while you wait for a to-go order, for example - and for God's sake, just smiling. You don't realize how little people behind counters smile until it happens to you. 

Yeah, the theme is random and confusing, but at least it's unique. Keep it up, Tacko!
author: Kiesha R.

description: This place was so good and very reasonably priced.  I had the most delicious street corn here along with a fish taco and a beer....all for about $15.  People I was woth also loved there food.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Sarah E.

description: Got a chicken SF Burrito and it was honestly one of the better burritos of my entire life.  The food was great, the service was fast, and the selection of hot sauces was great!  Also there were just glasses for water sitting near the water so I didn't even need to ask.
author: Branden T.

description: The flavors of the dishes are pretty authentic even if the combinations or methods are not strictly what you would find in Mexico (coming from a full blooded Mexican).  The crispy fried tacos "Nicks Way" are delicious and overflowing with guacamole.  I highly recommend the Watermelon agua fresca; it brings back fond childhood memories.  My lunch companions enjoyed their food as well (tortilla soup and burritos).  The only complaint is that all the food was on the salty side.  It's worth checking it out.
author: Patricia M.

description: I've never had Nick's Crispy tacos, and I didn't have them here either. I'll just have to come back. However the lobster was tasty. It was a bit on the small side but it had good flavor. Better to have not enough of something good than too much of something that sucks. Tacko we shall meet again. Next time crispy tacos to be had
author: Kim N.

description:
If you want bland Mexican Food got to Tacko!

I went for my first visit to Tacko with no expectations. It all sounds like a good idea and I guess the name says it all East Coast Taco's.

I order the standard street taco's and a carne asada nick taco. Unfortunately the food has no taste, its bland. The whole premise of Mexican food is big flavor and savory taste, this is not what Tacko brings to the table. This kind of Mexican food will fly on the east coast but not California.
author: Jason M.

description:
Hello!!!! Nicks-esq Crispy Tacos walking distance from my house!!! Yes!!!! Not EXACTLY the same as Nick's, but damn sure close enough. 

They even have the red salsa on the tables that I LOVE. 

I would give it a 5 star review - but it's cash only. Lame.
author: Alison M.

description: I'm giving them five stars cause I really can't find anything wrong with what they do. They are affiliated with taco shop@under dogs, nicks crispy tacos and formally with rouge, so it's the same menu. I feel like this is better quality and prep due to the open kitchen.  I recommend the carnitas nicks way, for beginners. For the more adept, try the sopa de tortilla. And for the master foodie, get the lobster roll. Very friendly staff. Can get busy during dinner rush. Best time is 2pm lunch.
author: Matt H.

description:
Mexican in the marina, so not much can be expected. But it's decent, which is better than the other places around here. Their baja burrito is far superior to the other burritos. The tacos are a good size and the pitchers of their drinks make this place a convenient stop if you are out in the marina with friends and want somewhere to eat and drink.  They would be a good late night stop but they avoid having to deal with the drunk crowd by closing at 10pm.

It opens at 11:30am (a little past 11:30am when I went there today) and it's not good enough to stay hungry for 30 more minutes, so I probably won't add it to the normal rotation of places I get lunch at but it's nice to have in the neighborhood.
author: Jeff L.

description:
Tacko is great.  My buddy and I stumbled on it while we were walking up Fillmore.  I got the street tacos and chips with pico de gallo spread on top.  The two salsa containers on the table was a good thing.  Everything was very tasty, and the restaurant has a cool vibe. 
Go try it out.
author: Stuart V.

description:
Carne Asada tacos Nick's Way and Horchata, man. Serious. 

P.S. I've read that they got Lobster Rolls too... I hope they're still in season.
author: Faffy L.

description: Yum!  We walked 3 miles from the Ferry Building, working up an appetite for lunch and Tacko's did not disappoint.  We had the yummy guacamole with authentic chips and enjoyed the California Burrito with carne asada/steak.  Very fresh and flavorful. Sangria was so-so but we were not there for the drinks!  Would definitely come back again to try the crispy tacos!
author: Michaela G.

description:
This is no authentic Mexican restaurant, but if you're going for that California-Mexican type ish... you'll find it here no problem. This place has abundant amounts of seating. Even during a busy rush I never have a problem locating some empty seats for my friends and I. 

They also have an incredible amount of beverage choices. Mexican sodas, regular sodas, cervezas, and fresh and fruity homemade sangria. Score. There are copious amounts of hot sauce for your choosing located by the water station. You can grab a few and bring them to your table. They probably have at least 40 different kinds of hot sauce so you're options are pretty much endless when it comes to spicing things up.

I order the vegetarian burrito which is insane. The burritos are a good size, and they are delicious! You can tell the ingredients are fresh, and I appreciate that. They even have their own salsas in squeeze bottles located on every table in the restaurant. I believe these are the same salsas that Nick's Crispy Tacos serves up at their restaurant (as this place is owned by the same people). The green salsa is my favorite, and usually the only one I use.
author: Ashley D.

description: I'll be the first to say that I'm not a fan of Nick's Crispy tacos...but Tacko is a different story. I was really craving a lobster roll and was impressed by Tacko. The lobster roll was $18 which was a bit steep but lobster isn't cheap so no complaints there. I REALLY liked the corn they sell. Much like what I can get in the Mission from a street vendor so I that made me happy. Thanks NIck!
author: Carlos A.

description:
No comparison to Nick's cripsy tacos....waited for almost 30mins for order to be taken as line grew longer and there hardly were any seats....the guy taking orders cleaned in between customers making the line longer, then he said all tacos are nicks way...so when I ordered the fish I found that not all were nicks way.

Our order came out randomly and we all ate at different times....it took way to long for our food and was not worth the wait.

Probably won't go back unless they have a good happy hour.
author: Hillary B.

description:
Tried this place for the first time tonight.  I was referred by a friend and I was really impressed.  The place is nice and clean ,which always matters to me.  Service is spot on.  Juliana, Emily and Gunter are great servers and were super friendly.  We ordered Grilled Mahi Tacos (Nick's Way), a carne asada quesadilla, shrimp salad, and horchata.  Yum!  I love horchata, and theirs is especially good.  So was everything!  

Thanks guys for an enjoyable meal and for pointing out where to put the compostables and recyclables and silverware(the earth has enough plastic forks in landfills already).  I appreciate that you care about mother earth too.

We will be back !
author: Paula C.

description: Expensive for being not that good. I ordered the carnitas taco and the beer battered fish taco. The fish taco had no flavor and a nasty mayonnaise filled slaw on it. The carnitas one was fine, but filled with mostly beans. My fiancé ordered the shrimp burrito - and described it as "meh" - it didn't have enough flavor. We also ordered an order of guac, which was fine, but again, pretty flavorless. We drank water and it cost us $40. If we're paying that much for tacos, they should be good at least. I prefer Tacolicious.
author: Jillian P.

description:
Yum!

I was really happy to hear that Tacko had the same owners at Nick's Crispy tacos because I'm a huge fan. I went to try it out on Tuesday (clearly, Taco Tuesday) and the food was amazing, just like at Nick's. I ordered WAY too much-- 

Carne Asada Taco, Nick's way
Baja Fish Taco, Nick's way
Corn

Everything was so delicious, and the tacos were so big I wasn't able to finish them. I'm so happy to know this place is so close to my apartment (or am i?)

The only downside is that the Taco Tuesday wasn't nearly as cool as at Nick's. The street tacos were $2 and Tecate's were $2, but that's about it. I would have liked to see some margarita or pitcher specials....The vibe also wasn't as great. There weren't as many people there and they didn't have the party music on!

BUT one thing that really blew my mind was the selection of hot sauce--they had everything you could ever want to smother your taco in! I will absolutely be back to eat tacos here again!
author: Holly G.

description: Very rude and obnoxious service. I would dissuade anyone from giving business here. I had to wait for thirty minutes for me food and when I asked about it- it turned out it was already ready- but no one had called my name. And rather than apologize, the server implied it was my fault. Food was cold and not good.
author: Megumi G.

description:
Pro's: Tasty Carne Asada, Wall of hot sauces, plenty of seating, great clean environment.

Con's: No footrest...that sucked, we got up and found a table. Got my order wrong, San Francisco Burrito sounds a lot like Shrimp Salad...but they quickly corrected the mistake. Cash only :( 

Will I go back? For sure, I want to try the Lobster Roll next time.
author: Kevin B.

description:
After the last two experiences with Tacko I need to give it one star. I'll explain.

I live in the neighborhood and frequent Tacko with the family on a weekly basis (or at least we did). We love the food and convenient location to our house. 

We have also ordered catering portions for events from Tacko (as recently as three weeks ago). Suffice it to say, I feel we are good customers.

This evening we ordered by phone for pick up. We were told 15 mins. We went to pick up but the food was not ready. Not an issue. Stuff happens. However the verbal ATTITUDE we received when we commented that this was the second time in a week that our order was delayed (and completely wrong to add), was way off base. The knob jockey behind the counter was SO dismissive and rude (and did I mention walked away in mid sentence) that we decided to end our relationship with Tacko. There are too many great places in the hood with better customer service to spend your money in. I left my phone number and name for the manager to call so I could give him some candid feedback, but so far radio silence. This is a restaurant that has apparently decided since they get so much foot traffic that be damned with customer service. As any mid to long term resident in Cow Hollow will attest......they eventually flame out of business as soon as their customer service starts to slide. 

Such a shame, because the food is decent. Up yours Tacko.
author: Redbone C.

description:
I have to admit, tacos are one of my favorite foods by far!  Tacos all kinds of ways, so long as they are tasty and have good, fresh ingredients.

After living in Russian Hill, and walking to Nick's Crispy tacos (way too many times than I'd like to admit), I was hooked!  Those tacos are something else.  And I'm from So. Cal so I know tacos!  Everyone I've brought from LA that has come to visit me has loved those tacos as well.  Sure I love the smaller taco truck style tacos and I love my homemade crunchy tacos, but these are killer.  Since Nick's I've gone to Tortilla Heights and now Tacko.  I've got to say that I'm pretty skeptical about ordering seafood tacos, but those Baja tacos are nothing short of amazing!  That creamy sauce, the crunchy cabbage and that FISH and batter, so fresh and so light and crisp!  The shrimp ones are pretty killer too.  Not sure about the lobster roll.  After having experienced them for the first time in New England I'm not sure what would compare!  

On a side note, they have white and red sangria and serve it in glasses or in a child's sand bucket which I happen to think is SUPER DUPER cute!

Will be back...of course!

P.S.  Sure it's CASH ONLY, but they do have an ATM located inside.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I am adjusting my review I have tried tacko many times and it's not as bad as I thought it was it's actually pretty decent I think the San Francisco carne asada is pretty good especially when you use the red sauce on it hot sauce. But they also have the best seltzer carbonated water in town. And it comes with the burrito. Great
author: B G.

description:
Not bad at all!  I was very skeptical about coming here after reading other reviews.  I was literally shaking when walking in, hoping I don't mess up on my order and have the owner yelling at me, telling me he doesn't need my business.  I get to the counter and the guy is extremely nice!  Whew.....what a relief....not what I was expecting.  I get three mini steak tacos to go.  No issue there.  Originally, I wanted three grilled chicken tacos, but a guy, who I believe might have been the owner told the one taking my order to explain to me they only have chicken mole.  So, I ended up getting the grilled steak tacos.  Everyone seemed to be very nice and professional.  I will definitely be returning. 

The only downside is the cash only policy.
author: Ryan M.

description: Found the food to be just okay!  Nothing special.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description:
I'm a big fan of the tacos at Nick's and the taco shop at Underdog's, so when I heard Tacko was opening, I knew what to expect, and I knew that I'd like it.  I was especially excited to try a lobster roll to go with my carnitas taco nick's way.  

I convinced my coworkers to go here last week to celebrate a birthday in the group.  Luckily, every loved the food here and said they'd definitely be willing to come back.  

While waiting in line, we were greeted by Nick, who upon discovering there was a birthday in the group, treated us to free chips and guac.  Score.  We were planning on ordering those already.  From there we may have gone a little overboard.  Each of us got at least one taco.  Carnitas, carne asada, shrimp, and fish.  Everyone said there's were delicious (of course i already knew that).  Then 2 people got chicken quesadillas (which are huge!), I got the taco salad, and the birthday girl got another taco.  

Sadly, the lobsters had missed their flight that morning, so no lobster roll.  But when we come back, I'm going to make sure the lobsters made it to the airport because it sounds delicious.  

Everyone was still settling into the running of the new restaurant (only being a week old), but the place was already crowded, and timing and efficiency were pretty good.  

I worry though, since I know how crazy Nick's gets on Taco Tuesdays.  Tacko may soon develop a following making it impossible for a quick, casual bite.  But man, those tacos are just so tasty!
author: Anne Marie B.

description: So a friend at work tells me about this "great" Mexican restaurant in the hood. So I decided to check it out. First time ordered a burrito, a bit overpriced and as far as taste ok, nothing to write home about. Today I was  craving Mexican food and thought I'd give Tacko a second try. What a disappointment!  Ordered tortilla soup. First it took 15 min for my ordered to arrive. And when it finally did, whatever it is they  placed in front of me was not tortilla soup but rather a concoction made of salty broth to which they added pico de gallo salsa rather than fresh chopped tomato. To top it all of and I guess to save me time the threw a piece of lime into the soup. The lime is always given on the side. Won't go back. Try la canasta instead, it is only slightly better but at least u r not overpaying for bland food
author: adam m.

description: I am gluten and dairy free so I could only get a street taco and it was pretty good. Nothing to write home about but the agua fresco was delicious!
author: Barbie K.

description: The place is cute and clean. The help is only so so friendly.  I ordered "Poco Queso" because I had to eat something small and fast.  Ew!  Horrible. Menu reads: Just melted jack cheese folded in a crispy flour tortilla"  How can you mess that up? This product is fried. Why doesn't it say that? It looked deep fried and when I bit into it buckets of oil squirted out onto my blouse.  I tried one more bite because I was hungry and it was just so riddled with oil, I had to toss the whole thing.  What a disappointment.
author: Colleen S.

description:
Everything you expect from THE Nick that we all know.

Fresh pico, yummy tacos, awesome quesadilla and cold beer. The service was on!

Well done! This is only after one visit. I am sure I will be back to try more.

inital draft above after first visit. My wife and I have been back twice in 2 weeks. 

Awesome.
author: Jon C.

description:
I have been watching them build this place for a while now and was excited to try it. I got the street taco combo and chips and salsa... 
Maybe I have been spoiled by the awesome taco trucks near me in the East Bay, but everything I got was kind of bland. Especially the chicken, which was the most boring, flavorless thing I have ever had from a Mexican restaurant. The carne asada and carnitas were standard fare, and the chips were too. But they forgot my side of salsa! Lame.
Aside from the food, the decor is awesome and they have a great bar and an impressive selection of hot sauces to choose from. The service was nice if a little slow during the ordering process even though it was not busy in there at all.
Overall I have to give this place a resounding Meh. I will go back in the future and try some their specialties, and see if they can change my mind.
author: Chase C.

description: Place was delicious and would go back when in town again! Nice and casual local place!
author: Tammy J.

description: The food at Tacko was pretty good.  Got the chips with salsa/guacamole (very yummy) and the street taco plate.  It was a nice variety of meats.  I didn't care for the carbonated water....bleh!  Had to go back and get a soda (would have preferred regular tap water).
author: Jessica W.

description: San Diego style California burritos!!!  Under 9 bucks.  Green Flash IPA on draft. Enough said.
author: Ryan T.

description:
if you want a good taco this Is it. 
the steak burrito was great! shrimp taco was delicious.
author: Lino B.

description:
I've made my way through all the meats, and love them all--can't even pick a favorite. The sangria is better than Cha Cha Cha. Great beer and hot sauce selections. 
I was not an Agua fresca fan before, but now I am. The corn is amazing. 
Don't let me forget the chips! Fresh guacamole and tomato rocks. 
I love both the green and red tableside sauces too. 
The atmosphere is friendly and fun with a very charismatic owner. 
I'm so excited to live nearby. It's my new kitchen!
author: Bob Z.

description:
Nick did it again.  If you are looking or a great fish taco/burrito then this is your place.  The "waspy" nantucket inspired ambiance is a creative spin on the latest craze in taco shops... . The staff was extremely friendly and diligent in al aspects of the experience (Nick was on hand as well and seemed like a great guy--engaging with customers making them feel very welcome).

My only knock was the chips and salsa/guac, chips were avg at best and needed an extra dose of the guac--however this was by no means a deal breaker.

I'll be back--frequently.
author: Solbiato S.

description: Just tried Tacko for the first time and went with the Baja Burrito.  The fish was definitely not battered and fried to order.  It tasted like something that came out of the freezer and was beyond disappointing.  Overall the burrito was just not anywhere close to par, and I won't be giving this place another chance by my own volition.
author: Oren T.

description: Chris and the team are great!!!  Just chatted with him and a really friendly guy.  Nothing beats the California burrito. Oh and the red sauce is awesome!!!  I come here probably once a week and am never disappointed. Thanks
author: Just N.

description: Burrito is average.  Pork had a lot of fat.  One bite I ate was just a big chunk of fat without any meat.  The place is very noisy and  full of drunk people.  I would not recommend.  went back for a second time to give another try, will not make that mistake again.
author: Lisa R.

description: Nice big open dining area; after you order your food from the counter, they bring it to your table.  The chips/salsa/guac for $6.50 was good:  I loved the plentiful thick crispy tortilla chips and they gave enough salsa and guacamole where we actually had excess to be used with other stuff.  The cheese quesadilla was a good size to share, it was neither exceptional enough to brag about nor mediocre but I, personally, don't see much differentiation in the world of cheese quesadillas.
author: Ross I.

description:
People really need to stop talking about all the other places that sell tacos in the city and just review the restaurant at hand.  This isnt a poll, its a subjective review/rating of one restaurant.

As for my experience at tacko, it was pleasant: The girl at the register was friendly, my san francisco carne asada burrito was made correctly, and the free chips and salsa they put in the bag were pretty solid.  The burrito itself actually impressed me.  I like that it is thrown on the grill once rolled to give it a charred taste.  The ingredients were well porportioned and no single ingredient overpowered the rest (in my book, the key to a successful burrito).  Its not the type of burrito you would get at a hole in the wall taqueria, but i wasnt expecting it to be, given the wierd cape cod decor.

In summary, I am happy to have found a place close to home to get a solid burrito.  My original unposted draft of this review would have been lower due to the original cash only system which drives me nuts (this has since been replaced with a $10 minimum for plastic - still annoying, but much less so).
author: Tony B.

description: New favorite place near work. They have artisan water on tap with bubbles!!! Food was great too ;o) Yummy salsa and I am picky about salsa.  Yum
author: Kim A.

description: Would actually give this place 3.5 stars because I would return if others wanted to go but I don't crave going back.  Liked that it was clean and easy to just order at the counter.  Pricing was okay.  10yr old son got the 3 street tacos with carnitas and liked them, but said they weren't anything spectacular, they fell apart and didn't feel like it was enough food (said he wanted another whole order).  Said the chips were pretty good.  I had the paleo guacamole (LOVED that they offered this option- thank you!).  It was quite tasty and everyone at the table was asking for some of my veggies.  Glad the veggies were obviously rinsed, but there was quite a puddle of water at the bottom of the basket so could have used a little more drying off.  Beware - if you're not a fan of spice, I think these veggies are sprinkled with a little cayenne.  Wine was fine.  Would like to try the frescos if we go back.
author: L S.

description:
"I was raised in a yacht club..." - hangover 2

The hot sauce collection alone is like 6 stars. The only other place that has a collection like that (to my knowledge) is Dos Pinas.   The house hot sauce was great too. 

I got the Baja style fish taco done Nick's way.  Really good.  AND the corn on a cob...rolled in cheese....sooooo good.  Not to be missed!!!  

I'll be back here...(why do i live so far from here...)
author: Julia H.

description: I actually loved that its just the right amount of busy on Taco Tuesday. Quick service and awesome food!!
author: Jason A.

description: I use to eat here every other day. Haven't been back in a while so on my last visit I was super excited.  Ugh my beef taco had nothing but chunks of fat and my shrimp taco...eh. step it up guys!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Very fairly priced (for the marina/cow hollow neighborhood) and delicious tacos. 

I got a baha taco (lightly battered and flash-fried mahi) taco and fish taco (grilled-to-perfection mahi) "Nick's Way". "Nick's Way" is pretty much a loaded version of a "hard-shell wrapped in soft-corn-tortilla" taco with all sorts of fresh fixins added on top - complete with guac, slaw, and melty cheesy goodness. 

I was also vibing the environment at Tacko - great for third wheel dates and casual gatherings.
author: Morgan K.

description:
Carne Asada Nicks Way!

And...

The chips and salsa are really fresh.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Been a fan of Nick's Crispy Taco's for a long time. So I was thrilled when I heard an 'upgraded' version was moving into Kasa's old spot. 

The Carne Asada Quesadillas, Grilled Corn and Black Bean Taco Salad, and Strawberry Fresca were all delish. 

I ordered shrimps w/ my Taco Salad and got 8 pieces!!! The salad itself was $6.25. With the shrimps it was $9. Such an amazing value for the flavorful food I got. Anywhere else this salad would be at least $15.

I also love that they offer Sangria, Margarita's and 6 different Fresca's, they take credit cards (Nick's doesn't), and the decor is light and modern. 
The only thing that throws me off a little is the whole Nantucket theme of said decor. The only thing remotely 'Nantucket-y' on the menu is the lobster roll. It's strange to base the entire theme of a restaurant that serves Mexican food on one menu item. But they get 5 stars anyway because of the taste of the food, great value, and chic decor (regardless of how misplaced it seems).
author: Maria A.

description:
My actual rating would be 3.5. 

The interior was very bright and fresh, a Nantucket-themed burrito/taco joint...down to a tee, the high top tables and bar counters were a wooden nautical ship deck, the stool bases were white wrought iron and the wall decor made up of Massachusetts, Nantucket and seafaring prints... it added to the charm of the place.

When we walked in at 7ish on a Wednesday night, it was pretty calm, only a few tables were occupied. At that time there also was a happy hour with margaritas and white and red sangria. How could a girl resist? I ordered the seafood tacos with mahi mahi and guac on the side. The fish was perfectly cooked and the cabbage slaw and guac all tasted delicious together. I would liked some sort of spicy kick to bring the whole taco together, but I enjoyed the flour tortillas, they weren't overwhelming and the two tacos served were a good size. The prices were reasonable and the location of the restaurant was great, right off Union Street. You order up front and the meal is served to you, seat yourself, no muss, no fuss. 

I would definitely recommend this place for lunch or a casual, quick dinner.
author: Jess K.

description: Absolutely love Tacko! Consistent, easy, delicious and made with quality. The tacos are good, the burritos are yummy and the guac is on point. The restaurant is randomly Nantucket themed...butttt I'm cool with it. The service is good and it's quick if you're looking to grab something in a time crunch. Thumbs up for Tacko!
author: Ashley S.

description: I don't know how or why I keep happening upon amazing San Francisco taco places, but I do.  This place was absolutely delicious.  The tacos were the perfect size, and extremely fresh.   We arrived 15 minutes before closing, but they were still happy to take our order.  I'm not sure what I like better... Tacko or Tacolicious. Ah!
author: Ian C.

description:
Fresh, Affordable and Friendly.

I'm used to getting my Mexican food in a filthy dump. These guys have raised the bar. Not only are they incredibly friendly and super organized, their food is outstanding. My lady works around the corner and visits there frequently. 

BOTTOM LINE: Mexican food never looked so good.
author: Joe S.

description: I walked into this place not expecting much of the food, but left pleasantly surprised. I ordered the San Francisco with carne asada and prawns (no guac) and it was probably one of the best burritos I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned and juicy down the very last bite. I was originally going to put some hot sauce on it, but I completely forgot about that after a few bites and just wanted to savor the actual flavor on its own. This might be my new go-to for my Mexican cravings.
author: Richard S.

description: Had the California burrito with guacamole and I will say that I wasn't that impressed, the tortilla was really weird tasting and the meat tasted of seafood, maybe it was from the grill and them grilling seafood and the beef next to each other but I will say the proportion was right for the price, I will go back but I will get the tacos next time, I have tried them off my buddies plate and they were a lot better
author: Duke D.

description: Good inexpensive food. No fuss, great for a casual bite. Got the street tacos and the corn on the cob and it was all delicious!
author: Kelly S.

description:
Tacos= delicioso.

Green sauce on table=delish.

Red Sauce on table... not so bueno.  Needed more complexity... was missing something and maybe had just been sitting out too long??

Staff was super friendly and helpful.  Will be back to try a different dish and stick to their great selection of bottled hot sauces.
author: Laura G.

description: I was born and  raised in North of  Mexico,  once in a  while I really want to eat really good authentic Mexican food, that one  that makes me feel  back home.  The only place in the area and it is  one  of my favorite is Tacolucious, but this time  I was really hungry and I didn't want to wait for an hour to get a table so My friend  and I walked up the street to try this place, I walked in and I liked it, looks fun,  the menu got me excited, but the food.. not really, its ok. It is  no bad at all. But it didn't satisfy my craving of super yummy Mexican food.
author: Jessica R.

description: Went there with some colleagues and we called in the order because we were pressed for time. After getting our food we decided it was best to eat there before we went back to the office. As we were eating someone who worked there came up to our table  and told us that we couldn't have togo bags on the table. He then went on to make us take all the loose chips out of the togo bag and put them on napkin so he can throw away the togo bags. Then went on to tell us not to call in then eat there. Great food but i will not be going back due to terrible customer service..
author: Tomjohn B.

description:
For a Tuesday night this place was packed!  You order at the register, they give you a #, and they deliver to your table.  The average wait in line seemed to be a minimum of 15 mins.  

I ordered 2 tacos and a pail (choice of red/white sangria).  I opted for the Nicks Way Tacos - carne asada & gulf shrimp taco.  It was pricey - $24!  The carne asada was definitely the way to go - super tasty and topped with guacamole - yummers!  The gulf shrimp was just ok.  In the pail is crushed ice and your choice of sangria, I opted for the red, and 4 straws.  Not really my style, but you can self serve and pour into the glasses at the counter.  The sangria was just ok, there also serve beer as an alternative.  We sat for about 2 hours, although the seating isn't abundant.    
I had a taste for my friend's tortilla soup and although she thought it was on the bland side, I appreciated it - chunks of avocado, lots of tortilla strips.
author: Meredith K.

description: I love this place and go here all the time. Love the burritos but the steak quesadilla is my favorite. Not the best mexican I've ever had, but I would say top 5.
author: Alan F.

description: I stopped into Tacko with friends after the first Niner playoff game, which came after parking myself at Eastside West for the evening across the street.  Already pretty full from all the beer but deprived of food, Tacko was easily a great option since Pizza Orgasmica had its usual line out the door.  My friends and I found a table by the window inside Tacko; as it turns out we were lucky since we left the bar before it completely let out.  Anyway, I'm usually really picky when it comes to burritos, and I usually am that annoying person who starts off their order with "no this, no this, just a little bit of this, and extra this".  So, imagine my shock when I saw Tacko's menu board that shows the various ways you can include or exclude things in your burrito!  I ordered the San Diego burrito with carne asada, which comes with just cheese, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  And that's it.  And I ate all of it.  Normally I like shrimp tacos, but at $4.50, I saw more value in the San Diego burrito.  I will most definitely be back if I'm in the area, I certainly liked this more than Taco Bell down the street.
author: Lisa I.

description: The food isn't bad....buuuut it's way too watery. The way they serve their chips and salsa is stupid, they put the salsa over the chips like its freaking nachos. My burrito had about a cup a water splooging out of it....awesome. Not to mention I had to ask for my chips and salsa after I received my watery burrito. Also, make sure to ask for light ice or you will get 80% ice 20% horchata.
author: Bianca C.

description:
If you're a fan of Nick's Crispy Tacos or The Taco Shop @ Underdogs in the Sunset, you'll like Tacko. Exact same menu, the only thing different is the decor. I hang out in the Marina way more than I do the Sunset so this is very convenient for me. The only thing I don't like is that the stools are way too high with no foot rest so your legs just dangle. Also the wait in line to order can be a bit long considering you don't get your food right away. Other than that, I've always been a fan and always say these are the best tacos in town. I'm glad they opened this location.

BTW, their hot sauce selection is simply ridiculous.
author: O'Shea J.

description: First let me start by saying you can eat off the floor at Tacko. The place is immaculate and you're greeted right away by friendly staff. The food is fresh, not your typical greasy Mexican joint, and my personal favorite - the Baja Fish Tacos - are so yummy! You can't go wrong with the chips and fresh salsa, and I love that they have a carbonated water drink fountain. Tacko is my new go-to place in the neighborhood. Never a line, never a mess and always a seat!
author: Karen S.

description:
I was holding out on this one-- it feels a little bit fast food-ish, which I didn't love, so I was ready to just never go.

But my boyfriend went, and he LOVED it (and Nick), so I acquiesced and checked it out. 

I wasn't disappointed. Their margaritish was bomb, and the carnitas quesadilla was awesome and also not overly messy.

The tacos were messy, of course, but they were also delicious-- especially with their salsas. 

I think I prefer Tacolicious, but when I'm in a rush/not in the mood to wait for an hour, this'll be my go-to
author: Michi K.

description:
Major plusses:
Carbonated water self-serve
Hot sauce bar
Food

Minor minus:
My complete inability when I first walked in to decipher the connection between Nantucket and Nick's Crispy Tacos.

Overall, great food, cool place, very nice on a nice day.
author: Marc M.

description: Love this place in the Marina. My friend and I come here ALL the time and its very consistent. The food is always very fresh, the drinks, although simple are great (sangria, beer, margarita, sodas, etc). I go back and forth between Tacos Nicks Way and the Tacko Salad with beef. The lines usually go really fast and you can typically easily find an easy place to sit. Love eating here and it's a go to for us.
author: Brent T.

description:
This time, the review is just for the food. I don't care if this food tastes like what white people think Mexican food is etc. I love food of Mexican origin, whether it is in a Houston (TX) taqueria, at a taco truck in the Mission, at Regalito, Mamacita or Tacko. Vive la difference!!
I like the consistency at Tacko - knowing exactly what I will get every time I order a Shrimp Taco, Nick's way. Prices are a little higher than those at Nick's Crispy on Polk but I guess the location justifies it.
author: Viv A.

description: I have been a taco Nick's way fan for years so having them now locally has been such a treat. The shop is always clean and fresh, a great interior space that just feels calm and relaxing.  Burritos feel healthy and the taco salad is a nice change from the usual fare. While they don't have a full bar to offer, the Margaritish made with Agave and triple sec is spectacular and offers a strong punch.  Often Nick will stroll down the line of people waiting to order and offer a drink. Doesn't get any better than that.
author: Howard R.

description:
Long time user, first reviewer. I am giving four star's based on Tacko's potential. 

Goods: the hot sauce selection was amazing including the home made green and red sauce, there was easy access to water with large cups (cough Nicks Crispy Tacos), and the california burrito was pretty ok! 

My gripes: the guac was a little bland, the salsa in my burrito was a little too sweet, and the size of the burrito left room for appetite. They are sooo close to having the first really good California burrito in San Francisco (carne asada burrito with french fries).  If they get this right, they could make a killing. 

Decor: cool decor but the menu was impossible to read until you are next in line - put a light on that thing or have one of your table cleaners pass out menus to people in line with a friendly hello!!  

Elephant in the room: worth checking out on potential. I live close to both Nicks and Tacko. For the next 3 months, nine times out of ten I would choose Nicks even though they dont have a California Burrito...yet. 

edit - clarification
author: Elliot H.

description: Ate here for lunch today.  Very tasty.  I had the carne asada taco "Nick's Way."  The meat was perfect and the guacamole excellent. The atmosphere is nautical which is kind of fun.  I would eat here again.
author: Christy L.

description: Great lunch spot! They're quick, super friendly & the food is great. My go to is the vegetarian tacos, comes with chips. Only $3.80 with tax and is plenty of food.
author: Carlynn A.

description: Probably the best Mexican food in Pac Heights. Well-seasoned ingredients, properly cooked, quickly (but not too quickly) delivered. Ignore the anemic salad options and don't think too deeply about the weird Nantucket vibe. Kid friendly too.
author: 1 D.

description:
I have been here three times, and each time have had great experiences with the food and service. 

I am not typical a carne asada person or even a big taco eater, but this one rocks. The steak is high quality, expertly prepared, served in a lightly fried corn tortilla which is nested in a flour tortilla. It comes with beans, salsa, cheese and a yummy, clean guacamole. Definitely a craveable dish. Same story on the chicken taco. 

My son has had the cheese quesadilla, and it was crispy and d'lish. 

The horchata and strawberry aqua fresca was quite good, too. 

My wife and kids all really dug, and it's hard to get everyone on same page about where to eat. 

Will be back often.
author: Mark S.

description:
Finally Google + was useful. 
Saw a friend post pictures and the food looked good. 

Before kickball playoffs wanted to get a quick meal so I ordered their version of a Burrito bowl and it was quite good.

Two things I really liked
1) self serve water/soda water (I drink a lot of water and do not like bothering the staff)
2) Amazing selection of self serve salsa. 

Good Job!
author: Marcus R.

description:
Nick, the owner, is the best! After waiting in line for 15 minutes to order I was informed that they're "cash only" (I failed to miss the little sign that was posted). Not a problem - Nick allowed me to eat on credit and just asked that I pay them next time. So nice! He and Bob (?) were doing a great job making sure everyone was happy. You can tell customer service is very important to them.

My chicken taco (Nick's way, OF COURSE) was stuffed full of meat and a generous dollop of guac. Chicken tortilla soup was also very satisfying and hearty for a soup. I like the counter in the back overlooking the kitchen and close to the TV. Great place for a inexpensive and delicious bite. SOOOO glad they opened up as the Marina/Cow Hollow  was in desperate need for a good Mexican joint!

My only suggestion is for them to work on creating a more flavorful/spicy salsa or red taco sauce. I like the green salsa but the others I thought were just OK.

I will be back soon to pay off my debt and eat lots and lots of tacos and such!
author: Ali K.

description:
Finally a top quality burrito spot in the Marina.  Very reasonable prices and friendly staff. 

Pros - Tecate tall boys and fish tacos, all served fresh and with a smile.
Con - No foot rests on the tall stool.  Brutal.
author: Daniel H.

description: The carne asada Nick's Way tacos are theeeee best. However, the consistency with which they are made is hit or miss. I particularly like it when they melt cheese in between the crispy inner corn tortilla and the soft outer corn tortilla. If they don't do that, I just toss the outer tortilla and it's a MESS! Ha.
author: Sally M.

description:
Tastes just like my other two favorite Mexican places in SF (Nicks and Tortilla Heights) which is no surprise since it's the same owner. The new england ambiance is also a huge win for this place. Great place for either a quick dinner or if you want to sit, hang, and have some drinks. Points for the water machine: sparkling or still on tap and cold. Seems not exciting but I loved it. 

Still working out the kinks a bit with the staff but definitely a great spot
author: Patti P.

description:
This place is amazingly awesome.  Unbelievable food, fun & friendly staff, great sunny porch, giants day games on the TV and once again Great Mexican Food!  Get the quesadilla. 

I work up on Union Street and have been twice a week for the last two weeks.  Tacko has quickly become part of the workday lunch routine.  

I read some of the negative reviews and they're pretty crazy.
author: Patrick D.

description: I get the california chicken burrito every time. The preparation and quality are consistent, the habanero salsa is fire, and the staff is great. Green flash IPA on tap is a bonus.
author: Nicholas B.

description: Alright, so it's not authentic Mexican cuisine and you can find far better for cheaper in the Mission. But when you live in the area and you're in the mood for a decent burrito then this is your best bet. My boyfriend and I like The San Francisco burrito -- pinto beans, cheese, rice, sour cream, pico de gallo salsa, guacamole, with your choice of meat. We like it with carne asada. Yum!
author: Sarah Z.

description: Love the mahi mahi taco Nick's Way. The staff are always friendly, food fresh and fast.
author: Marisa L.

description: Great place with pretty awesome California/Baja/North Eastern style.  Took a friend here from Southern California and even he said the fish tacos at Tacko were better than most places down there.  Always order "Nick's way" and you can't go wrong
author: Elliot G.

description: I'm a fan! I can't believe it's taken me this long to stop by, but in a week, I've already been twice.  I like how it's so bright and inviting inside. I've had Nick's tacos and the street tacos. I prefer Nick's tacos as they are more tasty with the soft and hard tacos. I also prefer the carne asada and carnitas over the chicken, which was a little bland for me. Next time, I want to try the quesadillas and salads.
author: Natalie S.

description: Pretty bland and definitely not worth the price. You could make something better at home. Service was ok but if you're looking for cheap Mexican chipotle is a lot better. Wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Nick is back. Well, on the east side again. And its great. Baja/Cali style tackos and just as crispy and mouth watering as ever. Good beer selection and the margs are money. Price is right too. 

Go get you some, people
author: Tripp S.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place.  I figured "Nantucket theme, cool! They probably have awesome lobster, clam chowder, baked schrod..." Then I saw the Mexican secondary theme and thought... "lobster burrito! schrod tacos" ... neat idea.

But it's neither. It really isn't a great Nantucket-style restaurant to start. The lobster roll, while buttery, was teeny tiny and only had claw meat. For nearly 20 bucks, that's ridiculous.  And it was hot. Lobster rolls are suppose to be cold, on a hot buttery toasted bun. That's important. And they got this all wrong.  I didn't even finish it.

The Mexican side of things were pretty tasty, but certainly not going to win in any head-to-head comparisons to a "real" taqueria anywhere nearby.  The burrito was good, but cold.

Also, the fact that they don't take credit cards is ridiculous... especially when you pay that much for one dish.

So, bottom line... this isn't going to be a successful restaurant they way they are doing it now. That being said, I will be happy to update my rating once I see some things change. But for now... I'd pass on this place.
author: Saul F.

description: The only reason this places gets 4 stars is because it gets really expensive really fast. However, the food is fantastic! I could eat 4,000 baja tacos in one sitting. We ordered a the baja taco and a carne asada and chicken taco. All excellent. Not to mention the sandpail filled with margarita. Yummmm.
author: Claire R.

description:
Nick knows tacos and that is just that.

i like the decor, its original and the space feels fresh and welcoming.
I like that he is using organic tortillas as most places dont spend the extra cash and GMO CORN is just freaky.
Fish was fresh and not frozen and staff was friendly.
You want fish tacos, you go to TACK.
author: Kate S.

description: A cool Nantucket-themed burrito spot.  The food is tasty, although it might not be authentically Mexican.  However, the San Francisco burrito is not to be missed.  I also like that they're licensed, which makes it that much more enjoyable to hang out.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I think it is more important the way a mistake is handled then necessarily the mistake itself. 

There was something wrong with my burrito, and they profusely apologized, brought me a new one and returned my money. They could not have handled the situation any better. And my burrito was delicious!
author: Jessica S.

description: I love this place, the food is great, I always get the San Francisco style burrito it's delicious. Great service, the green salsa is fabulous! My only complaint is that as I am waiting in line to place my order I always, always!!! See someone pouring ice to fill around the jars of agua fresca to keep them cold, the problem is that they always pat the ice with their bare Hands (the same hands they use to answer the phone and work at the register) and that Ice falls into the agua fresca... They should just raise the water containers to solve the problem!!!
author: ana g.

description: My go-to taco joint! Their guacamole is exceptional, their carnitas are succulent, their burritos are massive and their "Nicks Way" Tacos are a must!  it's not a traditional Taqueria at all but the quality of the food speaks for itself. The wall of hot sauces and homemade fruit drinks (both virgin and no-no style available) are welcome additions but their homemade salsas/sauces ain't too shabby either. I never get sick of the food here as I have eaten it well over a dozen times and I will be back. A couple tacos and you are golden!
author: G C.

description: great tacos.. definitely better than nick's crispy taco's
author: Kenny S.

description: "Delicious! High quality food. Yummy taco's! Try the corn on the cob! To die for!"
author: Evyan B.

description: I take all my friends to Tacko. Great burrito and taco's for Marina/Cow Hollow locals! Gotta go with the San Francisco Burrito
author: Steve B.

description: Great tacos and a casual vibe. This place is more laid back and less noisy than their sister spot on Polk St but the food is just as good. Great decor and good food!
author: Marie F.

description: A little pricey for what it is but tastes so good that you can't not splurge on it. Everything there is good and I like that they have Bohemia Beer.  Great red roasted salsa in the squeeze bottles on the table.
author: Alex A.

description:
If you're from So Cal, and you're craving a SD-style California burrito, THIS is your place!
Both the Cali and SD burritos are delicious!
author: David L.

description: Great Tacos good for grab and go. Quality is good will come back again for some other items for sure!
author: Corey C.

description: This is Gringo Mexican food at its finest. Tacos and quesadillas here are delicious. Burritos are OK. I recommend the carnitas quesadilla. I think the entire thing is deep fried. Bonus points for sparkling water on tap and a great house salsa. The Nantucket theme is a little weird at first, but there is a back story. Don't let me spoil it. Find out for yourself.
author: Zac H.

description:
BEWARE if you are placing a pick up order via the phone, and referencing the menu on their website - the prices on their menu online are all lower, but when you arrive to pick up your food they will charge you the prices listed on their in-store menu board!

When I told the cashier about this, he had no idea what to do, and there was no manager on site.

Needless to say, I was charged the higher amount.

Even though the price difference from online to in store wasn't drastic, I still think that's some shady sh#t.
author: Dan L.

description:
Tasteless tacos, poor service.

We are frequent diners in the area, and our experiences here have been poor.  The tacos are flavorless--even their specialities--and the beans are often hard and undercooked.  The guacamole tastes like it came out of a can.

For families, the manager is not kid-friendly.  He yells out to the entire restaurant, "no crying babies, no crying babies" multiple times during the meal, which is both annoying to the entire clientele and puts families with kids ill at ease.  In addition, on several occasions I have seen him be rude to kids, both at the register and as he walks around the tables.

Better choices for food would be Tacolicious or Mammacita, both on nearby Chestnut St.
author: C T.

description: The meat is so dry !! Expensive for the quality of the food. I've been here twice in the last two months and both times I have had a horrible stomach ache afterwards.
author: Shakira M.

description: Its the same as nicks on polk but in the marina.  The tacos are crispy, good and big.  I eat two and I am STUFFED! Its never been super busy when I have been so the food comes out quick.
author: Vince C.

description: I have been to many places for an authentic taco street style and Tacko has this down to everything done perfect, not to mention all the ingredients are fresh and all organic. Two steak tacos and a watermelon agua fresca with crushed ice is the way to go. All in all a perfect place for an all around great meal. I look forward in coming back again soon.
author: Robert N.

description:
Screw you, Nick! I ordered the BONELESS CHICKEN TACO!

I am not what one would call a Mexican food connoisseur. I've just started appreciating this kind of fare, unlike my fiancee who could judge a burrito contest. I know that El Farolito is bomb diggity and I know that the quesadilla at Whole Foods is crap, but I cannot really tell the difference most of the time between a quality taco and an "eh" taco. Except for the Tacko taco. This was gross. The cheese may as well have been a string cheese put in the microwave for 30 seconds and the taco shell was soaked with oil. Blech.

Now, this was enough to make me long for Tacolicious, which Nick told my fiancee was "not in competition, because he's trying to do something different." By different, I wonder if he means, "not edible" because the line at Tacolicious was out the door and Tacko was empty. But I digress. When I bit into my soggy pollo taco, I felt something hard against my tooth, and lo and behold, it was a bone. A BONE! When I walked up to the waitress to tell her that I hurt my tooth on said bone her response was, "Oh....I'll tell someone....." Hmm...We sat there for a few more minutes and no one came out to apologize. No one thought to offer our money back, provide us with a boneless chicken taco, or make sure that I still had a tooth. Nothing. Either the waitress got confused walking to the kitchen and chewing gum at the same time or they just have awful customer service. I was so peeved that I decided to call the restaurant and speak to Nick himself. Now, I'm not in the restaurant business, but any intelligent person would think that in this economy and given that Tacko is in competition with a number of Mexican joints within walking distance, that once the manager and owner heard about what had just transpired that he'd want return business and offer some type of compensation. NOPE! When we spoke he was completely apathetic. 

So, all in all, if you want a lackluster taco with a side of toothache, go to Tacko. If not, head to Tacolicious. Oh, and by the way Nick, my tooth still hurts, so if I end up heading to the dentist, you better pray that your business picked up today.
author: Lindsay W.

description:
Nick's Crispy in Cow Hollow?  Yes, please!
Although I was sad to see Kasa go, I am happy that another fave has popped up in its place.  Make sure to get the Carne Asada Tacos, Nick's Way.  And smother it with the green hot sauce, for sure.
author: Robyn S.

description: Call me a butt nugget for giving it one star if you must but it was lousy.  Nick's is still #1.  The idiot staff couldn't make them Nick's way, the prices are higher and the offerings are less than Nick's and the ambiance was plastic.  This place just really soured me.
author: Sin F.

description: I had one tacko Nick's way and one regular.  Maybe because I know that Nick's way adds a boatload of calories in an extra tortilla and cheese, I enjoyed the regular tacko better.  I do love these kind of chips too, but ate sparingly because I know they're greasy.  But hey, if you're eating Mexican you kind of have to pick your calories (a la not going Nick's way so I can eat more Chips!)  Not the most amazing ever but good.  Salsa verde was tasty too. I definitely agree with some other reviews that this is not cheap.  Little pricey for tacos!
author: Andrea R.

description: I just had the worst customer service experience at Tacko, and I couldn't walk up the hill fast enough to write this review. I ordered a Mahi Mahi taco. Being my first time here I didn't realize you needed to say grilled or Baja. I asked if there was white sauce and was told no. When I got my taco it was grilled, and I had wanted the beer battered one. I went to talk to them about it and was immediately met with attitude from Emily. ( she was so rude that I got her name). She didn't offer me the other taco, she told me that for next time I had to say Baja. I stood there in disbelief and finally she gave offered to make me the other taco. When it came out, it had white sauce on it. I went back to Emily, and she  told me that they have already given me two tacos. What?! So, bc you aren't clear, and then give me a sauce I asked not to have, I just have to eat it?! She refused do anything to make it right. I told her I would like to leave and to get my money back. She said fine but went along her business... I finally went to the cashier to explain, and she came up behind him and snipped.. " just give her her money". The sad part was we actually liked the food we did eat, but based on this terrible customer service experience we will never go back. We live close by but we will tell all our friends to also go to tacolicious where you never have to deal with someone as rude as Emily.
author: Leah G.

description: Awesome tacos, and especially tasty burritos.  Never heard of burritos with French fries in them, but they are delicious, if not healthy.  A bit of a wait for take out, order in advance if you can.  Great location just off both Chestnut and Union Streets. The only Mexican food better in the area is probably Mamacitas
author: Frank L.

description:
Location Location Location! It's not authentic duh. But it's not horrible either! It's fresh and tasty. If you want real Mexican, then go to Mission or find a Mexican family to adopt you. Goodness!

I love the street tacos, horchata, sangrias!
author: Lola D.

description: I had a horrible experience with the owner who started yelling at me. With 2 other customers behind me, he asked "would you like that for here or to go". After I responded "to go", he repeatedly insisted I eat it there even thou I had to get back to work. Then he told me they would no longer be serving "to go orders" and told me to not come back if I didn't like it!!
author: Tony G.

description: Going to school in Southern California and tasting countless Mexican restaurants in Santa Ana, San Diego and neighboring cities has definitely raised my standards when it comes to fast food Mexican food.  My girlfriend raves about Taco Tuesdays here and this restaurant actually offers a California burrito (fries inside instead of traditional rice).  I ordered the Carne asada California burrito ($9.75) and she ordered 3 carne asada street tacos ($7.50).  I have not had a California burrito in almost three years and was anxiously awaiting to be taken down memory lane.  Unfortunately, the California burrito was underwhelming and tasted more like fries than anything because there was barely any carne asada present in my burrito.  I was truly disappointed and the fries weren't even good.  My girlfriend's tacos however were above average and I could definitely taste the quality of meat and the meat was seasoned to perfection.  I guess in the Marina district there aren't many eateries available but I wouldn't come here again.
author: Christopher C.

description: This food was really disappointing. My quesadilla was soggy and thick. A quesadilla is meant to be thin and crispy not soggy and full like a burrito. If you're going to charge $8-$9 for one quesadilla then I think you can afford to put a dollop of guacamole on top instead of charging an extra $1.25 for it. My husbands burrito was not great either.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Today was my 3rd visit to Tacko. I loved the asada San Francisco buritto and I also wanted to try the cobb salad. It was awesome. 
This concierge will continue to send his guest to Tacko because of the food. 
I see alot of reviews complianing about the pricing, but I feel this is to be expected in the Marina District.
 By the way, I pretty sure that Nick has not owned Nick's Crispy taco's on polk since 2007 (FYI). Thanks Tacko for bring great mexican food to the neighborhood.
author: Raymond A.

description:
I felt like a flagpole-sitter on the footrest-less bar stool at the communal bar/table.  Seriously, you're perched on this stool with your feet dangling like a 4-year-old.  Unless you're 7 feet tall, you won't be able to rest your feet on the floor while sitting on the stool.  It makes you feel completely ridiculous and physically uncomfortable - not something I'd think a restaurant owner would be going for unless he's trying to encourage customers to order take-out (in which case he's wasting money on a lot of useless square footage and a liquor license).  

Fortunately, there are some tables with picnic-style benches, and I moved over to a table by the wall, where I was much more comfortable.  The decor is interesting and attractive.  I loved the framed 40's "Yachting" magazines on the walls.  

I ordered the fish taco Nick's way, and it was tasty. 

If you're in the neighborhood, give this place a try, but be sure to grab a picnic table if you want to eat in - especially if you're drinking!
author: hotdiggity d.

description:
former Kasa place, guess that didn't do well.
the nick's way crispy baja taco here was good except the crispy taco was also a bit stale tasting.  maybe i'll try the lobster roll next time.
author: Rob C.

description: AMAZING contemporary Mexican food, but the closing at 10 is absurd. If I need my Mexican fix at ~10, I'll be headed to chipotle even though the quality is significantly lower.
author: Alaina U.

description: Yumyum! Got the 3 mexican street tacos w some chips/guacamole. Tasty and good flavor! Agua frescas looked interesting but i did not try. Try here if you are in the mood for mexican. Would go back and check out their burritoes!
author: Alexa L.

description:
I have been to Tacko numerous times since it opened.   The first couple of times the food was great and the service was great.   I took the time to tell friends about it and thought it was a great addition to the neighborhood.

However, I'm giving this 1 star review based on my last three visits.  The quantity and quality was not the same and certainly not up to par.   They have gone down significantly.   I gave it two more chances after a very bad shrimp burrito.   Things got worse....

The worst part is the service.   I have never heard an owner that is so rude to it's customers AND employees.    I witnessed the owner (Nick) scream at his staff and fire someone while I was in the bathroom. Another time I asked him if I could order something on the side, and he replied with no and that if I don't like it I can go somewhere else.    No such reason what so ever for a response like that.   In a city where there are plenty of great food choices, I refuse to go to a place where an owner doesn't appreciate it's customers.     

So so so disappointing.   My only hope in writing this is that Nick takes the advice and changes his tone.
author: Nat S.

description: Horribly greasy!!!  I've had food from taco trucks that is much better and far less expensive.  Save your money, walk 1 block and eat at Taco Bell there is nothing novel at Tacko.
author: Scott C.

description: Definitely decent. Their taco's Nick's Way were great. My salad was really watery, I would hold the tomatoes (canned?) next time and maybe get tuna or chicken but I still liked the atmosphere and food overall.
author: jen n.

description: MMMM grilled fish tacos!! that was good! perfect constancy. Got it Nock's way, and I didn't need to add much to the taco just a hint of lime and it was perfect, well done. Now that i got that out of the way. They have a bucket of Margarita!!! AMAZEFORDAYZ!!! and thats all she wrote..
author: Sean MC E.

description:
Being a fellow local business owner I have tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt, but I refuse to go anymore.  Every time I have gone to this restaurant they mess up the order.  Either forgetting the order completely, adding something or not adding something that I asked for.  For being a "Mexican" restaurant the food takes an extremely long time to make and you really don't get anything that tasty or spectacular.  

Overprice
Long Wait
Messed Up orders

oh yeah....and really tint tables that are near impossible to get into and out of....
author: R Q.

description: They only have a few vegan options but the ones they have are delicious. I wish they would add more vegan options and I really, really wish they offered brown rice. The owner, who works the cash register couldn't be nicer! Great atmosphere!
author: Critic M.

description: Yummy veggie taco, done "Nick's Way" with a hard and soft shell combination. Really good sauce at the tables. Cool decor. Wish it were not cash only ... Nice fast-casual option if I happen to be in the Marina.
author: Jamie T.

description:
This place is good. Especially if you like Nick's Crispy Tacos, because they have the same "Nick's Way" tacos here (just more expensive, duh, it's the Marina.)

Highlight for me is the aguas frescas - particularly the watermelon juice, horchata, and other fresh fruit juices they have. Especially on a sunny day - so refreshing.

Great selection of hot sauces from all over the world, too.
author: Lina L.

description: San Francisco burrito 3 times a week!! Staff is super friendly and the food is SO good. Everything taste very fresh.
author: William T.

description: My favorite lunch taco spot by far. The Black bean and Corn salad with your choice of meat is fantastic. I went with Mahi Mahi and could eat it every day.  The Tacos are perfect, not too big not to small with enough of everything you want in it.  It took me over 3 visits before i tried tacos "nicks way" oh my god are those good.  The staff do seem a bit aloof at times but the food is oh so good. If you stay they have sparking water on tap to enjoy and if you decide to get it to go they give you free chips and salsa!
author: douglas B.

description:
I've never reviewed a restaurant before - but I have to get the word out that this place blows.

1. Carne asada tasted like fish
2. They got my order wrong
3. Super small burrito
4. The dude taking orders was a total kook - talking on his cell while taking orders, talking about how his friend owns a strip club.

There was one person in front of me in line and it took 15 mins to order my food.  The Nantucket thing makes no sense.
Lame.
author: Joe W.

description:
Had their tacos last night for the first time, huge fan of the soft/hard taco shell combo, they don't jip you on the guac which is refreshing!!!

Perfect casual spot for yummy, authentic mexican food.
author: Kellie K.

description: Came across this spot with the boys after a little wine tasting at Fort Mason.  It isn't Nick's Tacos or Tacolicious, but I wouldn't say ignore this place.  You'll get some satisfying burritos and tacos with no short-changing on the guacamole (huge plus) for a good price.  Would I go there again is the question and the answer is if I was just coming from a vintner's showcasing.  Cheers ;)
author: Nick J.

description: I am admittedly a HUGE Nick fan/food stalker.  Crispy Nicky has done it again.  He had a vision of this restaurant and executed it in typical Nick fashion...very tastily!!   I haven't had a chance to try the LOBSTER ROLL yet but it's high on my list.  Nick's tacos are not to be missed.  If there was some way to eat them at every meal, I would.
author: Shanni L.

description: I've never been disappointed by a meal here, yet I wouldn't go as far to say that this is my favorite Mexican place around or something I make as a destination for myself to go to. It's more like: "I have a craving for Mexican, I'm in the Marina and don't want to walk too far" and I end up at Tacko. I don't want to make it sound too mediocre either. They have a great menu and as many hot sauces and salsas as you could possibly want. I'll normally go with a Mahi Mahi baja burrito or the one with french fries and steak, depending on how I am feeling that particular visit. The burritos are not as big as a place like Chipotle, but they are tastier in my opinion. I'm not thrilled about dropping ten bucks for a burrito every time I come in, but such is life in the Marina. The wait times can get long but I don't feel that it presents an issue. I haven't had a chance to sample the tacos yet, but if they are anything like the Nick's style at the Nicks in Nob Hill, then they should be really good.
author: Taylor C.

description:
I'm amazed at how many people are complaining about paying $8 for a burrito at this place. You are correct, there is a slight premium for the cost of one of their burritos due to the location and the money they sank into this place. Having said that, it's a small premium, the food is pretty damn good, and its a very nice spot to lounge and enjoy your food. 

I am no SF burrito rookie- I've eaten at many of the alleged best spots in this city. I was very impressed with the Carne Asada California burrito here at Tacko, which was stuffed with french fries and plenty of melted cheese. I wasn't expecting anything spectacular, but I was pleasantly surprised at how tasty and flavorful this burrito was. Today was my first visit to Tacko, lets hope the rest of the menu holds up as I venture on to other options next time.
author: Tom C.
