description: Good clean preparation with high quality ingredients.  I like the corn and black bean salad with steak.
author: Neo M.

description:
We were very excited to try this place, always looking for great local taco's and our quest for the best guacamole.
Sadly our first visit ended in no food. At 6.30pm on a Friday night, there was one person behind the cash register not taking any orders, two or three polite looking servers standing around not doing much and no one cooking any food. After about 15  minutes waiting in line going nowhere slowly, the guy behind the register said to the folks at the front of the line "it may take a while" ....we walked out.

Seriously, on a Friday night, you need to be able to make taco's in 30 seconds, not 30 minutes.
We do hope that they get their act together as it would be really nice to try the food.
author: White P.

description: Amazing stuff. Being from cape cod the Nantucket theme kinda weirds me out but it seems like an authentic effort. Food is bomb.com
author: Robert J.

description: Overall pretty good.  Owned by the guy who did Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Neat little Nantucket theme and the food is good but I wouldn't say great.  The tortilla soup had really good, fresh ingredients but the broth left something to be desired.  Sangria was okay.  The waitress actually brought it over and told me that another customer said it was too bitter, and she offered to give me a glass from a new batch.  I appreciated her honesty.  Prices are reasonable.  I'd go back if I was in the area and wanted something quicker and more affordable than other nearby options, but if I'm not already in the area, there's nowhere I'd go for Mexican food sooner than I'd go to the Mission.
author: Molly P.

description: Yummy yummy!  One Saturday when the boyfriend and I were wandering around the Marina running some errands, we stumbled upon this place with empty stomachs.  We quickly filled them up with a chicken quesadilla (me) and tacos (him).  The quesadilla was probably one of the best I've ever had---the chicken actually really fresh tasting.  Yeah, I know it's hard to screw up a quesadilla, but rarely does one actually wow me.  Since we totally stuffed ourselves, I was glad to climb the hill back to my place afterward.  We will definitely be back again.
author: Danielle B.

description: Love this place!  Great place to grab a quick bite to eat.  The food is always delicious!
author: Cassie H.

description: Lobster Roll was to die for. Expensive, but worth the price. Carne asada taco was delicious as well, and my dad finished his spicy mahi mahi taco in record time. Beware: cash only, and a long wait in line to order since there is only one register. They also only serve beer, sangria, and margartishs' (made with agave wine, not tequila.) No wine or spirits.
author: Alexandra B.

description: Great Cow Hollow addition and best tacos this side of the Mission.  Very welcoming and friendly staff.  Nantucket theme odd for a Mexican restaurant but well done.
author: Niland M.

description:
This was the first place I ate in San Francisco when I first moved here back in January, and I've been back five or six times since.  No matter how crowded it gets, the food comes out quickly, and it is delicious!! The staff is friendly, the decor is fantastic (I'm an east coaster, reminds me of home..), and the food is out of this world.  Any taco done Nick's Way is great, and try the San Diego burrito if you are starving!

Why not a five?

I agree with Martina regarding the "Tacky" credit card signs.  They've dropped it to ten, but it is still a turn off.  Once that goes away they'll get that five they deserve.  Gas stations can get away with signs like that, cool taco shops in fun neighborhoods? Not so much.
author: Ethan H.

description: What's up with all these complaints about it being cash only? Instead of dragging down the rating of this tasty spot, how about you just open a free bank account from any of the number of banks who reimburse ATM fees and quit yer whining. There's an ATM on site if your wallet needs a refill. My rating is based on the food and service. The taco and chips and salsa were fresh and flavorful. The chips at the bottom of my basket were a little soggy but that's okay because the tomatoes were freshly diced for sure. Nick took my order this afternoon personally and he's a really friendly guy. Sidewalk seating, sparkling water on tap. Would come back here for lunch anytime. Will definitely recommend to friends and coworkers.
author: aaron f.

description: Good Food.  Chicken Taco is moist and flavorful.  Sampler taco plate allows us to indulge in different items.  The meat in the taco could be softer, was a little tough. Took a star away because the owner needs to tone down the volume when interacting with his employees, reprimanding them in public seemed tough on them and embarrassing.  Please and Thank You go a long way to boost moral and business.
author: T W.

description: Big fan of this neighborhood spot.  Great food, always easy to get a table, cheap prices!  If only they has margaritas!  Big fan of chicken taco nicks way (all white meat!), grilled corn and tortilla soup.  Yum.
author: Anna V.

description: Tacko is very good. It's fresh Mexican food at an affordable price. It's the same owner as nicks crispy tacos so if you like them, you'll love tacko.  Also, the name comes from the Nantucket airport code. They were supposed to open it there but ended up opening here in sf. There's your fun fact of the day!
author: Tami G.

description: Really good mahi fish tacos. A bit on the spicy side, but great slaw to balance it out, and good serving size. Their salsas are really good too.
author: Vijay M.

description: I went in to Tacko for lunch today and it was as good has expected.  I orders the chips  and they were fresh and crunchy.  The fish taco, Nick's Way was excellent.  Full and tasty.  I really like the self -service water machine.  You can have your water with bubbles or no bubbles.  I chose bubbles and it was perfect.  I definitely will return.  The restaurant was very open and clean.  The staff seemed attentive to all customers needs.
author: Vinn C.

description: Finally, a mexican spot with that's not as expensive as Mamacita, but very good.  Always fresh ingredients, and the San Diego burrito with no rice or beans is great
author: Jesse K.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood!! We finally have a great taco spot... If you have ever been to Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk and loved it... You will love this place because it has something that that place doesn't...Nick! It was great to meet the original Nick and it was even greater to have one (two) of signature tacos right here in the Marina... Loved it! Thank you!!
author: Paul B.

description: Checked out Tacko for dinner last Saturday night and was pleasantly surprised. Other than being cash only (with an ATM that charges $1 - plus whatever your bank charges) I had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and offered to let my friend and I sample both sangrias when we were debating which to try. They also threw in free chips and pico which were really tasty. I had the corn and black bean salad... it was awesome. A great, light limey dressing and all of my favorite mexican toppings, including cotija cheese. For all you hot sauce junkies out there, definitely check out this place... they have a whole wall of different hot sauces for adding a kick to your order. Seating is very casual and there were a lot of empty tables. Great experience and can't wait to go back!
author: Gina C.

description: Took forever for a take out order. Tiniest taco's I've seen.
author: Luis C.

description:
The best thing about this place might be the location and the habanero salsa. I've been several times, and will likely continue to go, if only because Tacko is one of the only Mexican places my wife really loves.

My biggest complaint is the meat quality. I've had the carnitas, and it's pretty bland but better than the chicken, which is terrible. I've mistakenly ordered the chicken many times, forgetting that it's not grilled chicken, but stewed. That makes for a grossly wet burrito that is borderline inedibly liquidy. The fish tacos are fine.. nothing to write home about. 

It's quicker than nearby Mexican places, but if you're not on a time crunch, I'd avoid Tacko. The only reason I'm giving it a second star is because they have Cali burritos, which isn't super common.
author: Brad R.

description: This place is fine if you want watered down Mexican food in an environment that tries to pass itself off as an east coast seafood shack. Never mind that the menu only has a few seafood items and the rest are meat and veggie options. I honestly don't get it. I will say the space is nicely done but that's not a reason to, or in my case, go back.
author: david s.

description: I wouldn't go back.  They only accept cash and the owner yells at his employees in front of everyone.
author: Ammala B.

description: Ummmmmmmm. This is some good fancy tacos!! Funny, when I lived in Boston I couldn't find Mexican food this good. But I live in San Fran , and a taco shop screaming with new England pride, specifically nantuckett and Fugawi, I find awesome tacos! Not near the real deal lobster Rolls, but the tacos are good.
author: John S.

description: Hmmmm. I ordered what I normally order from NICK's and it just wasn't the same. (Pescado Burrito on wheat tortilla) It was actually a little more bland. may be I caught them on an off day- I went right after they officially Re-Opened after the chaos. I live in the neighborhood so I will give it one more try, probably. But if it misses again, I will probably just stick with the original Flava at Nick's a few minutes from there...
author: Tara M.

description: My first time here. I was pleasantly greeted by the Sara at the front window. She recommended some great choices and the margaritas where blended perfectly. Staff is friendly and helpful. We will be back for more!
author: Oliver K.

description: As much as I liked Kasa I'm so happy that it's been replaced by Tacko.  It's the perfect post-bar meal and the self-serve water and salsa are fantastic.  It is a bit hard to find seating at times but the carnitas tacos are worth the stress.  (About $5/taco.)
author: Krystle S.

description: Food is fantastic but MAN this place is slow.  I honestly can't imagine why the service was so slow.  I guess the place hasn't been open all that long but somehow the cashier really could not get it together and get folks through the line.
author: Matt S.

description: This place was highly recommended to me by some of my friends that used to live in so cal but now live in San Francisco. Their carne asada California burrito was delicious, the carne asada was the best I've had in the city and reminds me of some of my favorite places in LA and San Diego.  Their red sauce is great as well.  I do find their Nantucket decor a little funny.  I will definitely be back.
author: Phil K.

description: Margaritas in sand pail are awesome. Food is reasonably priced. Venue is clean. Food is awesome.
author: Ben N.

description: I wasn't sure what to make of a Northeastern theme taco place.   It is San Francisco, and we have the Mission.    However, if you live in the Marina or Cow Hollow, this is the best place to get tacos.   I have often visited Tacolicious, but this place best it easily.   First, the tacos are better.   Second, you don't have to wait 30 to 40 minutes before you are seated.   I had great beer battered fish taco, mahi-mahi taco, and horchata.   Maybe, I should have given this place a bad review so I don't have to share this place with the rest of the yelp world.
author: Asit P.

description: Like the ambiance but chips were cold and tacos, although still better than most out there, not quite as good as nicks (maybe because shells were cold?) Ambiance much better than nicks/rouge tho. Friendly staff too.
author: Katherine L.

description: Don't miss the chips and guac, I may make a meal of that next time . Tacos were very tasty. Sparking water for free was a nice touch.
author: Drew H.

description:
just hit up tacko in one of their first few days, and the food is very much like what you can expect from nick's (which is great).  but, i don't know if it was the fact that they had just recently opened, but there was a girl taking beer/drink orders WHILE WE WERE IN LINE TO ORDER.  automatic points there.  i also got to meet nick cuz he was running around the joint working, but stopped to introduce himself to some customers, including me.

i'll now have a dilemma when choosing between nicks and tacko.
author: dan a.

description: First try. I had the lobster roll. It was quite good and I would get it again but be advised that it is not large.  I also had the mahi taco and it had a very generous portion of well prepared mahi.  The have a nice India pale ale on tap hurrah!  The place can become a bit of a scene evenings which I think is fun, provided that you are in the mood.  I did not try any spicy Mexican dishes because that is not my taste.
author: Art A.

description:
Tasty! 

I got the carne asada Nick's way tacos and my friend got a burrito. That with chips and some salsa made for a nice beak from the usual, and it wasn't too pricey. I'll definitely be going back!
author: Jade N.

description: Amazing mexican....fresh and tasty and a great prices.  Lobster roll is really good.
author: John C.

description: I have been to Tacko a few times and every time has been pretty good. Decent prices for the food. I recommend the carne asada and carnitas tacos. I'm still trying to figure out the pollo (chicken) taco. There is a thick gravy like sauce that does nothing other than gross me out and confuse me on what I'm eating. But all in all, ok for American- Mexican tacos.
author: Honest Y.

description: This is one of my favorite fast and casual restaurants in the area! You order and pay at the counter before taking a seat, and a server will bring your meal. It's popular with the 20s crowd, but I've definitely seen lots of families here, too.
author: J K.

description: Definitely not authentically Mexican, but it's not supposed to be. I love this place and Nick's because they've perfected Tex Mex. Everything from the soft shell/hard shell combo to the shape of the taco is spot on.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I had lunch here with Mr. on Saturday. We were inspired by good reviews, and overall it was a satisfactory experience. I had the street-style tacos. All three were on the greasy side (sizable pool of oil in the basket afterwards) and the chicken taco was kind of bland. On the up side, the staff was nice and efficient, and the place was clean. I do find the Nantucket/Taco mix a little confusing, though. (I read the history on the wall - still feels like a confused dining setting.) I might go back if I were looking for lunch in the area.
author: Lala K.

description: I grew up in Texas, so I've had a lifetime of (Americanized) Mexican food. Tacko did not disappoint. I ordered a Carne asada quesadilla with suiza and chips & salsa. The quesadilla was generously-sized and delicious. The chips were a bit thick for my liking and the salsa could be better described as a mild pico de gallo. My friends had tacos and burritos and enjoyed their food as well.
author: Preston D.

description:
Lets keep this short and sweet.  This is exactly what this neighborhood needs, and exactly what my gut doesn't.  

I will be a regular.  

Start with the Nick's Way tacos!!!!
author: Dustin W.

description: It was good. It is not a Mexican taco shop, it is an American taco shop. What I liked: the food was clean, and had familiar flavors. What I didn't like: they aren't very creative and don't allow substitutions. Also, they are cash only (at least for now). But the service was good - everyone was really smiley and helpful, so perhaps they've been reading the early reviews here and took it to heart?!
author: Carrie L.

description:
If i had written this review the week that Tacko opened, it would most likely be one start lower since they were still working their kinks out. I decided to wait and give it another try since a lot of restaurants deal with these types of problems.

Initially, I was pretty upset with the closing of Kasa since i live half a block away from the spot. When Tacko opened, we were pretty stoked. Everyone raves about the tacos, and don't get me wrong they are amazing, but i LOVE the quesadillas. I've had the carne asada one and the plain poco queso. Both times I had it done suiza style (on the side since i only like dipping it in the guac). They are a must try.

Last week we went in on a Friday night. Unfortunately the line was still moving slower than i would prefer, but much faster than when they first opened. I think they need one extra person back there to bag the chips ect. While we were in line, Nick the owner started chatting with us(4 girls) and gave us a margarita pail, as well as a modelo for the one guy with us. He also then came and checked on our table while we were eating. The amazing food and service made up for a extra minutes we waited in line to order.

If you are in the area, be sure to pop in. Tacko will definitely become a staple for my friends and I here in the neighborhood.
author: Mona A.

description: The grilled fish taco was dry with little flavor. The veggie taco was really good.
author: Taylor N.

description:
I can't believe how good the food here is!! Whether you have a burrito or a taco, the quality is Sky High! Everything is very reasonably priced, HOWEVER, it's only cash so stop by an ATM on the way there to avoid the service charge at the ATM in store. 

Beyond the taco/burrito, the Elote rocks! perfectly sweet and spicy! Yum :p
author: Jon V.

description: i've eaten here a few times and i'm totally a fan of nicks crispy tacos. unless there's a party being hosted in there, it's super easy to get in, always a fair amount of open seats. it's the typical order at the counter deal. the food comes in pretty large portions and tastes pretty damn good. my favorite is just a chicken taco nicks way. for the hubby and i to eat it's usually over $20, sometimes it can feel a bit over-priced (hence the 4 stars)...BUT the food is tasty, comes out fast, their chips are bomb, and their salsas are awesome too! you get what you pay for, and when i'm in the mood it's totally worth it. i definitely recommend this place!
author: Nancy H.

description: Rude owner and smallest lobster roll ever!!! As other reviewers have confirmed, Nick yells at customers...Lobster rolls priced at $18 are served with one tablespoon of lobster in between two pieces of focaccia  (1 inch by 2 inches)... No joke. He must be using the profit to pay for his anger meds. Other reviewers are spot on with comments on his temper. Bring your cash since no cards are accepted...
author: Palmetto C.

description: Decent quesadilla. I have had much better, but also much worse. I have a feeling tacos or a burrito may be the correct play here.
author: Scoot S.

description: Couldn't wait to try the lobster rolls at Tacko...my understanding is Nick has some east cost knowledge.... Nantucket... and thought he would be putting together a brilliant lobster roll....being a native Californian I have little to compare them to...Big disappointment....at $18.00 a roll and all it consists of is some lobster on  a grilled  buttery hot dog bun....no mayonnaise or tarragon or a shot of dill   It was gross and a total disappointment served with a bag of cape cod chips,,,how nostalgic
author: ED O.

description: This review is for staff attitude only, I left before ordering.  Walked up to the counter and a staff member walks up (he was in the dining room, not behind the counter) and asks if I am eating here or to go (I said here).  He tells me not to order a burrito (which I was going to order).  I ask if the burrito is bad, he says no but would only order if I was getting it to go.  I stated I wanted a burrito after which he said "well you can order what you want but the name of the place is Tacko so I would THINK you would want to order a taco".  After another minute of waiting for someone to take my order I left (which I was planning to do anyway).  Told the bartender down the street about my experience and he said he had heard numerous similar stories about this place.
author: Karl M.

description: Baja tacos and skinny guacamole are so good! California burrito is also delicious! And sparkling water for free on tap is a fun bonus. Nice outdoor seating and plenty of indoor seating. I'll definitely go here again!
author: Kelsey G.

description: Yummy!  Yummy!  Yummy!  Daniel and I have been looking forward to trying this new place out for awhile.  The first time we tried, the place was closed randomly.  The second time, we tried to go on a Monday night.  I guess we missed the memo that they are closed on Mondays!  DUH!  Anyways...we loved it!  Everything from the food to the decor to the atmosphere.  Even though it's a mexican restaurant, it is decorated in a Nantucket nautical theme which is kind of interesting, but needless to say I can't resist either...nautical stuff or mexican food.  I ordered the Carne Asada Quesadillas and my, oh, my...they were DELISH!!  The way the cooks prepare the tortilla makes it flaky almost like Phyllo dough.  Daniel ordered the California Burrito which has french fries rolled inside.  He felt it was pretty good and the french fries made an interesting combo.  He did like their HUGE variety of hot sauces.  Made for interesting decor...We will definitely eat here again...just not on Mondays! :)
author: Tara P.

description: awful.  expensive terrible customer service, manager had no clue and lost 5 customers for life.
author: Brian D.

description: Food is awesome and Nick has rectified many of the service issues.  I will say there is still a speed issue --sometimes the person working the counter is also pouring drinks and expediting food while moving at a glacial pace-- it took 30 minutes to just order food.
author: Chris H.

description: I like it but I don't love it.  The pescado fried taco at TacoBar in Pacific Heights is farrrrrr better.  Less mushy, more crispy, better flavors.  This place is still good though!!  I just hope they visit TacoBar and makes some tweaks to the recipe here.
author: Christin A.

description: While the food is okay, the owner is arrogant and insulting.  When I asked why they didn't carry diet drinks, he said in a rather insulting way, "I serve what I want to serve here.  If you don't like it, you don't have to eat here."  Even though it's right around the corner from me, I won't.!!! If you do, I suggest that you don't ask about diet drinks.
author: Bob K.

description: Just has a great dinner at Tacko. Good prices, fresh ingredients, delicious food. Just wish they had wine.
author: C B.

description: I love the nick's way carne asada tacos. Good cheese on a huge corn tortilla taco with a healthy amount of guacamole, beans, steak and salsa. That's pretty much all I get and it  hit's the spot.
author: Spencer M.

description: Not to be missed. Nick has done it again. Food is fantastic and atmosphere is great. Sit in the back under the skylights!
author: Hil P.

description: zomg the san francisco burrito and the tacos are amazo-licious.
author: Angela P.

description: Their posole is addicting and I could eat it every day. The new guy at the cash register is super nice. The pork tacos are amazing.
author: Kari G.

description: Um, SO good!  Finally a damn good taco place in my hood.  I just ate two fish tacos that were so good it made my eyes cross.  I love the multiple choices of aguas fescas.  I don't love the traditional containers they're stored in though.  Super cute and all, but not very hygienic.  As I got to the bottom of my cantaloupe fresca there was a black hair glaring at me.  I'm blonde, so I know it wasn't mine.  Gross.  Dying to try the lobster roll sans mayo.  What genius came up with the idea to make it with BUTTER?!?! Brilliant.
author: Danielle B.

description: Great food! Great owner! The tacos are amazing, but I'm also a huge fan of the quesadillas. Nick is friendly and I definitely suggest asking him about the back story. Overall enjoyable place to eat with a fun atmosphere.
author: Alana W.

description: The concept of a Nantucket taco bar is ridiculous to me but the truth is that they deliver a fine taco.  The food tastes fresh and their drink selection is good.  The location is clean, the service is quick and very friendly and the atmosphere is pleasant to either eat alone or bring a group.
author: Glen R.

description: i've only had the tacos here-- nick's way every time.  outstanding guacamole and quite the inventive agave wine margaritas.  It's a great place to go with a group if you want something quick and tasty.  haven't had the lobster roll yet, but seeing as the reviewers give it rave reviews, guess i have been missing out.  lobster roll and marg next...
author: m l.

description: The food is very good, but the portions are on the small side. The service is friendly, but a little forgetful. The prices are reasonable. The decor is silly, but whatever; it has no bearing on the food. Chairs with real backs would be appreciated, rather than the picnic tables. I usually go very early in the evening, when there's no line whatsoever, and the kitchen is still slow. The music is way too loud when the place is empty. The three stars are for the owner, who is aggressively obnoxious. It would be better if he either didn't interact with customers or toned it down. Fine Mexican food, but it's not a substitute for Andale.
author: R M.

description: I've gone to Tacko three times now. The food is ok but you can find much better three blocks over in the Marina. My first impression wasn't that bad. The restaurant it's self is adorable and they have a pretty large menu however there is no way I'm going back after my last visit on Sunday night. I called in an order for pick up and when I arrived they had messed it up. I asked the girl working the counter (who had also taken the phone order) to have the order corrected. She then rolled her eyes told me it was already made and actually told me they weren't going to fix it. I was a little baffled but insisted as I had already paid for it. She then went back into the kitchen and said something rude to the cooks who seemed to have less of a problem fixing her mistake then she did. It was so uncomfortable that I ended up apologizing for 'being a pain' only to have her look at me and walk away. She acted so unprofessionally that I was almost embarrassed for her. I'm not going back because of my experience. She seemed pretty comfortable with her attitude which gave me the impression that this is an establishment where management sides with that kind of behavior in their staff. I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.
author: Emily A.
